loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en: Carmelina is 58 years old, married and the mother of four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to use when raising her livestock. She has been in the pig-raising business for five years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 61 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works by raising pigs in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to use for her livestock. Rosalinda has been in this business for ten years and also earns additional income by running a general store. She is working tirelessly to attain of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married with five children. With four of her children currently in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like chocolate drinks, cereals, soft-drinks, noodles, detergent, soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. to sell. Elizabeth has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like chocolate drinks, cereals, soft drinks, noodles, detergent, soap, shampoo, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Annam

texts.en:
Annam is 28 and her husband is a young and energetic person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of a baby boy and they live near his clothing shop. This clothing shop is the only source of income for his family. For this reason, he devotes all his all efforts and time to the garment shop. 
His shop is situated under the clothing market and there is a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price. This competition becomes the cause of low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delightful colors of clothing for his shop so that he can maintain the rate of sales.

Now the major problem is that the summer season is going on and he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy clothing related to the current season. 
Therefore, Annam has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be empowered to buy summer season's clothing.

She hopes that her husband will purchase clothing according to his desire at the right time so he can cope with the market competition and could grow his income as well. She thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: to buy summer season's clothing for her husband's clothing shop.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda, 45, is married and a mother of three children. She works hard to help support her family by providing tailoring services to her neighbors and the local community. She has been a seamstress for many years and knows stitching techniques very well. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her in her business, Fareeda has applied for a 45,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf to buy such items as spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to help speed up her production. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy such items as spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons, etc.

loans.name: Saon's Group

texts.en:
Saon is a 48-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in a rural area of Kampong Thom province. For 20 years, she has been growing rice and pigs-raising to support her family. Her rice did not grow well this year and she is able to sell it in the lower price than before. 

Saon is requesting a loan with VisonFund (Kiva’s partner) in order to build a decent latrine to upgrade her family’s living. This is will be the first loan cycle for her and her member with VisionFund. She hopes that she can improve her family's living and having better health through this loan.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to upgrade her family’s living.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 58 años de edad y es separada,  tiene dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Viven en  la casa de una hija
Doña Martha  aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Tiene una ayudante de costura.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, cierres y otros materiales para la costura. Está en el grupo de crédito ya por 8 años, le gustan los intereses bajos y la unión de las socias. Su sueño es tener un taller grande.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular and highly visited heath resort in Ecuador, for its lovely and welcoming beaches, the premier deep-water port in Ecuador and South America.

Martha lives in this place. She is 58 years old, and is separated. She has two adult and independent children. She lives in a daughter's house.

Martha, taking advantage of her knowledge of sewing, established a small sewing shop in her house. There, she works sewing all sorts of women's clothing. Seasonally, she also makes uniforms for institutions, and primary and secondary schools in the area. She works every day from 9:00 am to 10:00 pm and sometimes later when she has an order to finish. She has a sewing assistant.

This new loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, fasteners, and other materials for sewing. She has been in the loan group for 8 years now, and she likes the low interest rates and the closeness of the members. Her dream is to have a larger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, fasteners, and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sell animal and poultry feeds. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are farmers.

Mary will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of animal and poultry feeds. This will enable her to have more stock to sell and hence increase her sales and profits. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of animal and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Eulalia Doris

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Eulalia, tiene  34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 15 y 9 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es taxista
Doña Eulalia es una mujer que le gusta generar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, ella hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo,  fue poco a poco fue aumentando sus ventas y actualmente también vende sabanas, cosméticos y otros productos que  a la vez han ido mejorando su situación económica y familiar, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale cuatro vences por semana en la mañana o en horas de la noche ya que a esta hora es más fresco y puede encontrar a sus clientes  con más facilidad ya sea para vender o cobrar ya que les deja a crédito y cobra cada semana. 
Este crédito es para comprar  ropa, sabanas y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños darles la mejor educación a su hijos.
texts.en:
The Hermano Gregorio loan group meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are highly visited all year round, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Eulalia lives in this place. She is 34 years old, married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 15 and 9, who are students in the secondary school and primary school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Eulalia is a woman who likes to earn her own income and, with this, help her family to get ahead. For 6 years, she has worked selling all sorts of clothing. She increased her sales little by little and currently she also sells sheets, cosmetics, and other products that have also improved her economic and family situation. She sells from door to door, going out four times per week in the morning or at night since those are the cooler times and she can find her customers more easily, whether to sell or collect since she leaves the products on credit and collects weekly.

This loan is to purchase clothing, sheets, and all of what she sells. She has been in the loan group for 3 years and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Connie

texts.en:
Ma. Connie is 48 years old, married and has three children. For the past nine years she has earned a living by fattening and selling pigs in the Philippines. She earns additional income from her motorcycle transport business.

Ma. Connie has applied for a 9,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She is always working tirelessly to save money toward the expansion of her operation.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Phal is 49 years old. To support her family, she grows rice as the main source of income. She also gets extra income via pig raising. In fact, her rice did not have enough water to grow and her pigs got ill.

Phal has been involved in her current businesses for 31 years and she can save her daily income of about 26,900 KHR per day. This is the second loan cycle for Phal with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. With her past loan, her businesses had improved gradually. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seed, pig feed and pay for plowing fees to support both her current businesses and help them to grow well.

She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions through this loan portion.

loans.use: to buy seed, pig feed and pay for plowing fees to support both her current businesses and help them to grow well.

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Roselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a hollow block making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like sand and cement and pay for the laborer's salaries for her hollow block making business.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past single loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like sand and cement and pay the laborer's salaries for her hollow block making business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 47 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ester is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. Ester has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Magda Liliana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Magda, tiene 37 años  de edad, es soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Magda es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y así salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, ella sale a vender ciertos días de la semana en distintos horarios ya que también tiene un local en su casa en la cual vende materiales eléctricos para carros, en este negocio le ayuda la mamá y cuando ella sale a vender su mercadería, la misma que deja a crédito y cobra por semana, ella lleva más de 3 años dedicada al comercio el cual le deja lo necesario para salir adelante y ayudarles a sus padres que lo necesitan mucho.
Este nuevo crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo, materiales eléctricos y repuestos para carros. Lleva 3 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella mejora su negocio.  Sus sueños son seguir mejorando cada vez más.
texts.en:
The Hermano Gregorio loan group meets every two weeks in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are highly visited all year round, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Magda lives in this place. She is 37 years old, single, and lives in her parents' house.

Magda is a very hard-working woman who likes to earn her own income and, so, to get ahead. She works in sales, selling all sorts of clothing. She goes out to sell certain days of the week on specific schedules, since she also has a space in her house where she sells electric parts for cars. Her mother helps her in this business and when she goes out to sell her merchandise. She leaves products on credit and collects weekly. She has been working in sales for more than 3 years, which gives her what she needs to get ahead and to help her parents who need it a lot.

This new loan is to purchase all sorts of clothing, electronic materials, and car parts. She has been in the loan group for 3 years and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she improves her business. Her dream is to continue improving each day.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, electric materials and car parts.

loans.name: Patricia Jessenia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 23 y 8 años que estudian en universidad y escuela. Su esposo es maestro soldador
Doña Patricia  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, artículos de bazar y papelería, ropa, zapatos, entre otras cosas, de a poco ella ha ido surtiendo su tienda para que  sus clientes encuentren todo en su local,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, tiene dos años en su negocio el cual lo mejora cada vez más con los créditos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda va a comprar víveres y artículos de  bazar. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Hermano Gregorio credit group meets every 15 days in the Jocay neighborhood in Manta city, a city known for its beautiful neighborhoods that are visited frequently throughout the year and for being a beautiful city popular with tourists.

This is where 40 year old Patricia lives. She is in a civil union and has two children ages 23 and 8 years old, both attend school. Her husband is a master welder. Patricia has a store where she sells household goods and groceries such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables, meat, household goods, paper goods, clothing, shoes and other items. Little by little she has been stocking her store for her customers so that they may find what they need at her store. She works every day from 6 AM until 8 PM, sometimes even later. She has had this business for 2 years and it continues to improve with each loan.

This loan will be used to better stock her store by buying groceries and household goods. She is a founding member of the credit group and she enjoys the help the institution provides. Her dreams are to provide the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy household goods and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Margret sells soft drinks at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last nine years. She works seven days a week. 

Margret has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy crates of soda, passion fruits, and pineapples for making juice. Her major business challenges include electricity and the perishability of her products. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a bigger fridge to serve her customers better. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, passion fruits, and pineapples for making juice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fresh fish which will then be resold

loans.name: Teltaba Group

texts.fr: Kalizèta, agée de 30 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants. Vendeuse de jus depuis 2 ans. Elle vend son jus dans une zone ou la route est très emprunter, son jus bien faite, son respect de sa clientèle, sa propriété et le goût particulier propre à elle, toutes ses qualités sont pour elle un atout pour faire marcher son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter le sucre 4 sac à 90 000, 15 000 de bissap 2 sacs, lait à 125 000, l’eau 25 000 f et le reste dans les autres ingrédients (arome, mil etc…) à 45 000f. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Kalizèta, aged 30, is married and the mother of two children. She has been selling juice for two years. She sells it in an area where a lot of people use the road. Her juice is well-made and her respect for her clientele, her cleanliness, and the special taste she creates--all these qualities are essential in making her business a success.

Kalizèta is asking for the loan to buy 4 sacks of sugar at 90,000 francs, hibiscus flowers for 15,000 francs, 2 sacks of milk for 125,000 francs, and water for 25,000 francs, using the remainder for other ingredients (flavoring, millet, etc.) for 45,000 francs.

She already received a loan and reimbursed it on the due date.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of sugar at 90,000 francs, hibiscus flowers for 15,000 francs, two sacks of milk at 125,000 francs, and water for 25,000 francs, using the remainder for other ingredients (flavoring, millet, etc.) for 45,000 francs.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Andrea, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 5 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chef pastelero y trabaja en un hotel muy importante en la ciudad.
Doña Andrea al igual que su esposo comparte el amor y gusto por la cocina, es así que ella para generar sus propios ingresos también se dedica a la preparación de tortas en muchos sabores y diseños, estos ella los prepara por pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación, ella también en ocasiones con la ayuda de su marido imparten clases de repostería y cocina en su casa, por lo cual cobran una pensión con lo cual se gana algo extra realizando esta labor que a ella le encanta. Lleva 5 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de reposteria  para elabora las tortas y para sus clases. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy buenos para ella. Sus sueños son tener un gran centro de enseñanza.
texts.en:
The Hermano Grego credit group meets every 15 days in the Jocay neighborhood in Manta city, a city known for its beautiful neighborhoods that are visited frequently throughout the year and for being a beautiful city popular with tourists.

This is where 30 year old Andrea lives. She is married and has two children ages 14 and 5, both attend school. Her husband is a pastry chef and works in a very important hotel in the city. Andrea, like her husband, loves to cook. She generates her own income by baking various kinds and designs of cakes. She takes custom orders from her customers. She also helps her husband at times give baking and cooking classes from their home, from which they collect a bit of extra money while doing what she loves.

Andrea has had this business for 5 years and has very good income. This loan will be used to buy baking supplies to make cakes and for her classes. She joined the credit group shortly after it formed, and she enjoys it because the loans are very helpful to her. Her dream is to have a culinary school.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Santos Gilberto

texts.es:
Santos  tiene 35 años de edad. Su finca es de 3 manzanas de las cuales 1.5 ha destinado al cultivo de café, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo. Su producción en los últimos tres ciclos ha llegado hasta a 35 quintales de café pergamino. 

Para este ciclo, Santos está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su plantación de café, lo cual está seguro le ayudará a obtener una mejor producción.

Una de sus metas es mejorar la administración de la finca y reinvertir en ella para que esta sea cada vez más eficiente y heredársela a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is 35 years old. His farm is 3 manzanas (blocks) of which 1.5 is dedicated to growing coffee, which he manages under the criteria of meeting fair trade certification. His production in the last three cycles has been 35 quintales of pergamino coffee. (1 quintal = 100 pounds)

For this cycle, Santos is seeking a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to his coffee plantation, which will ensure that he will be able to have a better production. One of his goals is to improve his farm management and reinvest in the farm so that it continues to become more efficient and be able to leave the farm as an inheritance to his children..

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to his coffee plantation in order to improve production.

loans.name: Miarintsoa Eliane

texts.fr:
Miarintsoa est une jeune femme dynamique et travailleuse de 26 ans. Elle est mariée, et son mari est coiffeur. Ils ont ensemble deux enfants de 2 et 9 ans. 
Comme activité génératrice de revenu, Miarintsoa dirige une boucherie et ceci depuis très long temps  car c'était le métier de ses parents donc elle n'a pas eu de difficulté pour maîtriser l'activité.
Elle demande un prêt pour pouvoir développer l'activité , augmenter les quantités des marchandises à vendre, proposer différentes sortes de viandes afin d'améliorer le revenu familial. 
Son but est d'épargner davantage et de construire sa propre maison un jour et améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Miarintsoa is a dynamic and hard-working young woman of 26 years old. She is married and her husband is a barber. They have two children together, 2 and 9 years old.

As a revenue generating activity, Miarintsoa has been managing a butcher's shop for a very long time. Since it was her parents' profession as well, she didn't have any difficulty mastering the skill.

She is requesting a loan to be able to develop her business, to increase the quantity of products for sale, and to propose other kinds of meat in order to improve her family's revenue.

Her goal is to increase her savings, to build her own house one day, and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy some beef steaks.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: A $1,000 loan offered to Esmeralda to improve her business. She is married and she opened her garden in 2009 with her own $200 capital. She will use this loan to buy shovels, machetes and powder to clean the garden, and sell her harvest from the garden afterwards. She will be able to generate a good income from the sale of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy spades, machetes and powder

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Food vending is highly appreciated in the Philippines. Due to this fact, Gene was enticed to get in touch with this kind of craft. She has been an entrepreneur for 16 fruitful years. She has entered different businesses, including a sari-sari store, which still operates today. She is 42 years old, married to Armando, a tricycle driver, and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Now, Gene and Armando are working with determination to pursue the needs of their family. The income they get from the both the businesses helps them with their daily expenditures. 

However, the profits they get from their here are sometimes insufficient. This is because at times, Gene finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products due to financial incapability. For now, she wants to continue the operation of her food stall business. This is why she is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan, which she will utilize to buy additional products for Food stall. With more recipes displayed, she can achieve a greater increase in her income.

In due time, Gene hopes that she will progress and that her business' sales will go up. Through this, she can earn and save money for a canteen business and a house someday if God will allow. Gene meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her inventory.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Yenny, one of Ruma's agents. She lives in Rembang, which is a regency in the northeastern part of Central Java. She owns a stall that sells women's beauty care products like perfume, lotion, shampoo, etc. as well as medicines and mobile airtime credits for her community.

She decided to join Ruma because she wants to try another business opportunity as well as contribute more to her community. She feels happy because since she joined Ruma, she understands more about how to manage her business.

As the business grows, Yenny needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her village community.

Yenny's goal in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for lower communities--Ruma's latest product, called 'Mapan'--so that later, her community can have access to better products with lower prices.

Yenny is shown in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en: Jesica is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years. She works at the market seven days a week and on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Twezimbe- Nakawa Group

texts.en:
Micheal, 37 years old, is a hardworking man. He has been a member of this group since 2013. He lives with his wife and and his two daughters on the city outskirts. Micheal is an agriculturalist that grows food crops and also rears live stock. Its the money from this income that he uses to pay tuition for his children and also meet other house hold financial obligations. Micheal intends to raise breeding goats, but his savings are not enough for him to invest in the goats. Therefore, he wants to take out a loan for this purpose. He hopes that the loan will help him to invest effectively with high productivity, and that next year, the female goats will produce many small goats. 

(The sixth man, standing at the back, is a member the group who is only saving.)

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Jose Erasmo

texts.es:
José con 64 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. En su finca ha logrado cosechar hasta un máximo de 30 quintales de café pergamino, el cual produce bajo criterios de certificación Comercio Justo.

Para este ciclo, este productor está solicitando un financiamiento para la adquisición de abonos y foliares que le permitan garantizar una mayor calidad de su café. 

Su objetivo en los próximos años, es ir tecnificando su finca y aumentar las áreas de producción en su pequeña finca, ya que considera que este es un rubro rentable, que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old. He lives with his wife and children in a rural community in northern Nicaragua. On his farm he has managed to harvest up to 3000 kilograms of coffee, which he produces under the criteria of fair trade certification.  

For this cycle, he is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers that will ensure a higher quality of coffee.

His goal in the coming years is to improve technology and increase production area of his small farm, as he considers this is a profitable category, allowing him to make more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers that are required for his coffee to ensure a higher quality of production.

loans.name: Zohid

texts.en:
Zohid is a clever boy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996. He is living in a big town with his parents. 

Zohid is an excellent student and earns good marks. He is well known among his friends and other students. His university is in the city far from his house. He is used to spending money for transportation, food and renting a room. His family’s standard of living in normal, and their income is spent on family needs and education. Recently, Zohid's family does not have the money to pay his tuition fees. He applied to IMON, asking to get a loan to pay his higher education costs. He awaits Kiva's support.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for his studies.

loans.name: Malialele

texts.en:
Malialele is 30 year old mother with 3 children. She runs a business of selling fish in her community to earn a living. 

Malialele requested for a loan to buy a fishing net, fishing gear, canoe, torch, container, ice bag, to help her with the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012, and she will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fishing gear, canoe, torch, container, ice bag,

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
To be able to raise her four children, Irene, 32, from Araneta, Quezon City, is very passionate and hardworking. She operates a business of dealing in liquified petroleum gas.  With her affordable items, customers get more for her service. Through this, she earns a living. And what income she gets in her trade is just enough to support the entire household.

Aspiring to grow her business and be successful, Irene wants to ask for a loan worth PHP 22,000 which she will use as an capital for more LPG tanks because her business is LPG dealing business and this her profit here will indeed be a great help for her and for her family in their daily expenses and necessities. 

Your help can mean a lot now to Irene. In advance, we want to thank you for your consideration and unwavering generosity. 

She regularly meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: for acquiring more LPG tanks for her LPG dealing business.

loans.name: Eriberta

texts.en:
Eriberta is encouraged that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which helped maintain her ornamental plant business. Her business means a lot to her since it is a good source of income to cover her family's needs. Although there are days that her sales are low she keeps her faith that God will see her family through. She continues to love and take care of her business.

She trusts that you could again loan her PHP 19,000 which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires and nets that she needs to nourish her ornamental plants. The good weather in Silang is conducive to growing ornamental plants. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her.

Eriberta continues to dream of a better life and be more successful in her ornamental farm. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, pots, nets, screen and plastics for her ornamental plants business.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky, a 45-year-old fish vendor from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, has been in the fish vending business for seven years. Ricky and his wife, Maria Fe, are blessed to have four children, of whom three are already in school: the eldest is in high school and the other two are in elementary. As a fish vendor, Ricky has to wake up as early as 2 a.m. to go to the local fish port to buy a variety of fish. Milkfishes, catfishes, “tilapias”, and “sapsaps” are the fish that he commonly sells. Most of his customers are local residents in their community who eventually became his regular customers.

Because of the demand for his product, most of the time Ricky is able to sell all his products quickly. He is applying for a loan amounting to P18,000. He will use this amount to purchase additional fresh fish products. Aside from the usual fish types he is selling, he will also add other fish types like “tuloy”, “gurayan”, and such for his customers to have a wide array to choose from.

As a hardworking father, it is his goal to continually support his children’s studies until they graduate college. He also shares that becoming rich is one of his ultimate dreams: not only for himself but for his family as well.

Ricky regularly meets with his co-fellowship members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. All CCT Community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh fish which will be sold to the public market.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 45 years old and married with six children and two dependents he takes care of because they are aged.

Godfrey is an agriculturalist who deals in cattle fattening and dairy farming. He owns five cows for milk production and 10 bulls for fattening. He has managed to look after his family, especially paying school fees for his children.

His major challenge is the prolonged dry season which dries all his farm, hence leading to emaciation and eventual death of some of his animals due to hunger and thirst. 

He is applying for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to dig a dam where he can collect water for his animals when such calamity occurs. 

His dream is to own one of the largest farms in his region.

loans.use: to construct a dam for harvesting water.

loans.name: Gratiano

texts.en:
Gratiano is 47 years old and married with eight children and four dependents, including his parents who are old, and orphans. Gratiano is a primary school teacher by profession and also does agriculture on a large scale.

He operates a maize milling machine in his region to help support his family financially. He has managed to pay school fees for his children and also been able to construct a permanent house for his family.

Gratiano’s major challenge is the increase in the standards of living which now makes it hard for him to support the large family he has due to increases in school fees for the school-going children.

He is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy fertilizers for his coffee and banana plantation.

He wants to see all his children attend school and graduate with degrees.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more food items in mama lishe (food vendor) business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina, 55 years old, is married and has 4 children. 

For the past 15 years, she has run tailoring and farming businesses. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund and she will use it to buy a water tank and seeds. 

Sabina will use her profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hope and dream for the future is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and seeds

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 51 years old,married and blessed with seven children;four are still young and three are adults.

Geofrey is an ice cream retailer, a business he has done for a few years and it has been profitable. He has borrowed a loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase ice cream ingredients. 

He hopes that this will help him generate income as well as profits so as to educate his children and plough back to his business.

His hopes and dreams are to educate his children and grow his business further.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream ingredients

loans.name: Ciria Ines

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Hermano Gregorio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Jocay en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ciria, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo mayor  de edad y casado que aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es maestro de una universidad local.
Doña Ciria es una ama de casa que le gusta valerse por sí misma  y así sentirse independiente generando sus propios ingresos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio ella vende ropa de todo tipo, así como también productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 4 años con este negocio el cual lo comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy contenta con los créditos y su negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy buenos y necesarios. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Hermano Gregorio meets every 15 days in the Jocay neighborhood in the city of Manta.This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year and for being a city with an incomparable beauty that has many tourist attractions.

This is where Ciria lives. She is 45 years old, married and has an adult son who is married and still lives at home. Her husband is a professor at a local university. 

Ciria is a housewife who likes to provide for herself and therefore feel independent by generating her own income. In order to do this she makes a living in business. She sells clothing of all types as well as Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She works three days a week for two to three hours a day. She sells her products on credit and charges every eight days. She has had this business for more than four years and started with the first loan she received from the group. She is very pleased with the loans and her business. 

This loan is for the purchase of pants, blouses, t-shirts, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics among other things she sells. She has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because the loans are very good and necessary. Her dream is for her and her family to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Judith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Judith es una de esas mujeres que deja cuerpo y alma por su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos fritos como empanadas, pasteles, palitos de queso, papas rellenas, pero ya que las ventas no alcanzaba a suplir todos los gastos del hogar esta luchadora y aguerrida mujer quiere acudir a la ayuda de personas de buen corazón que se encuentran en cualquier parte del mundo para comprar un carreta y surtido de vegetales y frutas para salir a las calles y vender estos productos en la tarde, ya que en la mañana seguirá con su venta de alimentos.

Todo lo hace por sus dos hijos, pro su familia, por ello está dispuesta a salir todos los días a empujar su carreta, anímate y apóyala con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Judith is one of these women who gives her body and soul for her family. She works selling fried foods such as empanadas, pastries, cheese sticks, and stuffed potatoes, but since the sales weren't enough to cover all of the household expenses, this determined and brave woman wants to get the help from good-hearted people who are found all over the world to purchase a cart and an assortment of vegetables and fruits to go out in the streets and sell these products in the afternoon, since in the morning she will continue with her food sales.

Everything she does is for her two children, for her family, and for this she is set to go out every day to push her cart. Come on, support her with a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cart and an assortment of vegetables and fruits to go out to the streets and sell these products in the afternoon.

loans.name: Pablo Eliezar

texts.es:
invertir en la compra de: laminas, polines y pines para hacer el cambio lo antes posible.
Pablo de 60 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de sus dos hijos de 17 y 7 años de edad por quienes día a día se esmera para bridarles sus estudios. Pablo desde hace un buen tiempo se dedica a trabajar como jornalero y gracias a su esfuerzo y desempeño es como el obtiene los ingresos que le permiten llevar a su hogar todo lo necesario para poder llevar una vida estable, el desea invertir en mejorar su vivienda pero debido a que sus ingresos no le alcanzan para realizarlo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en la compra de: lamina, clavos, pines y madera para poder cambiar el techo de su humilde hogar el cual se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y no le brida la seguridad que él desea brindar a su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo is 60 years old and lives in his own home with his two children, who are 17 and 7 years old and for whom he fights every day to provide an education. Pablo has worked as a day laborer for a long time and, thanks to his effort and hard work, he earns enough money to provide everything necessary for a stable life for his household. 

He would like to invest in his home but, since he does not earn enough money, he has decided to request a loan from FUSAI, which he will invest by purchasing laminate, nails, pins, and wood. He will replace the roof of his humble home, which is in very poor condition and does not provide the security that he would like to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase laminate, nails, pins, and wood in order to replace the roof of his humble home.

loans.name: Las Princesas Del Castillo Group

texts.es:
Originario de una comunidad mexiquense, el grupo Las Princesas del Castillo está integrado por personas muy trabajadoras cuyo único objetivo es aprovechar al máximo las actividades que llevan a cabo. Cabe mencionar que la región es conocida porque sus habitantes se dedican a la cría de ganado y el cultivo del maíz.
   Doña Yolanda se caracteriza por su amabilidad y alegría, vive junto a su esposo Andrés y su hija quien es su orgullo pues actualmente estudia para convertirse un una gran chef. Para poder solventar los estudios de su hija y los gastos del hogar se ha dedicado a la venta de tortillas desde hace más de diez años. Desde muy temprano adquiere los granos de maíz para después molerlos y obtener así la harina con la que obtiene finalmente la masa. 
   Con el propósito de aumentar sus ganancias y alcanzar sus metas, Doña Yolanda comenzó a vender antojitos mexicanos por las tardes; "para mí lo más importante es ayudar a mi hija para que ella termine una carrera profesional, así tendrá una mejor calidad de vida" comentó.
   Por otro lado está muy contenta y agradecida con VFMéxico pues gracias a los préstamos podrá adquirir maíz, papel, gas, elotes, mayonesa, chile, palitos, limones, etc. Es sobresaliente su espíritu emprendedor pues ha logrado que gradualmente sus negocios tengan el éxito esperado. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Tomasa quien invertirá en una tienda de abarrotes; Tomas, en borregos; Alberta, en pollos; Teresa, en plásticos; Angélica, en productos de belleza y Adriana, en una estética.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Yolanda quien viste el pantalón en color rosa*
texts.en:
Hailing from a Mexican community, the group Princesas del Castillo ("Princesses of the Castle") is made up of very hard working people whose sole goal is to make the most of the businesses they have.  The region in which they live is known for its inhabitants who make their living raising livestock and growing corn.

Yolanda is known for her kindness and joy.  She lives with her husband Andrés and her daughter, who is her pride as she is currently studying to become a great chef.  In order to pay for her daughter's schooling and the household expenses, Yolanda has worked selling tortillas for over ten years.  Very early she acquires the dried corn which she then grinds to make the flour, from which she then makes the dough.
 
In order to increase her earnings and reach her goals, Yolanda began to sell Mexican snacks in the afternoon.  "The most important thing to me is to help my daughter so that she can complete her professional studies, and thus obtain a better quality of life," she says.

She is very happy with and thankful for VFMéxico.  With the loan she will be able to purchase dried corn, paper, gas, corn on the cob, mayonnaise, chile, sticks, limes, etc.  Her enterprising spirit is outstanding, as she has managed to gradually gain the success she hoped for for her businesses.
 
The other members of the group are Tomasa who will invest in a grocery store; Tomas in sheep; Alberta in chickens; Teresa in plastic goods; Angélica in beauty products and Adriana in a beauty salon.

The photograph was taken in Yolanda's business.  She is wearing pink pants.

loans.use: to buy corn, paper, gas, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Indelira

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es jubilado, viven en casa propia.
Doña Rosa aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas ya que hay más diseños y con estos aprende aún más, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8h00 hasta las 12h00 y de 14h00 a 18h00 a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar una máquina de coser y materiales para la costura. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande. Tiene en el grupo de crédito 4 ciclos y le gusta la fundación porque los créditos son rápidos.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important and most popular seaside resort in Ecuador, visited because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It is the premier deep-water port in Ecuador and South America.

Rosa, 60, lives in Manta. She's married and has five adult children who are financially independent. Her husband is retired and they live in their own home.

She earns a living making all kinds of clothing for women, men, and children, although she likes to make clothing for women and girls best because there are more styles and she learns even more from them. She works by individual requests. Seasonally she also makes uniforms for institutions and schools in the town.

Taking advantage of her knowledge of tailoring and dressmaking, Rosa set up a small tailor shop in her home. She works from Monday through Saturday from 8 a.m. until 12 noon and 2 to 6 p.m., sometimes later if she has orders to deliver.

She's going to use this new loan to buy a sewing machine and materials for sewing.

Rosa's dream is to have a larger studio. She has been in the group for four loan cycles and she likes the foundation because the loans are quick.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials for sewing

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 39 years old, married to Wilson and they are blessed with 3 children. 

She sells maize,millet,sorghum and beans and the business has been profitable. 

She plans to buy more stock of maize and beans to sell to her customers.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

Her future hopes and dream are to expand her business by selling more cereals and make more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize and beans to sell to her customers

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente, vive con su conyuge y sus hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Pablo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos, gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Pablo espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo, age 42, is married. He lives with his wife and their children in a rural area in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district mainly work in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.

Pablo raises and sells small animals like pigs, chickens, hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others. His business is located at his house. He has five years of experience in the business, and he has very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more animals like pigs, hens, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others. He will also buy balanced feed for the animals. With this Pablo hopes to offer his customers a better product. This will allow him to generate greater earnings, and that will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more animals like pigs, hens, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others, and to buy balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a Babban Gona farmer from Rafin Tabo Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Haruna no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchasing better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Haruna has ambitious plans to harvest 45 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his children.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es: Diana es una joven empresaria que se tomó la determinación de iniciar su almacén misceláneo, para tener una independencia económica y poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Hace seis meses los habitantes de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Madrid en el Departamento de Cundinamarca, gozan del beneficio de contar con un negocio de este formato y poder comprar a precios de oportunidad, útiles de papelería, accesorios, productos para el aseo persona, maquillajes y detalles para toda ocasión.  Como su expectativa a largo plazo es prosperar en su negocio, ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en nuevo surtido y poder ofrecer variedad de productos. Ella vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores de edad y su meta a largo plazo es continuar trabajando por cumplir sus propósitos en su negocio y así ofrecer bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is a young businesswoman who had the determination to open her own general store in order to be financially independent and improve her quality of life. For the past six months, the residents of a neighborhood in the Madrid municipality in the department of Cundinamarca have enjoyed the benefits of her business. They can purchase items like stationery, accessories, personal care products, makeup, and party supplies at good prices. 

Because her long-term goal is for her business to prosper, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, which she will use to invest in new merchandise so that she can offer a variety of products.

She lives with her partner and their two young children. Her goal is to continue working so that she can meet her goals in her business and ensure the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to invest in new merchandise so that she can offer a variety of products.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a divorced man aged 44 and father of  seven children who are 24, 22, 20,18,16,14 and12 years respectively. He lives in a rural setting with his family and two of his children are still attending school. He has a few rentals from which he collects income to meet his family's financial needs. He supplements his income with  agriculture and retail trading.

He started his business in 1990 with the aim of getting money to increase the family's income. He has acquired this loan in order to renovate his rentals.
His clients are fellow residents and his dream is to enlarge his business by building more houses for renting, but his biggest challenge is limited capital.
He describes himself as an honest man. Joseph appears in the photograph with the UGAFODE credit staff(right to left)

loans.use: to renovate his rental properties

loans.name: Marly Arelis

texts.es:
Una guerrera de la zona de Apartadó, así es Arelis, mujer de 41 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos y propietaria de un restaurante en vía de crecimiento.

Inició con su sueño de ser independiente y generar ingresos en el año 2012, guiada por el deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida, aprendió los secretos de la cocina gracias a su madre y ahora usa ese valioso conocimiento para generar recursos.

La zona de Apartadó es un lugar de bajos recursos, los esfuerzos que hacen sus habitantes por salir son gigantes, por ello apoyar a estos empresarios es tan importantes, es mostrarles que no están solos  y que esa aspiración a una mejor vida si es posible si se lo proponen.

Arelis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos como granos, vegetales, verduras, carnes para la preparación de almuerzos, el resto del dinero será destinado a la reparación de la nevera y el refrigerador.
texts.en:
A warrior in the zone of Apartadó -- this is Arelis, a 41-year-old woman, mother of 3 children and owner of a restaurant which is growing.

She began it with her dream of being independent and generating an income, in the year 2012, guided by the desire to improve her quality of life. She learned the secrets of cooking thanks to her mother and now she uses this valuable knowledge to generate income. 

The zone of Apartadó is a place with limited resources; the efforts that the people make to get ahead are gigantic. So, to support these business people is very important, to show them they aren't alone and that this aspiration for a better life is possible if they decide to do it. 

Arelis wants to ask for a loan to purchase supplies such as grains, vegetables, and meat to prepare the lunches. The rest of the money will be used to repair the freezer and refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as grains, vegetables, and meat to prepare lunches.

loans.name: Diani Luz

texts.es:
Diani es una mujer cabeza de familia de 27 años de edad, residente de la zona de Chigorodó Antioquía, que guiada por la necesidad económica y los conocimientos en belleza que aprendió de un vecino monto un negocio que se podría denominar sala de belleza, ya que oferta los mismos servicios pero no posee la infraestructura, principalmente por falta de capital.

Lo que más ama Diani son sus dos hijos, dos varones de 10 y 12 años, ella busca que estos tengan un futuro prometedor, que nunca pasen necesidades y siempre tengan el estómago lleno.

Pero Diani no solo se quiere conformar con mejorar las condiciones en la vivienda, aspira en un futuro dejar de pagar arriendo y vivir bajo un techo propio.

Ya que la principal dificultad que atraviesa Diani para tener un salón de belleza con infraestructura es económica, quiere solicitar un crédito el cual puede ir pagando pro cuotas, para comprar una silla de motilar, implementos como peinillas, secadores, tijeras, máquina de motilar.

Este préstamo será un enorme impulso para su actividad y de seguro con estas nuevas herramientas logrará captar la atención de un buen número de clientes.
texts.en:
Diani is a female head of household, 27 years old, who lives in the zone of Chigorodó Antioquía and who, guided by economic necessity and knowledge of beauty that she learned from a neighbor, established a business that could be called a beauty salon, since it offers the same services but doesn't have the infrastructure, primarily due to the lack of capital. 

What Diani loves most is her two children, two boys ages 10 and 12. She seeks for them to have a promising future, that they never want for anything and always have a full stomach. 

But Diani doesn't want to just settle with improving the conditions in her home, she aspires in the future to stop paying rent and to live under her own roof. 

Since the primary difficulty that Diani faces in order to have a beauty salon with infrastructure is economic, she wants to ask for a loan which can pay for costs to purchase a barber's chair, and tools such as combs, hair dryers, scissors, and clippers. 

This loan will be an enormous boost for her business and surely with these new tools, she will manage to attract the attention of a good number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase a barber's chair, tools such as combs, hair dryers, scissors and hair clippers.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José Joaquín es un pequeño productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. En su pequeña finca de 11.2 hectáreas cultiva café, granos básicos y malanga. El café que produce en un área de 3.5 hectáreas está certificado por Comercio Justo.

Su meta es incrementar su producción este ciclo, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le permitan asegurar el manejo adecuado a su plantación de café. José está seguro de que la mejor manera de salir adelante es trabajando y produciendo con calidad, lo cual continuará realizando para brindarle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José Joaquín is a small coffee producer from the northern region of Nicaragua. His farm of 11.2 hectares (about 27.5 acres) is planted with coffee, basic grains and malanga (a root vegetable). The coffee covers 3.5 hectares (approx. 8.5 acres) and is Fair Trade certified. 

His goal is to increase his production this growing cycle, so he is asking for financing to buy fertilizers and manure which will allow him to take proper care of his coffee plants. Jose is sure that the best way to get ahead is by working and producing quality products. He will continue to do this so he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plants to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Santiago De Jesus

texts.es: Santiago de 50 años de edad vive en casa humilde pero de su propiedad  con su compañera de vida con quien lleva muchos años juntos. Él es un hombre trabajador y carismático que se dedica a la venta de minutas de una diversidad de sabores, venta que realiza en su comunidad, barrios y colonias de su municipio, es gracias a su trabajo como  ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y a mantener además la economía de su hogar. Santiago con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar a FUSAI un crédito el cual le permita invertir en la compra  de materiales como: cemento, arena, grava, lamina, polines y además pagar mano de obra para de esta manera ampliar la galera y encementar el área del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Santiago, 50 years old, lives in a house which is humble but which he owns with his life partner with whom he has been for many years. He is a hard-working and charismatic man who works selling shaved ice in a variety of flavors. He makes his sales in his community and in the neighborhoods and communities of his municipality. Thanks to his work, he has managed to get ahead with his family and has also supported the household economy. Santiago, the the goal of improving his living conditions, has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan which will allow him to invest in the purchase of materials such as cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, beams, and in addition to pay labor costs so that he can expand his enclosure and cement the outdoor walkway of his house.  in this way

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, beams, and in addition to pay labor costs so that he can expand his enclosure and cement the outdoor walkway of his house.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is grateful and encouraged for the financial help which she has fully paid on time. It was a big help to expand her store and has increased her earnings. Her general store is her main source of income to support her family's needs. The only difficulty she faces in her business is when the island is hit by typhoons but Violeta continues to be positive that with God's grace her store's sales will eventually pick up.

She is hoping that she can avail of a Php 35000 loan to continue to infuse and fill and her store with more grocery items like rice, instant noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, sugar and toiletries. It will be a big help to maintain her store and better serve her community.   

Violeta's simple dream is that her store will someday be a big grocery store. She desires her child to get a College Education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman and owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mlongo has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Asha operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Meris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Querer salir adelante, mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar, como poner un piso en cerámica, tener su hogar construido en material (concreto, adobes), son los sueños, las esperanzas, el gran deseo de esta humilde mujer llamada Meris, quien a sus 62 años de edad, le pidió ayudo a su hija para que le enseñara a comerciar productos por medio de catálogos.

Meris Inicio el negocio en el año 2012, desde entonces ha puesto todo su empeño en generar recursos para alcanzar sus sueños y aunque parezca poco, lo muebles que tiene en su hogar los ha conseguido gracias a su profesión y esto la llena de motivación para seguir adelante y creer que cumplir su sueño si es posible.

Solo con el objetivo de progresar, ella desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y compra de mercancía de productos de uso personal, maquilla y accesorios.
texts.en:
Wanting to get ahead, improve the infrastructure of her home, such as installing a tile floor, and having a home built of better material (concrete, adobe), are the dreams, the hopes and the great desire of this humble woman named Meris who, at 62 years old, asked her daughter for help to show her how to sell products through catalogs. 

Maris began the business in 2012, and since then has put all her determination into generating resources to achieve her dreams and, though they seem few, the furniture that she has in her house she has gotten thanks to her profession and she is full of motivation to get ahead and believes that realizing her dream is possible. 

Just with the objective to progress, she wants to ask for a loan to purchase a display case to show her products and to purchase merchandise of personal care products, make up and accessories.

loans.use: to purchase a display case to show her products and purchase merchandise of personal care products, make up and accessories.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Zawadi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zawadi has operated a paraffin-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase more paraffin to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase more paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Maria Alix

texts.es:
Sonreír es una de las principales cualidades de María, esta luchadora mujer de 37 años de edad, con perseverancia, empuje, sueños, ilusiones, montó un negocio de confección de línea propia, pero no se quedó solo con máquinas, conforme pasada el tiempo compro una mesa de corte y ahora todo el proceso lo realiza desde su propio negocio.
Hablando un poco de María, ella es madre cabeza de familia, tiene una hija de 19 años de edad que depende económicamente de ella, aprendió del negocio gracias a que se sometió a clases y la experiencia que iba adquiriendo trabajando en empresas que ofertar servicios similares.

Debido a que sus diseños y estilos han gustado en el mercado, María quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales para elaborar sus prendas, tales como: telas, hilos, resortes y accesorios al por mayor.

Tu puedes ser partícipe del progreso de una empresaria que no le teme al progreso, que se arriesga a darlo todo, ya que en sus manos está el futuro de su hija.
texts.en:
Smiling is one of María's principal qualities. This determined woman, 37 years old, with perseverance, drive, dreams, and vision established a business of sewing her own line of clothing but she she didn't stay with just having machines. As time passed, she purchased a cutting table and now the whole process is done in her own business.

Speaking a bit about María, she is a female head of household, and she has a 19-year-old daughter who depends on her economically. She learned the business thanks to taking classes and experience that she gained working in businesses that offer similar services.

Because her designs and styles have pleased the market, María wants to ask for a loan to purchase the materials to make her clothing, such as fabric, thread, elastics, and accessories in bulk.

You can be a participant in the progress of an entrepreneur who doesn't fear progress, who risks herself to give it her all, since in her hands is her daughter's future.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make her clothing, such as fabric, thread, elastics and accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has no piped water but has electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She mentioned competition as a challenge in her business.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Kiswend-Sida De Koanga Group

texts.fr:
M. PALINGUENABA est responsable du groupe  KISWENDSIDA DE KOANGA. Marié il père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 des enfants vont à l’école et il a 05 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait le l’agriculture depuis 06 ans. Il s’approvisionne  au marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 03 sacs d'engrais. 
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne être un grand éleveur.
NB: nos clients sont polyvalents pour la plus part. Ils mènent leurs activités en fonction des périodes. 
Quant à ce crédit, c'est un crédit complémentaire pour la saison des pluies.Si non il fait aussi l'élevage.
texts.en:
Palinguenaba is the leader of the Kiswend-Sida De Koanga group. Married, he is the father of five children, aged from two to 18 years old. Three of the children go to school. He takes care of five people.

Palinguenaba has been a farmer for six years. He procures his supplies at a local market. With this loan, he plans to buy three sacs of fertilizer. 

Palinguenaba wants to use his earnings to strengthen his business. His ambition is to become a major livestock farmer. He currently has several businesses. This loan is for the rainy season, but he also raises livestock during the dry season.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacs of fertilizer

loans.name: Kiwoda New Group

texts.en:
Zaverio is a repeat client in Ugafode Microfinance Ltd having previously taken a loan of 3,000,000 UGX. He is a married man with children. He is a businessman running a retail shop in the city outskirts, but the retail shop is still small and needs capital to boost it.

In a bid to increase his working capital and expand on the business, he has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy the most sought after items and also restock with new ones. He is however faced with challanges of competition and limited capital, which though he thinks will be history if he keeps getting funding.

He is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to him, since he is now able to fund his business. The extra person (lady in yellow blouse) at the back is a group member who has a loan but with a different term since her loan is small. Therefore, she could not be listed because of the different loan term.

loans.use: to boost his retail trade by buying more items for the shop.

loans.name: Daniel Kwasi

texts.en:
Daniel Kwasi is 27 years old. He is single and has no children. He is a water vendor at Awudome and has been selling water for two years now. He has employed one person who helps him to sell the water at his shop.

For a year now, he has been trying to save money toward his university education from the profits he makes. With this loan, Daniel Kwasi will buy more sachet and bottled water to sell. He is hopeful that in five years time, the business will expand and he will be able to complete the university.

loans.use: to buy more bottled and sachet water to sell.

loans.name: Kamono Group

texts.fr: AMINATA est  la dame  qui  tient la corne du bélier  sur la photo, elle est  malienne, âgée de 35 ans,  mariée et mère  de 8 enfants  en charge, âgés de 5  à 18 ans dont  un  scolarisé, son mari est un cultivateur . AMINATA  fait l’élevage  des ovins, elle  achète des moutons les élève et les revend. Elle a 3 ans  d’expérience.  AMINATA fait  recourt  au prêt du RMCR  afin  d’augmenter  d’avoir de l’argent  pour  acheter  beaucoup  de  moutons ,elle fait ses  achat et ses  ventes   dans les  foires  de  sa localité.  Avec  son  profit , elle parvient  à  aider  sa famille  en prenant  les  charges  ,des  frais  scolaire, de santé, et de  condiment . Elle  est  souvent confronter  à des  situations  de méventes  et relève  les  défis  avec  un revendeur  de  sa  localité . Son rêve est d’ avoir beaucoup  de profit  et d’acheter  une  charrette  à  quatre Roux  pour  sa famille .
texts.en: Aminata is the lady in the photograph who is holding the ram's horn; she is Malian and aged 35. She is married with eight dependent children who are aged from five to 18. One of her children goes to school, and her husband is a farmer. Aminata is an sheep farmer; she buys sheep, fattens them up and sells them again. She has three years experience. Aminata requests a loan from RMCR in order to have enough money to buy many sheep. She buys and sells her livestock at the local fairs. With her profits, she can manage to help her family by assuming the expenses relating to school, healthcare, and condiments. She often has to cope with difficulties such as a slump in sales and manages these problems with the help of a local salesman. Her dream is to make a big profit and to buy a four wheeled cart for her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Bulgantamir

texts.en:
Bulgantamir, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been driving a taxi for a living since 2012. Currently his wife is unemployed and taking care of house chores. Their eldest child goes to school and the younger one stays at home with his mother.

Bulgantamir's family lives in a traditional Mongolian ger which loses its warmth easily and becomes cold in winter. So he is requesting a loan of 1,275 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, planks and cement to build a barn joined with the door of ger. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place as the ger will no longer lose its heat through its door and the barn will serve as an extra wall against the cold.

Bulgantamir is a very hardworking person who strives for a better future. (in the profile picture, the borrower is with his wife and youngest child)

loans.use: to build a barn joined to his traditional Mongolian ger.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
