Evelyn is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney. She is glad that her jeepney is in a good running condition, which assured her continuous income to support her family. 

Aside from her transportation business, Evelyn has run a general store for quite a number of years. Typical of Filipino mothers, she does her best to help her husband make a living. To help augment their income, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more grocery items to sell in her store such as instant noodles, canned good, bread, beverages, etc. Having mostly essential food items will assure her of better sales. She will use part of the loan to buy some tools needed to regularly maintain her jeepney and thus ensure safe and efficient service. Your help will be greatly appreciated as it supports her livelihood.

Evelyn dreams to have a big grocery store someday. She prays to always have a happy and healthy family. She desires for her child to get a college education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and some tools needed to maintain  her jeepney.

loans.name: Stand For Good Group

texts.en:
Hawa is a thirty-five-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of Stand for Good solidarity group. Stand for Good solidarity group has four members with three women and one man. Hawa is in the middle of the group picture. She sells provisions for her business. Hawa has been in this provision business for the past two years. She opens her business six days a week from 10 am to 5 pm.

Hawa established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.

Hawa and her group members needs a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which Hawa is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy bags of sugar, a box of tins of powdered milk and baby foods for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Hawa is single and has two children who are both school going children.

In the future, Hawa plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Hawa and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, a box of tins of powdered milk and baby foods.

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita works hard to support her family. She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Edelita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional tools and accessories for the computers in her internet cafe business.

Edelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and accessories for the computers.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe2 Group

texts.en:
This group's members are part of Yehowa akwe 2 and are begin its 11st cycle with ID-Ghana as part of the loan system in Teshie branch. It is made up of four members and is led by Beatrice the group leader. The businesses that the members of the group carry out are varied. Among them exist: wigs, fry fish, grocery, kenkey, sauce pans, and plastic products.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small-business entrepreneurs of which Beatrice is a member. She indicates that she joined ID-Ghana four years ago through the invitation from a neighbor who is part of the loan system.

Currently, she has a business providing hair dressing services and also sells wigs. She makes it known that she learned this business from another lady in the township.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase in capital to purchase more wigs, shampoo, and hair creams to service her customers' hair. She will acquire these products from the wholesalers in the city of Accra. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support herself and also prepare for her future since she is single.

When she is consulted about what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responds that she likes the area of health and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase more wigs, shampoo, and hair cream to service her customers' hair

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam, age 42, is the mother of two children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. 

Mariyam's husband needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. Mariyam is therefore requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband make these purchases. 

Mariyam is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring work

loans.name: Maiuni Wendano Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand is Kyuli, 67 years old, married with 7 dependents. He started training with Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 with an aim of gaining knowledge in savings, enterprise development and financial management. He has benefited from this training and implemented mostly the savings and enterprise development. He operates a business of buying and selling goats. 

The purpose of this loan is to buy more goats to improve on his income level and be able to meet basic needs such as food and clothing for his family.

He appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy more goats for resale hence more income and be able to buy basic need such as food and clothing

loans.name: Basnéré Group

texts.fr: Roketa est une femme agée de 51 ans battante et dynamique.Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle à plus de 10 ans dans la restauration. Son succès se repose sur le respecte de la clientèle, son accueil et surtout sa propriété.Son restaurant est bien propre et le service également.Elle est à son cycle 06 à ACFIME et à toujours respecter ses engagements. Elle veut le crédit pour acheter de 05 bidons l'huile, 04 sacs de riz et des condiments.
texts.en: Roketa is a 51-year-old woman, hard-working and a fighter. She is married and the mother of four children. She has been working at selling cooked food for more than 10 years. Her success is based on the respect of her clientele, her welcoming attitude, and especially on her cleanliness. Her restaurant is very clean and the service, too. She is on her 6th cycle at ACFIME and has always met her commitments appropriately. She wants the loan to buy 5 jerrycans of oil, 4 sacks of rice, and condiments.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and condiments

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a proud veteran with the US Army Field Artillery Division, and a husband and loving father of two children. He is the main provider for the family but the troubled economy had a huge impact on the family income and caused him to fall behind on bills and monthly living expenses. This negatively affected Eric’s credit and prevented him from obtaining financing to complete much needed home improvements. The family lives in a modest home that is in need of serious repairs. Eric is most concerned about the safety of his family and he is seeking a loan to replace the original windows with new energy-efficient impact windows that will improve the structural integrity, security, and operating costs of the home. Eric and his wife are proud of their home, and they are doing their best to maintain it for their children. 

Eric is hoping that KIVA and SELF will help him provide a safer and more secure home for his family by helping him finance new windows at a monthly rate that he and his family can afford.

loans.use: ” provide a safer and more secure living environment for his family by allowing him to purchase new windows for his home through an affordable loan.

loans.name: Tomasa Rosalinda

texts.es:
Tomasa es una gran mujer de 35 años de edad, casada con una hija de cinco años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
Tomasa para darle a su familia lo necesario y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, desde hace seis años tomo la iniciativa de elaborar y vender tamales y paches que son su especialidad, ella aprendió esta labor con su amada madre y con lo gana aporta con su esposo para la construcción de su casa, pero ahora ella se ha dado cuenta que ahora con las ganancias ya no es suficiente, a raíz de esta necesidad ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de arena, cal, piedrín para el repello y cernido de la pared de la casa.
Tomasa tiene las esperanzas de poder conseguir el crédito para que su casa quede muy bien presentable, y poder instalar algún negocio.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a great woman, 35 years old, married, with a five-year-old daughter. This lovely family lives in a community of San Pablo Jocopilas.

Tomasa, to provide her family with what she needs and support her husband with the household expenses, took the initiative six years ago to make and sell tamales and paches [potato tamales], which are her specialty. She learned this work from her beloved mother and with what she earns, she contributes with her husband to build their house, but now she has realized that the earnings are not enough. So, because of this need, she now asks for a loan to purchase sand, lime powder, and fine gravel to apply stucco and texture to the wall of the house.

Tomasa has the hope of being able to get the loan so that her house looks very presentable, and to be able to establish a business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, lime powder, and fine gravel to apply stucco and texture to the wall of her house.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 42 years old. She is single and has four children. Her first son is 23 old, the second is 14, the third-born is 12 and the last born is 8 years old. Edith is a water vendor at Nsakina. She has been selling water for the past five years.

As a result of the delay in water supply, Edith would like to take this loan to buy a poly tank and store more water so that water will be available for her clients anytime they come to fetch water from her. She believe this will help her to increase sales and mange her home.

loans.use: to buy a poly tank to store water for her water vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of sachet and bottled water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of farm produce to sell in the market for more income gain

loans.name: Rezil

texts.en:
Rezil is 31 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rezil is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rezil has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 58 years old and married with three children. Antonia works very hard to provide for them.

Antonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Antonia has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, coffee, soft-drinks, noodles, cooking oil, etc. 

Antonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Ardiana has been in this business for 5 years. Ardiana earns more income from general store.

Ardiana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Norry

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Norry works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and coffee shop. Norry is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Norry has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 62 años de edad, una persona seria, tierna, de gran fortaleza mental y moral, ella por un triste acontecimiento perdió a su esposo, pero sigue adelante luchando por salir adelante, pro vivir dignamente, porque tiene 4 hijos y quiere que encuentren en ella un apoyo.

Ana para generar recursos tiene un restaurante, el cual lo atiende sola, es cocinera, mesera, cajera, una persona poli funcional que prefiera estar en un negocio generando recursos, sintiéndose viva, que estar sentada en un sillón.

Con ganas de mejorar sus ingresos hoy Ana quiere solicitar un préstamo, para remodelar el negocio, quiere darle un nuevo aire, conservando los aspectos que la hacen diferenciar de la competencia, el dinero será invertido en menús, pinturas, sillas, mesas, cubiertos, vajillas.
texts.en:
Ana is 62 years old and is a serious and loving person with great mental and moral strength. She lost her husband under unfortunate circumstances, but she continues her struggle to get ahead and live in a dignified way because she has four children for whom she must be strong. 

Ana has a restaurant so she can generate income for her family.  She runs it by herself and cooks, waits on tables, and is the cashier - a multi-function person. She would rather be at work generating income and feeling alive instead of sitting in an armchair. Wishing to increase her income, today Ana is asking for a loan so she can remodel her business. She wants to freshen it up, keeping the aspects that are unique and differentiate it from the competition. The money will be spent on menus, paintings, chairs, tables, tablecloths, and dishes.

loans.use: to remodel her restaurant.

loans.name: Yesika Paola

texts.es:
Yesika es una joven de 28 años de edad, residente de la zona de Sahagún, una persona humilde, colaboradora, que tiene en su hogar un negocio de cría de aves, negocio que monto por necesidad económica y pensando siempre en sus hijos que no superan los 5 años de edad, pues está actividad le permite no solo generar recursos sino también estar siempre al pendiente de ellos y criarlos como debe ser.

Yesika empezó el negocio con un objetivo muy claro y era ayudarle a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar, pero conforme iba avanzando el tiempo se dio cuenta que su actividad generaba recursos y le permitía soñar, esperanzarse con un mejor futuro, uno donde sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria, pero quiere dejar de soñar, quiere convertirlo en realidad y tiene un buen periodo de tiempo para elevar su carrera hasta el éxito y poder hacer realidad esos sueños.

Yesika quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos y alimento, un impulso muy significativo para su negocio, ya que aumentara la cantidad de animales y el alimento al comprarlo en cantidades y no ser perecedero tendrá un ahorro de dinero a largo plazo, significándole aumento de utilidad por cada pollo vendido.
texts.en:
Yesika is a young woman, 28 years old, who lives in the zone of Sahagún. She is a humble, cooperative person who has in her house a business raising poultry, a business she established due to economic necessity and always thinking of her children who aren't 5 years old yet, since this activity allows her not only to generate income but also to always be near them and raise them as she should.  

Yesika began her business with a very clear objective and it was to help her husband with maintaining the household, but as time passed, she realized that her business generated resources and allowed her to dream, hoping for a better future, one where her children have the opportunity to get a university degree, but she wants to stop dreaming, she wants to make it reality and to have a good period of time to lift her career to success and to be able to make these dreams a reality.

Yesika wants to ask for a loan to purchase chickens and feed, a very important boost for her business, since it will increase the quantity of animals and the feed, when purchased in bulk, since it is not perishable, will be a savings of money in the long run, meaning an increase in profit for each chicken sold.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is 34 years old and married with three children, three children are presently in school, Rina works very hard to provide for them.

Rina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Rina has been in this business for 7 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 59 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Celestina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, sanitary pads, body soap, seasonings, etc. to sell.

Celestina has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, sanitary pads, body soap, seasonings, etc.

Celestina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like coffee, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, sanitary pads, body soap, seasonings, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ingrid Libertad

texts.es:
Ella es Ingrid, es una mujer viuda de 49 años de edad, que se dedica a vender suvenires en una de las calles de la hermosa sabaneta y tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad.

Ingrid, siempre le ha gustado el trabajo independiente, le gusta manejar sus tiempos y llevar su empresa según sus principios y estrategia.   

A lo largo de su actividad se le han presentado inconvenientes, muchos de ellos económicos, pues la falta de capital ha frenado muchos proyectos, pero ahora ella no está sola, tiene un amigo que lo respalda, Interactuar, quien le ofreció llevar su Historia con su aliado Kiva para recibir ayuda de personas de buen corazón que puedan estar ubicadas en cualquier parte del mundo.

Ahora su proyecto es sacar vasos con logos distintivos, es por ello que solicita un apoyo para la compra de una máquina para imprimir los motivos que ella se ingenia, tendrá un nuevo producto que espera sea un éxito y contribuya a su sueño de tener locales distribuidos en todo Antioquía.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a widow, age 49, who works selling souvenirs on one of the streets of beautiful Sabaneta and has a child who is an adult now. 

Ingrid has always liked to work independently, she likes to manage her time and to run the business according to her principles and strategies.

In the time she has had this business, some inconveniences have come up, many of them economic, since the lack of capital have stopped many projects, but now she is not alone. She has a friend who supports her, Interactuar, who offered to bring her story with its ally Kiva to get the help of good-hearted people who can be found in all parts of the world.

Now her project is to get glasses with distinctive designs, so she asks for a loan to purchase a machine to print the designs she creates, she will have a new product that she hopes will be a success and will contribute to her dream of having distribution points in all of Antioquía.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to print on glasses, she seeks to have personalized designs.

loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.es:
Ella es Lucia, es una tierna y carismática confeccionista a terceros de 46 años de edad, que encontró en el trabajo independiente una manera de sobrevivir y darle a su familia una forma de vida digna sin pasar necesidades.

Pero ella no está sola, tiene a su pareja y a sus dos hijos que siempre la apoyan y la animan para que continúe realizando esa actividad y la motivan para que crezca y haga de su negocio una de las confecciones más importante de la ciudad de Itagüí.

Con este gran apoyo que recibe, la constante motivación, hace que se Lucia se entusiasme y quiere progresar, por ello llega ahora a Interactuar a solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos para su trabajo, telas, hilos, accesorios, que son los insumos que principalmente usa.

Su objetivo en la vida es retribuirle a su familia por ese gran apoyo y confianza que depositan en ella y lo quiere hacer dándoles una vivienda propia, ese es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Lucia is a tender and charismatic third-party seamstress.  She is 46 years old.  She found that independent work was a way of surviving and giving her family a dignified way of living without lacking necessities.  

She is not single.  She has a partner and her two children always support her and encourage her to continue working and motivate her to grow and make her sewing business one of the most important in the city of Itagüí.

With the great support that she receives and constant motivation, Lucia is enthusiastic and wants to progress, so she came to Interactuar to request a loan to purchase supplies for her work like fabric, thread, and accessories, which are the supplies she uses most.

Her goal in life is to repay her family for their support and the confidence they have in her and she wants to do that by giving them their own home, which is her biggest dream.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her work, like fabric, thread, and accessories, which are the supplies she uses most.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 43 years old and married with three children.

Ludy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Ludy has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a water refilling station.

Ludy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Angie Luzceidy

texts.es:
Hace un poco más de un año inicio una travesía la joven  Luzceidy, una con destino al éxito, al progreso, hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño de tener una vivienda propia para dársela a su madre como agradecimiento por la crianza y amor que le ha dado y dará por tantos años.


Luzceidy monto un negocio de carnicería, lo inicio empíricamente comprando un cerdo y distribuyendo su carne a amigos y vecinos, conforme iba pasando el tiempo veía los resultados y se fue enrolando en la profesión.

Luego de adquirir un año y algo más de experiencia, de analizar los clientes y el potencial de su negocio, Luzceidy está decidida a montar su propio negocio por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de un congelador y lechones.

Este préstamo, será un gran impulso en los deseos de estandarizar y tener un local comercial de la joven Luzceidy, Anímate y apóyala.
texts.en:
A little over a year ago, Luzceidy started a journey with success and progress as a destination, towards making her dream come true of having her own home. She wants to thank her mother for raising her and for the love she has given her for so many years.

Luzceidy started a butcher shop. She learned on her own, buying a pig and distributing the meat to her friends and neighbors. As time passed, she saw the results and she developed in the profession.

After acquiring more than a year of experience, analyzing customers and business potential Luzceidy is determined to open her own business. To do that she is asking for a loan to buy a freezer and piglets. 

This loan will be a good boost for her goal of formalizing her business and having a commercial locale for Luzceidy. Go ahead and support her!

loans.use: to buy a freezer and piglets. She wants to have a locale.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Esta es la Historia de Amelia una mujer pujante y trabajadora de 53 años de edad que inició un negocio con el conocimiento y herramientas que tenía disposición, no contaba con capital, solo con las ganas de progresar y sacar a su familia adelante, por ello empelo sus enseres de cocina para preparar alimentos y venderlos en las afueras de su hogar.
Es así como su negocio dio comienzo en el año 2001, y aún sigue cocinando en ese fogón de leña, ya que considera que la cocina tradicional es la que mejor sabor tiene.

Amelia es madre de dos hijos, que depende económicamente de ella puesto que tan solo tienen 10 y 19 años de edad, su sueño es que estudien y se formen como moral e intelectualmente. 

Amelia se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos tales como vegetales, granos, víveres, abarrotes y frutas.
texts.en:
This is the story of Amelia, a thriving and hardworking 53 year old woman who started her business with the knowledge and tools she had available.  She didn't have capital, only a need to progress and help her family succeed, so she got together her cooking equipment to prepare foods and sell them outside her home.  This is how she started her business in 2001.  She continues cooking on her wood stove, since she thinks that traditional cooking has the best flavor.

Amelia is the mother of two children who depend on her financially, since they are 10 and 19 years old.  Her dream is for them to study and become moral and intellectual people.

Amelia is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare foods such as vegetables, grains, groceries, and fruit.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare food, including vegetables, grains, groceries, and fruit.

loans.name: Elilibeth

texts.en:
Elilibeth is a 31-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elilibeth has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elilibeth has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Edilma Rosa

texts.es:
Edilma es una mujer de 43 años de edad, trabajador innata que desde tempranas horas de la madruga se levanta a recibir el surtido de frutas y verduras para vender diariamente en su negocio, cabe recordar que es una actividad que deben realizar constantemente debido a que las frutas y verduras algunas maduran y se echan a perder muy rápido.

Ella es madre de 3 adolescente y junto con su pareja trabajan muy duró por ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Edilma encuentra entre sus principales dificultades el precio variable de los productos, ya que influyen factores como el clima, paro camionero, o épocas de cosecha de los productos.

Es por esta razón que en épocas necesita de un apoyo para surtir su negocio.

Ella desea solicitar un apoyo para la compra de surtido de frutas y vegetales con los que busca abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Edilma is 43 years old. She is a natural born hard worker who gets up in the early hours of the morning to receive the different fruits and vegetables to sell in her business every day. It's worth remembering that this is an activity that must be done constantly due to the fact that some of the fruits and vegetables ripen and go bad very quickly.

She is the mother of 3 teenagers and she and her spouse work very hard to offer them a better quality of life. 

Edilma finds that among her main difficulties is the variability of the price of the products. Different factors affect it, like the weather, trucking strikes, or the harvest time of the products. 

That is why at times, she needs support to stock her business. She wants to ask for support to buy different fruits and vegetables with which she seeks to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy different of fruits and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es:
Ella es Nubia es una joven de 25 años de edad, que vive en el municipio de Sahagún, es madre de dos hijos el pequeño de 3 y la mayor de 5, ellos son todo para ella, trabaja en una chaza solo con el objetivo de brindarles un buen futuro.

Como mencionábamos anteriormente Nubia trabaja en una chaza, (para las personas que no están relacionadas con el termino, una chaza es una pequeño de negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar), como es una persona humilde empezó con un surtido muy básico, sin estanterías, ni vitrinas para exhibir productos, pero conforme iba pasando el tiempo adquiría elementos para mejorar el aspecto visual y surtido de su negocio.

Aunque todavía le falta elementos, surtido y capacidad para considerarse una tienda de abarrotes, Nubia va paso a paso para lograr su objetivo de constituir una, ya que pondrá todo su empeño para que su futura tienda sea la artífice de los sueños y esperanzas que tiene para su familia, solo por nombrar uno de ellos, quiere comprar una vivienda.

Pensando en mejorar y seguir por ese buen camino que recorre, Nubia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cabás, para almacenar productos refrigerados, surtido de abarrotes, y solo le queda decir gracias a las personas que apoyen su proyecto.
texts.en:
This is Nubia. She is 25 years old, lives in the town of Sahagun, and is the mother of two children who are 3 and 5 years old. They are everything to her. 

She has a chaza (for those people who don't know what it is, a chaza is a small business where basic foods are sold) with the sole purpose of providing a good future for her children. As she is a humble person, she started with a very basic assortment of goods and no shelves or cases to display the products. But as time went by she acquired elements to improve its appearance and increase the supply of merchandise. Although she is still missing some elements, products and capacity to consider it a grocery store, Nubia is slowly attaining her objective of becoming one. She is doing everything she can so that her future store will be the embodiment of the hopes and dreams she has for her family, one of which is to buy a house. 

Following her plan to improve and continue on her positive path, Nubia wants to apply for a loan so she can buy a cooler to store refrigerated items, and a supply of groceries. All that remains is for her to say "thank you" to the people who are supporting her project.

loans.use: to buy a cooler to store refrigerated items and a supply of groceries.

loans.name: Livis Adriana

texts.es:
Livis es una hermosa costeña de 22 años de edad, una mujer que no cuenta con grandes recursos solo unas energías inmensas y ganas de superarse, ella se dedica a empacar regalos, quiso ser diferente y mostrar algo diferente en su sector, lo que la motiva es que sus vecinos y compañeros han aceptado de muy buena manera este negocio y hacen de una entrega de regalo, algo especial y conmemorativo gracias a la ayuda que les ofrece Livis.

Livis quiere seguir con su profesión, seguir ayudando a su familia, estudiar, capacitarse, marcar la diferencia, demostrar que el trabajo humilde y honrado es la mejor salida a la pobreza, es por ello que acude a ustedes con la esperanza que al apoyen en un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de los elementos para elaboración de sus empaquetes, necesita variedad de papales, pegantes, artículos de decoración entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Livis is a beautiful 22 year old woman from the coast. She is a woman who doesn't have a lot of resources just immense energy and a drive to get ahead. She works wrapping gift. She wanted to do something different and show something different in her area. What motivates her is her neighbors and friends have accepted her business very well and they make the giving of a gift something special and commemorative thanks to the help provided by Livis.

Livis wants to continue with her profession and keep helping her family by studying, training, making a difference, showing that humble and honorable work  is the best way to get out of poverty. That is why she is turning to you with the hope you will support her with a loan. She will invest it in buying materials to make her packages. She needs a variety of papers, glues, decorative items and other products.

loans.use: to buy materials to maker her packages. She needs a variety of  papers, glues, decorative items and other products.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 52 years old, married and has three children. While doing the housework, Luz engage herself in caring and growing of hogs in their backyard. Luz husband is doing busy in making karaoke set. They offers karaoke rentals for any occasion. Luz wants to support her husband business in able to have more units of karaoke for rent. 

With this, she is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy DVD player, microphone, and other tools in making karaoke. Luz will be very happy if she will expand their business so that they will earn bigger as well to bestow their basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy DVD player, microphone, and other tools in making karaoke.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for her  clients who have increased in the market as well as her family needs .

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 46 years old and married with five children, two of whom in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jerlyn is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to pay for laborers salaries for farm preparation.

Jerlyn has been farming rice  for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers salaries for farm preparation

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una joven de 20 años de edad, la cual tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a su hijo de 4 años de edad, ella al ser procedente de una familia humilde, abandono momentáneamente sus sueños de estudio para laborar, ya que necesita los ingresos para cubrir todos los gastos que competen con su hijo y apoyar en su hogar.

Marcela para generar recursos se vale de su negocio de venta de calzado, ropa para hombre y dama, la cual inició empíricamente y pro necesidad económica.

El principal factor que impide el crecimiento empresarial de Marcela es el clima, ya que para vender necesita realizar grandes desplazamientos y cargar con su mercancía.

Pensando en un plan para atraer mayor clientela, mejorar sus ingresos, Marcela quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de blusas, camisas  camisetas, jean, suéter, desea vender mercancía enfocada en jóvenes y ropa casual.
texts.en:
Marcela is 20 years old. She is responsible for supporting her 4 year old. Being from a humble family, for now she left behind her dreams of going to school to work, because she needs the income to cover all of the expenses for her son and supporting the home.  

In order to generate income, Marcela works in the business of selling shoes and men's and women's clothing. She started the business by learning it on her own and out of financial necessity.

The main factor that impedes Marcela's business growth is the weather. In order to sell, she needs to cover large distances and transport her merchandise. 

Thinking of a plan to attract more customers and improve her income, Marcela wants to ask for a loan to buy blouses, shirts, t-shirts, jeans, and sweaters. She wants to sell merchandised targeted to young people and casual wear.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, jeans, and sweaters. She wants to sell merchandise targeted to young people and casual wear.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 42 years old and has four children. Mary Grace is married and has four children are presently in school.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en:
Thary’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Speu province in Cambodia. Thary makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family.

 In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lemau

texts.en:
Lemau is 42 years old and she runs a small convenience store in her village to earn a living.

 Lemau requested for a loan to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk and plastic bags,

loans.name: Atuganile Group

texts.en:
Pascal, who is in her late 30s, is a married with four children.  He has been running two businesses A genge (fruits and vegetables) business for 4 years now. he works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.daily  and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Pascal’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.He will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the genge .He dreams of to buy another motorbike. Pascal will share this loan with his loan group "Atuganile" which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To restock the out-of-stock items in the genge.

loans.name: Line

texts.en:
Line is 25 years old. She runs a business of selling fruit salad in her community to earn a living. Line requested for a loan to buy ice bag, sugar, foam cups, fruits, cooler, to help her run the business.

 She will expand her business and provide for family needs using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy ice bag, sugar, foam cups, fruits, cooler,

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years old. He is married with 2 children. He has had a spare parts selling business for 2 years and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to buy spare parts for sell and hopes this will enable him to make more income to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business, make more income and build a big house for his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for sell and hopes this will enable him to make more income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Marenette

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marenette works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Marenette is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business like thread, needles and maintenance for her sewing machine.

Marenette has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business like thread, needles and maintenance for her sewing machine

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Luisa dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as sugar, coffee, salt, milk, water, body lotion, Fanta, CocaCola,Sprite. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, salt, milk, water, body lotion, Fanta, CocaCola, Sprite.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Speu province in Cambodia. Sarin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and factory laborer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreyorn

texts.en:
Sreyorn is a 23-year-old married factory worker who resides in a village in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory for over two years. Her husband 24 years old, he is a construction worker. Sreyorn and her husband can earn around $11 per day. Sreyorn would like to improve her family’s finances, therefore she needs a loan to buy cows to breed for calves to sell. 

With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. In the future, Sreyorn wants to buy more cows to breed and renovate a proper house.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Sokkhy

texts.en:
Sokkhy, 54, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children. To make a living, she has been involved in farming business for around twenty, grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. She is able to generate a net profit of USD 4.00 a day, on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farmland. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old. He is single and has no children. He has had a motorcycle transport business for 1 years. 

He will be using the loan to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle so as to serve more customers and make more income to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his transport business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and service his motorcycle so as to serve more customers and make more income to expand his business.

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sreyneang makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

 In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. Remedios is married and has a selling nipa roofing business in the Philippines.

Remedios requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell to her customers.

Remedios has been in this business for 27 years now.

Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rizel

texts.en:
Rizel is 41 years old, married.

Rizel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Rizel has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and buy and sell personal collection.

Rizel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Kulangwa Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 40s is a divorcee with three children, one is still in school and two are grown-up.  She has been running a gengeduka for seven years now.  She works from 06am to 10pm daily and is able to make a a good monthly profit.

This will be Halima's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the gengeduka and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is really happy with her loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees, built her house, bought a plot of land, bought a TV set, radio, cupboards, to repay loan  and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase on the gengeduka stock to serve more people.  She dreams of building another house.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group Kulangwa which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the gengeduka stock to serve more people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, container,

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, 45, is a married woman from Kampong Cham province. She has two children. To make a living, she employs as a construction worker and earns, on average, an earning of USD 4.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for two years. 

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of fund, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes, banana and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 55 years old and has five children. Judy is married and has three children who are still in school.

Judy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Judy requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Judy has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Judy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Kanchaiym

texts.ru: Канчайым, 56 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. В качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Канчайым на сегодняшний день имеет 6 коров, 25 овец. Канчайым в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Канчайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит накопить средства на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Kanchaiym is 56 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Since 1995 she has practiced animal husbandry in order to earn an income for her family. Thanks to her tireless work Kanchaiym today owns six cows and 25 sheep. To further develop her business Kanchaiym came to the Bai-Tushum Bank for a 120,000 som (KGS) loan to buy livestock to raise. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further development of her business and when possible save funds to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to expand her herd

loans.name: Manuela Fernanda

texts.es:
Ella es Manuela una joven de tan solo 20 años de edad que decidió realizar el hermoso ritual del matrimonio, siguiendo sus sentimientos y yéndose a vivir con su pareja buscando su propio camino y felicidad.

Ella es una joven que continua con sus sueños de estudio, de progreso, de salir de la pobreza y ya que por la falta de experiencia laboral le han cerrado  varias puertas, decidió comenzar su negocio y en base a estudios y capacitaciones que realizo en belleza, inicio con ofertar servicios de manicura y pedicura. 

Manuela sigue con su negocio ha ido adquiriendo no solo experiencia, equipo, conocimiento para variar sus diseños y complacer a su cliente, pero aún le falta, la nueva tendencia que hay en el mercado son las uñas en acrílico y es un mercado al cual no ha podido llegar por la falta de recursos para comprar insumos, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un kit de uñas en acrílico, con el objetivo de llegar a ese mercado y mejorar sus ingresos que ayudaran en el mantenimiento de su hogar y darán su aporte en el cumplimento de los sueños de esta joven trabajadora.
texts.en:
Manuela is a young woman who is just 20 years old. She decided to participate in the beautiful ritual of marriage, following her heart and going to live with her husband seeking her own way and happiness. 
She is a young woman who is continuing with her dream to study, to progress and to get out of poverty.  As a result of a lack of work experience various doors have been closed to her. She decided to start a beauty salon business based on her studies and training and began offering manicures and pedicures.  
Manuela is continuing with her business and has acquired not only experience,  but also equipment and knowledge for making various designs to please her customers. The new trend in the market is acrylic nails and this is a market that one can't enter if they lack the resources to buy the necessary supplies. 
This is why she is requesting the loan, to buy an acrylic nail kit, with the goal of entering this market and improving her income which will help in maintaining her home and will contribute to accomplishing this hardworking young woman's dreams.

loans.use: to buy an acrylic nail kit, with the goal of entering this market and improving her income.

loans.name: Ghenadie

texts.en:
Ghenadie who is 45 years old, married and works in the cultivation of apples, with his own apple orchard of 4 hectares. Last year due to a faulty irrigation system, he incurred significant losses to his crop. 

To fix this problem and improve his production of apples he wants to buy a second-hand irrigation system, which will be newer, more efficient and effective. The new irrigation system will help increase production and create a more stable income, which can be used to develop and grow the business for the future.

loans.use: To pay for an irrigation system to water an apple orchard.

loans.name: María Deisy

texts.es:
María, de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está felizmente casada, su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos, pero viene a visitarla cada cierto tiempo, en su casa vive su hija mayor con sus dos hijos y un hijo que trabaja en el campo y en obras de construcción.

María, tiene un negocio de venta de panes con pollo, ella sale a vender por las tardes en la comunidad y también tiene contrato en el centro escolar del cantón, para hacer la comida para los niños y además de eso siempre ha tenido pollos de engorde para vender.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar pollos de engorde, concentrado y vitaminas para tener una granja y venderlos para obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.

El sueño más grande de María, es poder realizar un viaje hacia Estados Unidos, para poder reunirse con su esposo allá y apoyar económicamente a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 48 years old, went to school through ninth grade. She is happily married. Her husband works in the United States, but he comes to visit her every so often. In her house live her oldest daughter with her two children and a son who works in the fields and in construction work.

Maria has a business of selling chicken sandwiches. She goes out to sell in the afternoons in the community, and she also has a contract in the canton school to make food for the children. In addition to this, she has always had chickens to raise to sell.

Maria needs the loan in order to buy chickens to fatten, concentrated feed, and vitamins in order to have a poultry farm and sell them to obtain greater income for her family.

Maria's greatest dream is to be able to make a trip to the United States, to be able to reunite with her husband there, and to support her grandchildren economically.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise, concentrated feed, and vitamins in order to have a poultry farm

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Editha has been in this business for 38 years now.

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es un productor de café de la zona de Jinotega. Posee aproximadamente 0.7 hectáreas de este rubro, de las cuales logró obtener una producción de 20 quintales de café pergamino en el último ciclo, el cual está certificado por Comercio Justo.

Su mayor desafío en esta actividad ha sido el control de las plagas y enfermedades que afectan este cultivo, las cuales ha logrado controlar con el mantenimiento adecuado de sus plantaciones. Este pequeño productor menciona que trabajar bajo las normas de Comercio Justo y cumplir con diligencia las recomendaciones que le brindan los técnicos, es lo que le ha permitido ir mejorando su cafetal.

Para este ciclo, Julio está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que mejorará la nutrición y producción de sus plantas, y con ello la rentabilidad de su cultivo.
texts.en:
Julio is a coffee farmer in the region of Jinotega. He owns about 0.7 hectares of land, from which he was able to produce 2,000 pounds of Fair Trade pergamino coffee last season. 

His greatest challenge in this business has been controlling the infestation and disease that affect his crop. He has succeeded in keeping them under control through appropriate maintenance of his plantations. As a small producer, he mentions that working under the guidelines of Fair Trade and completing the experts’ recommendations with diligence is what has enabled him to improve his coffee crop.

For this cycle, Julio is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, with which he will improve the nutrition and production of his plants and thereby the profitability of his crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies that he will apply to his coffee plantation in order to yield greater output.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 48 years old, married with three children.

Ma. Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, coffee, sugar, noodles, cereals, etc. to sell.

Ma. Gina has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Gina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, coffee, sugar, noodles, cereals etc. to sell

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Su espíritu inquebrantable, su actitud ganado, su perseverancia y constancia laboral hicieron que Isabel una mujer de 54 años de edad, que no tiene pareja, no tiene hijos, que es solitaria, se esforzara y comprometiera con el cumplimiento de sus sueños.
Ella es una confeccionista a terceros que aprendió de su profesión de su madrina y nunca se conformó con ser una operaria, por el contrario, busco y quemó toda posibilidad hasta volverse independiente y hoy en día se siente muy orgullosa de operar su propia empresa.
Con vísperas de salir adelante, de mejorar su actividad, de tener un negocio con empleados, Isabel quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de insumos; telas, botones, hilos, accesorios complementarios de prendas y una parte la destinara a un mantenimiento preventivo de sus máquinas de coser.
texts.en:
Her unbreakable spirit, winning attitude, perseverance, and determination in her work have enabled Isabel to work hard and commit herself to the fulfillment of her dreams. She is a solitary 54-year-old woman who is single and does not have children.

She is a third-party dressmaker who learned her trade from her godmother. She was never content to be an employed worker, instead searching for possibilities and leaving no stone unturned until she became independent. Today she feels very proud to manage her own business.

In hopes of succeeding, improving her business, and having more employees, Isabel wants to request a loan. She will invest it in the purchase of supplies (fabric buttons, thread and complementary accessories for garments), and she will set aside one part of it for preventative maintenance on her machines.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fabric, buttons, thread, and complementary accessories for garments), and for preventative maintenance on her sewing machines

loans.name: Emelina Rosa

texts.es:
Emelina de 42 años es una mujer separa, que quedó como cabeza de familia de un hogar conformado por tres hijos y el cual sostiene gracias a su empresa de confección de línea propia, aprendió de la confección gracias a una clases y tiene su negocio en casa.

Trabaja 6 horas 6 días a la semana, puesto que tiene el trabajo como ama de casa de su hogar.

Su propósito es tener clientes y ventas para mantener el negocio, montar en un futuro un local comercial, donde solo exhiba sus creaciones y crear un legado para dejarles de herencia a sus hijos.

Ya en estos meses, Emelina, se tiene que dar a la tarea de crear las propuestas de la colección del mes de diciembre, que tradicionalmente en Antioquía es el mes de mayor movimiento de ventas en ropa, ya que se tiene la costumbre de estrenar los días 8, 24 y 31 de diciembre.

Es pro está razón que Emelina quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de tela, hilos, accesorios complementarios, para confeccionar las propuesta de colección de diciembre, sin descuidar sus actuales ventas.
texts.en:
42-year-old Emelina is separated from her husband; she became the head of a family made up of three children. She maintains the home thanks to her business where she makes her own line of clothing. She learned to make clothes through a class, and she has her business in her home.

She works for 6 hours on 6 days of the week because she still has her work as mother of the household.

Her goals are to have customers and sales to maintain the business; to have, in the future, a business location where she only shows her own creations; and to create a legacy to leave as an inheritance for her children.

Over the next couple months, Emelina has to do the work of creating the items for the December collection. In Antioquía, December is traditionally the month with the highest movement of clothing sales. It is customary to debut items on the 8th, 24th, and 31st of December.

For this reason, Emelina wants to request a loan to purchase fabric, thread, and complementary accessories, in order to make the items in the December collection without neglecting her current sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and complementary accessories to make the items in the December collection without neglecting her current sales

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es: Luis tiene 21 años de edad es soltero vive con sus padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar el se dedica a la albañileria , solicita el crédito para mejorar la casita de sus padres ya que es humilde pero quiere pintarle y cambiar las ventanas, gracias al credito podra mejorar su vivienda y darles comodidad a sus padres, realiza las compras en Guaranda, su sueño es cumplir con sus metas y  llegar hacer un profesional para ayudar a su familia, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte con sus amigos.
texts.en:
Luis is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar. He makes a living as a construction worker.

He is requesting the loan to improve his parents' little house. It is humble, but he wants to paint it and change the windows.

Thank to the loan, he will be able to improve their house and give comfort to his parents. He will make the purchases in Guaranda.

His dream is to fulfill his goals and become a professional to help his family. In his free time, he likes to play sports with his friends.

loans.use: to fix up the house

loans.name: Norma Guadalupe

texts.es: Norma de 30 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de pescado, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, ella es muy organizada, ya que cada día visita una zona diferente buscando mantener sus ventas. La vivienda en la que habita Norma es muy humilde pero en ella se siente feliz de vivir en compañía de su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad. Norma siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos económicos, es por ello que solicita a FUSAI un crédito el cual invertirá en: pescado, mariscos, conchas, etc., y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Norma is 30 years old and is a very hardworking woman. She has worked selling fish on the street for two years. She has many customers and is very organized, each day visiting a different zone of the city seeking to maintain her sales. The house where Norma lives is very humble but she is happy to live in the company of her life partner and their two children ages 7 and 9. 
Norma is always looking for ways to improve her economic income. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to invest in: fish, shellfish, oysters, etc. and in this way increase her sales and earnings.

loans.use: to buy fish, shellfish, oysters, etc. and in this way increase her sales and earnings.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es: Osvaldo, tiene la edad  de 37 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los  cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is 37 years old. He is married. He lives with his wife and children, who are his greatest priority. 

With his loan, he plans to buy fertilizers and other products to apply to his coffee planting and thus have good development, in addition to paying for labor to apply these products and for assistance on the plantation once his crop has developed. In this way he will be sure of doing a good job. What he hopes for is to take advantage of the good climate conditions and soil that the area has for this crop and also to put into practice the experience of a number of years of managing coffee. In addition, he will be able to buy the best products of the best quality so that his plantation has good development and sanitation as well as a sufficient harvest and in the short term a substantial production.

He wants to use the income from the harvest that he hopes to obtain for the well-being of his family, to accomplish some family goals, and to continue investing more in his crops. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with a better payment plan and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to develop his coffee crop

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco es un pequeño productor de una comunidad de Jinotega. Su esposa y él cuentan con una pequeña área de café de 0.7 hectárea. Su finca está bien diversificada ya que además de café cultiva malanga y granos básicos. Anteriormente se dedicó a la horticultura, pero debido a los químicos nocivos que utilizaba para el control de plaga; decidió cambiar de actividad.
 
Actualmente, Francisco está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes que le permitan mejorar la nutrición de su cafetal, y con lo que podrá obtener mejores resultados en la cosecha del próximo ciclo agrícola, para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is a small producer in a community of Jinotega. He and his wife have a little plot of coffee of 0.7 hectares. His farm is well diversified, since in addition to coffee he raises sweet potatoes and basic grains. In the past he worked in horticulture, but due to the damaging chemicals that he was using to control infestations, he decided to change his work.

Now Francisco is applying for a loan for the purchase of compost and fertilizers that will allow him to improve the nutrition of his coffee planting and with which he will obtain better results in the harvest of the next agricultural cycle, for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers that will help him to have a better coffee harvest

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 60 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Madelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Madelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, spices, soap, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has seven children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 54-year-old married woman. She has five children. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns by hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. She also knows the techniques of tailoring. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Bushra closer to her dream of providing a prosperous future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a water source at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Perelini

texts.en: Perelini is a 32-year-old mother with three children. She runs a convenience store in her village to earn a living. Perelini requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 and she will expand her business using her profit and provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Shehr Bano

texts.en:
Shehr Bano is the age of 49. She is the mother of one son and two daughters and is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well and some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

Therefore, Shehr Bano requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits. etc. Shehr Bano thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Shehr Bano hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way. This amount will help him to cope with the demand. Her family and she thank Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has two children. He operates a butchery. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to be a meat supplier to other retailers within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open other branches.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза, 61 год, замужем, 5 детей, младшему сыну - 19 лет. У Розы - среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду Розы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 19 овец, 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Роза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Roza is 61 years old, married and the mother of five. Her youngest son is 19 years old. Roza has received secondary education. As a source of income for her family, she raises livestock, having launched this business 22 years ago. Thanks to Roza's hard work, at present she has six cows, 19 sheep and two horses on her farm. Her monthly revenue is 11,800 soms (KGS). 

In order to develop her business further, Roza has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to use the resulting revenues for an additional increase of livestock as well as for home renovations.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie, 48, is married and has four children. For the last twenty years she has sold fish to earn a living in the Philippines.

Vergie has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her local market. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her local market

loans.name: Enkhnasan

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhnasan, 49 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been running automobile repair shop for 17 years. Her husband does mechanical works while she herself does easier jobs such as painting, cleaning and reviewing the automobiles. Their son graduated from his university last year and now works at private firm as engineer. 

She is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, planks and fiberglass in order to renovate her house. After renovation, her house will no longer lose its heat and her family will also burn less coal for heating, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 33 years old and married with three children.

Emely works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Emely has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Emely aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 26 years old and married with one child.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Gina has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for oneyear and also earns an income from buying and selling flowers.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.

Sarim makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en:
Rommel is married, 39 years old and has 2 children. He opened up a small sari-sari store in the front of his house in order to provide for and meet the needs of his children in their school. Despite the small income he is earning, it brought in a daily income which is just what the family needed. Another opportunity presented to him is to take a loan to buy more goods to have a greater income and to expand his business into a bigger one
