Rommel’s plan for his future is to save money to cover their daily needs and for the educational plan of his children

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in his store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
For 20 years, Gemma has been selling fish in the market. With the help of her husband, she really earns well. She has been providing for her family's needs from the business, and now she has also successfully repaid her previous loan used for this business. She was determined enough to sustain her business.

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more variety of fish to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy.

Christine operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soap, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, soap, cooking oil and other household items. Her business goal is to have a shop with a variety of goods within 5 years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of sugar, soap, cooking oil and other household items.

loans.name: Nelpa

texts.en:
Nelpa is 38 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelpa has a business raising pigs in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Nelpa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Katalina

texts.en:
Katalina is a 29 year old mother with 3 children. She has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living.

Katalina requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future.
She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, a rake, a shovel, gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Jeffer

texts.en:
Jeffer is a married man with one child. He describes himself to be reliable.

Jeffer operates a photography business and he has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy photography materials. His business goal is to have a fully equipped studio within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy photography materials

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 28 years old with 5 children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. 

Christina requested for a loan to buy banana tube seedlings and taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, water tank, gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2015 and will use profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube seedlings and taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en:
Imeleta is a 54 year old mother with 5 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living.

Imeleta requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future.

She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon and a frying pan.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is married and she is a business women. She has a very keen interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2013 with her own working capital of $250, and she makes her best of it.

Filomena is earning good money. She is taking this loan to improve her management of her business, because she wants to open a bigger business a bigger in the future. She is taking a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more items to keep in her store including aqua, noodles, coffee, shampoo, detergents, soap, salt, slippers, toothpaste, lighters, candy and other things to sell.

She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy aqua, noodles, coffee, shampoo, detergents, soap, salt, slippers, toothpaste, lighters, candy and other things to sell.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn has been working on her farm for many years. She just plants corn and sells it in the market. She earns a good living from this business, and this is the reason why she is able to provide for the needs of the family as well as for her children's educational needs. 

Now she has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for the business. She was determined enough to maintain her business and do really well. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay for labor on her farm. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to pay farm labor and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Heliodoro

texts.es:
Heliodoro vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. En su pequeña finca cultiva café; y granos básicos para el autoconsumo. El café es la principal actividad económica de este productor que está integrado al proceso de certificación Comercio Justo.

En los últimos años ha mejorado su producción de café, y su meta es aumentar el área de cultivo de este rubro para mejorar sus ingresos. Actualmente, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas a fin de garantizar la nutrición de 1.4 hectáreas de café, y asegurar una buena cosecha para el ciclo actual, que le permita incrementar sus ingresos y darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en: Heliodoro lives with his wife and children in a community in north Nicaragua. He grows coffee and basic grains on his small farm for consumption. Coffee is the main occupation for this producer and his goal is to increase the cultivation area to improve his income. Currently, he is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies to ensure the nutrition of 1.4 hectares of coffee and to assure a good harvest for the current season, which allows him to increase his income and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to use in his coffee plantation to have better production.

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao, 55, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He is the father of five children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling his product to the local dealers. On average, he can make an income of USD 2.00 per day.

Nao is facing a challenge with water utilization and would like to request a Kiva loan to buy a water pump for household use. With the support from this loan, he hopes it will make it more convenient for his family members to have access to water. 

He thanks all the lenders for their financial support and is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and has 1 child. She describes herself as intelligent. 

She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are regular. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, cooking oil and other items. 

She hopes that in the future she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Edralin

texts.en:
Edralin is 43 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Edralin has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional varieties of fish to sell to her customers.

Edralin has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Edralin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Malfryn Domingo

texts.es:
Malfryn Domingo es un joven estudiante de medicina, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi Nombre  Malfryn Domingo tengo 20 años, vivo en San Francisco de Macorís,  con mi papa, mis dos hermanas y mis dos sobrinos, mi hermana mayor se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y mi hermana menor se dedica a sus estudios.  

Estudio la carrera de medicina en la Universidad  Nordestana en San Francisco de Macorís, estudio  esta carrera porque es mi pasión ser médico, me identifico mucho con ella y de las materias que he tomado la biología es la que me encanta.  

Yo necesito este préstamo porque mi papá y mi mamá no tienen los recursos necesarios para cubrir los gastos, ya que son muy costosos y no pueden seguir ayudándome  con mis estudios, cuando yo termine de estudiar voy a ejercer de mi profesión empezando mis sueños y pagando  los gastos que utilice durante el período de mi carrera, mi meta académica es prepararme cada días más adquiriendo nuevos conocimientos para en un futuro ser un buen profesional estoy dispuesto a enfrentar cualquier desafío que se presente como obstáculo en mi carrera.
texts.en:
Malfryn Domingo is a young medical student. He is asking for a loan to be able to cover his educational expenses. 

This is his story: My name is Malfryn Domingo. I am 20 years old and I live in San Francisco de Macorís with my father, my two sisters and my two nephews. My older sister takes care of her children and my younger sister is in school. I am studying medicine at the Nordestana University in San Francisco de Macorís. I am studying this field because it is my passion to be a doctor. I identify myself with it and of the courses that I have taken, biology is the one I really like. 
I need this loan because my dad and mom do not have the necessary resources to cover the costs. It is very expensive and they can not continue to help me with my studies. When I finish studying, I am going to exercise my profession, start my dreams and pay the expenses that I use during the period of my career. My academic goal is to prepare myself more every day, getting new knowledge to be a good professional in the future. I am willing to deal with whatever challenge that comes up as an obstacle in my career.

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, water tank, gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Juán José

texts.es: Júan José, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan José is 44 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children, Juan's biggest priority.

Juan plans to use this loan in order to buy fertilisers and other products to apply to his coffee crops so that they develop well. Juan will also pay labourers to apply the product, and help with the crops during harvest. This loan will help Juan to do a good job. He wants to take advantage of the good climate and ground conditions in the local area, and to put into practice years of experience growing coffee.

In addition to buying the highest quality products so that his crops grow well and healthily, Juan wants to have a good yield in the short term.

Juan wants to use the profits that he hopes to receive to look after his family and achieve some family goals and continue investing in his crops.

This is Juan's first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has had no other loans from state banks and FUDECOSUR has provided Juan with this loan with better conditions and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to look after his coffee crops.

loans.name: Fatoumata Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré depuis le 01 Juin 2007, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentable. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. Elles ont une bonne maitrise du programme.

Madame Fatoumata Coumba, âgée de 59 ans (debout a gauche en vert et blanc et voilé), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 04enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente d’huile et de patte d’arachide qu’elle revend en détails dans les régions environnantes.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme à 14000f la bouteille et 09 sceaux de 25kg de patte d’arachide à 11000 le sceau et le revendre en détails.

Ses bénéfices serviront à la nourriture et la santé de sa famille
texts.en:
Created on 1 June 2007, this banc villageois is made up of village women who joined the program to make their businesses more profitable. They get along well and they do well in the program. 

Fatoumata Coumba, who is 59 years old and who is standing on the left [in the photo] in the green and white dress and a veil, is the featured borrower of the group. She is a widow and the mother of four children. She works selling oil and groundnut paste in the surrounding areas. 

With this new loan, she plans to buy 10 20-liter drums of palm oil at 14,000 francs per drum, and nine 25-kilogram buckets of groundnut paste at 11,000 per bucket.

Earnings will serve to feed her family and provide for their healthcare.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and groundnut paste

loans.name: Tou Wendé 3 Group

texts.fr: Korotoumou est âgée de 40 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 15 ans. Ce  qui fait marcher son activité c’est son expérience, son emplacement de son lieu de commerce et la qualité de sa marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter des vivres pour la restauration. L’utilité du prêt c’est de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt trois fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Korotoumou is 40 years old, married, and a mother of four children. 

She has worked running a restaurant for 15 years. She does well in this work, because of her experience, her restaurant's location, and the quality of her meals. 

She wants this loan to buy enough food for her restaurant, so that she can satisfy her customers.

She has already received three loans and has repaid them all on time.

loans.use: to buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Ablavi Mobino

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Ablavi est une femme mariée résidant à Tokoin et âgée de 34 ans. Ablavi est une revendeuse de fruits et divers qui achète ses provisions au marché et le revend dans son quartier au bord de la route. Ablavi demande ce prêt pour acheter des fruits et divers en vue de réaliser plus de rentabilité pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidienne de la famille
texts.en:
A mother of three children, Ablavi is a married woman who lives in Tokoin. She is 34 years old. 

She works selling fruits and other types of food which she procures from a market and resells in her area on the side of the road. 

Ablavi is seeking this loan to buy fruits and other types of food to earn more, so that she can help her husband cover the family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy one tray of oranges and one tray of bananas

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
Cesar, de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y vive junto a sus 3 hijos.

Cesar, trabaja en enderezado y pintura de vehículos y también en reparación de equipos electrónicos en su casa, dichas actividades las aprendió en programas impartidos por el gobierno, a través de algunas ONG que velan por el bienestar de los lisiados de guerra, como es el caso de Cesar, quien combatió en el ejército durante 15 años, hasta que una mina le explotó y le daño la pierna izquierda y tuvieron que amputársela.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar más material y equipo necesario para su taller, en el cual empieza a tener más número de clientes por la confianza que le tienen.

El sueño de Cesar es, tener un taller más equipado, para trabajar mejor y generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Cesar is 52 years old and has a fourth-grade education. He is married; his wife looks after the household chores. Cesar lives with his three children.

Cesar works at a vehicle paint and body shop, and repairing electronic equipment in his house. Cesar learned these trades at programmes given by the government through some NGOs that look out for the well-being of those wounded during the war. This includes Cesar who fought in the army for 15 yeas until a mine exploded and injured his left leg, which had to be amputated.

This loan will be used to buy more material and equipment for Cesar's workshop, where he is starting to have more customers as people trust him.

Cesar's dream is to have a better-equipped workshop in order to work better and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy more necessary material and equipment for his workshop.

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré depuis le 01 Juin 2007, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentable. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. Elles ont une bonne maitrise du programme.

Madame Kadiatou, âgée de 48 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente d’arachide qu’elle achète en gros dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre dans son quartier en détails.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 04 sacs d’arachides à 15000f le sac et payer un transport de 5000f jusque chez elle.

Ses bénéfices serviront à aider son mari dans les charges liées à la scolarité et aux soins médicaux des enfants.
texts.en:
Created on 1 June 2007, this banc villageois is made up of village women who joined the program to make their businesses more profitable. A good ambiance permeates the group meetings. They are doing well in the program. 

Kadiatou, who is 48 years old and who is standing on the far right with her hand raised [in the photo], is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and a mother of three children. She works by selling groundnuts, which she buys at wholesale in the weekly markets, and resells in her area at retail. 

With this new loan, she plans to buy four sacs of groundnuts at 15,000 francs per sac and to pay 5,000 francs to transport the stock to her home. 

Earnings will serve to help her husband with their children's school costs and healthcare needs.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and to pay for transport

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme veuve sans enfant habitant à Tokoin. Afi est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Afi demande ce prêt pour commander des friperies.
texts.en:
Afi is a widow with no children and lives in Tokoin. She works selling used clothing which she procures from a market and resells in the surrounding areas.

So as to have enough stock to satisfy the great demand from her customers and to maximize her profits, she is seeking this loan.

loans.use: to buy 165 pieces of used clothing

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Afi est une femme résidante à Tokoin. Agée de 45 ans, Afi est une revendeuse d’oignons qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans son quartier. Afi désire ce crédit pour acheter des oignons afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Married and a mother of three children, Afi is 45 years old and lives in Tokoin. She works selling onions that she procures twice a month from a market and resells by traveling around her neighborhood. 

Afi is seeking this loan to buy onions in order to earn more, so that she can help provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy one sac of onions

loans.name: Blanca Lety

texts.es:
Blanca, de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, nunca se casó ni tuvo pareja y vive junto a sus padres, una hermana y una sobrina.

Blanca, aprendió a trabajar desde temprana edad, empezó realizando los oficios domésticos en diferentes casas, incluso llegó a trabajar en la capital del país; hasta que en el año 2001 decidió abrir una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, la cual sostuvo por nueve años; luego decidió trabajar nuevamente realizando oficios domésticos en casas ajenas.- Hace aproximadamente 3 años, decidió abrir nuevamente la tienda, pero esta vez vendería productos alimenticios que no se encuentran en tiendas pequeñas, por ejemplo: queso, chorizo, pan, boquitas diana, etc. y le ha ido muy bien.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar más productos, porque se acercan las vacaciones y en esa época se venden más producto.

Blanca, sueña con tener una tienda más grande en el caserío donde vive, para percibir más ganancias y poderle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 46 years old and went to school until the third grade. She has never married nor had a partner and lives with her parents, her sister and a niece. 

Blanca learned to work from an early age, starting with domestic tasks in various houses, eventually going to work in the nations Capital. In 2001 she decided to open a shop selling staples and kept this going for nine years. She then decided to go back to domestic work in households nearby.
 
About three years ago she decided to open a shop again, this time selling foods that are not available in small shops. So for example she sells cheese, chorizo pork sausage, bread, snacks etc and this has done very well.  She is asking for a loan to buy more stock, because expects sales to increase in the coming holiday season. Blanca's dream is to have a larger shop in the village where she lives so that she can increase her income and provide a better a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock;  the holiday season is coming and this is a time when her sales increase

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 54 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Pungul, pertenece ala ventanilla rural Pungul, el se dedica a la agricultura a la compra y venta de ganado, solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado para incrementar su negocio, el realiza las compras en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana, gracias al crédito podra mejorar su economia y sustentar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos para que sean profecionales, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer mingas en la comunidad.
texts.en: Lorenzo is 54 years old, he is married, he has 4 children, and he lives in Guaranda, province of Bolivar, in the community of Pungul. He belongs to the communal bank Pungul. He works in agriculture and the purchase and sale of livestock. He asks for the loan for the purchase of livestock to expand his business. He makes the purchases in the market in Guaranda every week. Thanks to the loan he will be able to improve his economy and afford the expenses of his children’s schooling so that they can become professionals. In his free time, he enjoys cooperative work in the community.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 39-year-old man living in Kipkener, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Like many smallholder farmers in Kenya, he owns a tiny inherited plot of land to live off of, just under half an acre, and has always struggled to support his family. His primary source of income has been milk, crops and some small personal business he engages in to supplement his meager income.

Charles passionately loves dairy farming, but one challenge he has been facing is the lack of funds to buy a quality breed of cow. He is kindly seeking a loan to buy a superior breed of cow. From the loan, he will get quality milk, which fetches high prices in the local market. He will also get skin and manure, which he will sell to his neighbors and to the local market. Feeding the cow will never be a challenge for Charles because he has planted forage on his farm and will be supplementing this by cutting plants at the river bank for fodder. This will assure him of increased milk production. This loan is going to impact the life of Charles positively. Charles is already thinking ahead, and with the loan, he plans to increase his milk production and sell to the big milk processing firms. Other than milk from the cow, he will benefit from the manure, which will improve his farm fertility and result in high productivity. All that Charles waits for is for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a superior breed of cow

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a married woman with six children. Her home has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to start a new business selling ladies' shoes. She wants to purchase pairs of shoes for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to have access to a loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kellys Maria

texts.es:
Con tan solo 26 años de edad Kellys  es madre de 3 hijos que no superar los 10 años de edad, una responsabilidad que asume con madurez y compromiso ya que su pareja al igual que ella es una persona humilde que necesita laborar con mucho empeño para salir adelante y conseguir el alimento para su familia.

Kellys para generar ingresos se vale de su negocio de venta de ropa, la cual realiza empíricamente desde su casa, pero que también tiene la variante de que realiza desplazamientos para lograr mayores ventas.

Al preguntarle a ella cual ha sido su principal dificultad en su negocio, ella respondió la falta de capital para rotar sus productos.

En base a esta dificultad Kellys quiere un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa para hombre, niño y niña en diferentes estilos, buscando refrescar su actual exhibición y portafolio de servicios.

Anímate, ayuda a una empresaria para que mejore su negocio y pueda tener en un futuro un almacén de ropa y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Kellys is only 26 and already has three children under the age of ten.  She assumes her responsibility with maturity and commitment since her partner is like her, a humble person who needs to work hard to get ahead and put food on the table for the family.

To earn an income Kellys sells clothing from home.  She also goes out to sell to earn more.  When asked about the main difficulty in her business she said it was the lack of capital to keep products moving.

Because of this difficulty, Kellys is requesting a loan to buy a variety of men's, boy's and girl's clothing in different styles to update her stock and services portfolio.

Please help an entrepreneur improve her business so that in the future she can establish a clothing shop and improve the quality of life of her loved ones.

loans.use: To buy a variety of men's, boy's and girl's clothing in different styles, to update her current stock and services portfolio.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en: Annastacia is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soap, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, soap, bread, flour and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, soap, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Júan Bautista

texts.es: Juán Bautista, tiene la edad  de 62 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hija, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de caña y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de la caña. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una producción adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una cosecha importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista, 62, is married and lives with his wife and daughter, who are his main priority.  With the loan he plans to buy fertilizers and other products for his sugarcane crop for its proper development.  He also will hire workers to apply the products and care for the plantation once the crops have grown.  This will insure a quality job.

He wants to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions in the area, and also put into practice the years of experience he has in handling sugarcane.  Juan Bautista also wants to buy the best quality products he can to grow a healthy crop, attain adequate production and have an abundant crop in a short amount of time. 

With the harvest he hopes to contribute to his family's well-being and meet some of the family goals, as well as continue investing in his crop.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan and FUDECOSUR is giving him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To care for his sugarcane.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Elsa, de 46 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, está casada, tres de todos sus hijos aún viven con ella, su esposo es empleado municipal, en el departamento donde residen.

Elsa, tiene un comedor desde hace cuatro meses en donde vende desayunos y almuerzos, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 2:00 de la tarde, con ella también trabaja su hija y su esposo, cuando tienen tiempo libre para hacerlo; anteriormente era empleada en un comedor y fue ahí donde aprendió a preparar algunos platillo, pero después decidió poner su propio negocio.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos para preparar la comida y comprar mobiliario y equipo para brindar mejor atención a sus clientes.

Ella desea seguir trabajando en su negocio, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
46-year-old Elsa has four children. She studied up to the first year of high school. She is married. Three of her children still live with her. Her husband is a public servant in the department in which they live.

Elsa has had a restaurant for four months, where she sells breakfast and lunch food. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. Her daughter and her husband also work with her when they have the time to do so. She was previously employed in a restaurant and it was there that she learned how to make some dishes, but then she decided to set up her own business.

She needs the loan to buy supplies for making her food and to purchase furniture and equipment so she can offer better service to her customers.
She wants to continue working in her business in order to improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food and to purchase furniture and equipment so she can offer better service to her customers

loans.name: Sai Mahila Mandal -2 Group

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Mariyambai, the lady in the centre in the group picture, hails from the Kutch district in Gujarat. Mariyambai is married and she has seven members in her family, including herself. She runs a clothes-selling business. At present, running her own business, she is able to contribute Rs. 3,000 to her household monthly income of Rs 13,000. She believes she can increase her contribution to Rs 5,000 per month if she expands her business. To do that, she needs a loan of Rs 10,000. With the loan, she will purchase and sell shirts, pants, frocks, sarees, etc. The loan will help sustain her family.

Mariyambai has come together with four other women – Samimbanu, Havabai, Himaben and Kulsumbanu- who also need a loan to expand their businesses. The loan will be used by Samimbanu to expand her handicrafts business, Havabai to expand her fish business, Himaben to expand her livestock business and Kulsumbanu to expand her cutlery (beauty items) business. Collectively, they need a loan of Rs. 55,000, which they are confident they can repay with the increased income from their businesses. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to expand her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina is married and has 10 children to provide for. She owns a farm where she plants fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers. She has been running this fruit and vegetable selling business for 13 years. His husband is also a farmer. He is the one who takes good care of her vegetables. She has sustained the business, and because of her generated income, she is able to sustain the needs of her children. She really wants to improve their living condition and decided to borrow a loan from GDMPC to buy fertilizer for her vegetables, so that she will produce good quality vegetables and will be able to sell them to her customers.

She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business to improve and expand her business and pay for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the fruits and vegetables that she plants and sells to her customers.

location.town: Happy Village, Tambulig Zambo. del Sur

loans.name: Grupo Sector Chicay Group

texts.es:
Maria es una muchacha de 28 años de edad, ella vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Maria (la señora que se ubica de primero en el lado izquierdo de la foto) es una joven que lucha cada día para poyar a su familia, pues desde hace cinco años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo hace desde la plaza de su comunidad, y esto le permite también realizar los oficios de su casa y cuidar de su familia, con esta actividad ella contribuye en complementar algunos gastos en su casa.
Maria con el afán de seguir comprando y vendiendo ropa típica, ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, con este dinero ella estará comprando, güipiles, cortes, fajas y todo lo relacionado con la línea de ropa. Maria tiene el sueño de construir una casa más grande para sus hijos donde ellos vivan mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Maria, 28, lives with her parents and siblings in a community in Santo Tomas La Union.  Maria (the first on the left in the picture) is a young woman who struggles daily to support her family and for five years she has been buying and selling typical clothing.  She enjoys what she does and carries out her activity in the main sqare of her community.  Her schedule also allows her to do the housework and care for the family.  Through her business she is able to contribute to the household expenses.

In order to continue buying and selling typical clothing, Maria is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  She will use the money to buy güipiles (typical blouses), skirt fabric, waistbands and everything related to typical garments.

Maria's goal is to build a larger house so her children will live more comfortably.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as typical blouses, skirt fabric, waistbands and everything related to this type of garment.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es una mujer con 50 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, que con mucho esfuerzo logro montar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes la cual situó en la sala de la casa donde reside.
Este ha sido un medio con el cual esta mujer ha logrado superar una difícil situación económica que vivo luego de la separación de su esposo, quien era el sostén del hogar.
La idea es continuar creciendo con su negocio y más adelante generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesiten.

En el momento Marleny no cuenta con mucho surtido, lo que hace disminuir sus ventas y de tal forma sus clientes, es por esto que solicita un crédito con el cual abastecerá su negocio de productos de aseo y productos de consumo diario en los hogares como lo es el arroz, aceite, sal, azúcar, bebidas y carnes frías.

Para esto cuenta con el apoyo de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal kiva.
texts.en:
Marleny is a 30-year-old woman, hard-working and very modest, who with a lot of effort managed to open her own business, a grocery store which she set up in the living room of the house where she resides.
This has been the way in which this woman has managed to get over a difficult economic situation that she went through after she separated from her husband, who was their main support.
The idea is to keep growing her business and further on to generate employment to people who need it the most.
At the moment, Marleny does not have a lot of stock, which decreases her sales and therefore her clients. It is for this reason that she asks for a loan with which she will stock her business of cleaning and daily home use products, such as rice, oil, salt, sugar, drinks, and cold meats.
For this, she counts with the support of Interactuar and the collaborators of Kiva.

loans.use: to stock her business of cleaning and daily home use products.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a 49-year-old mother with two children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printed materials at the market to earn a living. Makerita requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushses, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her to run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, a paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Para progresar solo necesitas voluntad y esto se ve muy reflejado en Mercedes, una mujer humilde que montó una legumbrera y se aprecian la foto, en el fondo se ve la cocina, en pocas palabras, en un espacio que tenía de su cocina, puso su venta de vegetales y frutas para generar los ingresos necesarios con los que quiere brindar estudios a sus hijos, una actitud de admirar y de imitar ya que está empresaria no se rinde.

Ahora Mercedes se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de vegetales y parte del préstamo será para la compra de estanterías ya que todo lo que tiene lo ubica en una mesa que improviso con un par de tablas y dos cajones, anímate, incentiva esta empresaria con un préstamo que la ayuda a progresar.
texts.en:
To get ahead one only needs willpower, as is well demonstrated by Mercedes.  She is a humble woman who set up the vegetable stand shown in the picture.  Behind her is the kitchen so, in a nutshell, she uses her kitchen space to sell fruits and vegetables to earn enough to cover her children's education.  Her attitude is admirable and sets an example; this entrepreneur does not give up.

Mercedes is requesting a loan to buy vegetables and use part of the loan to buy shelving.  Currently she displays everything on a table that she put together with boards and two boxes.

Please encourage this entrepreneur through your loan and help her prosper.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, and use part of the loan to buy shelving.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es: Ana Yancy, tiene la edad  de 33 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  materiales para poder hacer la construcción de un local donde pueda tener y desarrollar algunos cerdos para el engorde.  La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene y las buenas condiciones para ubicar un chiquero  para los cerdos. Además de obtener unos cerdos de buena calidad que a corto plazo puedan estar gordos y de buena calidad. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en el proyecto y a la vez darle más ingresos económicos a su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ana Yancy, 33, is married and lives with her children and husband who are her main priority.  She plans to use the loan to buy materials to build a pig pen to raise pigs.  Her idea is to take advantage of the space she has which is in good condition for a pen.

She also wants to buy quality pigs to raise in a short amount of time.  With the purchase she will be able to go into business and save enough money to buy more animals and invest in other projects as well as provide her family with more income.

This is her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has never received state bank loans and FUDECOSUR is giving her better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a latrine at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Ron

texts.en: Ron, age 40, is a married mother with six children who lives in a village in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. Since 1995, vegetable farming has been the main source of her family’s income. Her husband, age 41, is a farmer as well. Two of her four children work in construction and four are in school. Together, they can earn approximately $14 per day. Ron would like to improve her vegetable farming, so she is now requesting a loan to buy a tractor for plowing. With the loan, she will have enough money to buy this tractor for her farming, thus reducing her plowing expenses. In the future, she wants to buy more farmland, build a fence around her house and help her children who are still in school to earn their bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to buy a tractor for plowing

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a beauty salon where she sells hair products and also offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are ladies. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of hair products and other beauty products. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of hair products and other beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more tailors for tailoring clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, etc.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: María es una mujer que a sus 28 años de edad siempre busca la manera de mejorar sus ingresos, por lo que desde hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, actividad que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar, y en el que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, ya que es el único negocio de este tipo en su cantón. María vive en casa de su  propiedad junto a su compañero de vida, su hijo de 4 años de edad y su hermano. Ella ha decidido que desea brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz por mayoreo y de esta manera obtenerlo a precio más cómodo.
texts.en: Maria is a 28-year-old woman who is always looking for a way to increase her earnings, which is why she has been making and selling tortillas for the past two years. This work allows her to support her household. She has a large clientele since it is the only business of this sort in the canton. Maria lives in her own house with her partner, her four-year-old son, and her brother. She has decided that she wants to offer her clients better service, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will use it to buy maize wholesale, thereby obtaining it at a better price.

loans.use: to buy maize wholesale, thereby obtaining a better price

loans.name: Leticia Amparo

texts.es:
Leticia es una mujer con 50 años de edad, trabajadora, humilde y muy servicial, desde hace ya un año logro montar su propio negocio, un taller de confecciones, una actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre y con lo que ha logrado un gran progreso, salió adelante con su familia luego de pasar por una situación económica bastante difícil.
Cuenta con ocho empleados, trabajan de lunes a viernes durante 8 horas diarias.

Actualmente está pasando por un mal momento, debido al poco capital y la competencia en el sector donde vive sus ingresos han bajado de forma continua y muy notoria, lo que impide que los pagos a sus empleados sean impuntuales  o  muy rebajados.
Es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual ajustará para cubrir los pagos a sus empleados, de tal manera que todos queden satisfechos y sigan laborando como normalmente lo han hecho.

Su propósito es continuar trabajando para remodelar su casa, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando, y sus condiciones no son las mejores.
texts.en:
Leticia is a 50-year-old woman. She is hard-working, humble and very helpful. She managed to set up her own dressmaking business a year ago. She learned this activity from her mother and she has managed to progress a lot in her business and get ahead in life with her family after going through quite a difficult financial situation. She has eight employees and they work eight hours a day from Monday to Friday.

Leticia is currently going through a hard time due to the competition in the area where she lives and the lack of capital. Her income has decreased steadily, which means her payments to her employees are late or reduced.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay her employees so that they are all satisfied and their work doesn’t suffer.

Her goal is to continue working so she can remodel her house, since it has been deteriorating over time and the living conditions are not the best.

loans.use: to pay her employees so that they are all happy and keep working for her

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es:
Digna, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, se casó de 26 años, su esposo trabaja como jardinero dando mantenimiento en algunas colonias de prestigio, pero también trabaja en la agricultura durante la época de lluvia. 

Digna, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa y vende ropa en su comunidad. 

El préstamo será invertido principalmente para comprar ropa para todas las edades, esto le va a generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.

A futuro desea hacerle mejoras a su casa y construirla de ladrillo o bloque, porque actualmente es de adobe, es pequeña y la familia ya creció.
texts.en:
Digna is 43 years old, she studied until 4th grade and married at 26 years old. Her partner works as a gardener carrying out maintenance in prestigious communities. But he also works in agriculture during the rainy season.

Digna has a small shop in her house and sells clothes in her community

The loan will be invested mainly in purchasing clothes for all ages, this will earn her more income for her home.

In the future she wishes to make improvements to her house and build it out of bricks or concrete blocks, because at the moment it is made of sun-dried bricks, it is small and the family is growing.

loans.use: to buy clothing for all ages

loans.name: Sandra Nohemy

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer que a sus 41 años de edad siempre busca la manera de mejorar sus ingresos económicos para brindar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos de forma ambulante recorriendo diferentes lugares cada día en los que ya la esperan para comprar sus productos. Sandra hace 9 años logro comprar su pequeña vivienda en la que habita junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad del cual se siente muy orgullosa, ya que lo ha sacado adelante como madre soltera. Sandra desea aumentar sus ventas y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: mariscos, pescado, conchas, entre otros productos, con los cuales espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Sandra is a 41-year-old woman who is always looking for a way to increase her earnings so she can give her son a better quality of life. For this reason, she has been selling shellfish for the last 12 years. Every day she goes to a different place where people are waiting to buy her products. Nine years ago, Sandra managed to buy her little house. She lives there with her 17-year-old son, of whom she is very proud. She has managed to support him as a single mother. Sandra wishes to increase her sales; for this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy shellfish, fish, shells, and other products so she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy shellfish, fish, shells, and other products so she can increase her earnings

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the Northwest part of Cambodia. She is 51 years old. She lives in a wooden house with her husband (who is also a weaver) and her son, who is still studying.

Her three other children are already working and/or married. Her family owns a 1.5-hectare cassava field. In 2001, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Kong makes scarves, which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field and to extend her lending business.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, age 45, is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shoe shop in which he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells over his shop. He has been selling gents shoes only but now he wants to offer ladies shoes as well according customer demands but the major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount.

Therefore, Azra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy crushing ladies shoes as well.

Azra is very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more variety of ladies shoes for her husband's shoe shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Sarah requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Sarah has been in this business for six years now.

Sarah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in medicines and groceries such as rice, oil, tuna, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine.

loans.name: Sarean

texts.en:
SAREAN, 32, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. She has two children who are currently in school.

To make a living and support her family, she runs a business of selling clothes and earns, on average, USD 10 a day. So far, she has been involved in this business for five years.

She wants to extend her business by offering a variety of clothes for her clients. However, she doesn’t have enough capital to do so. Therefore, she would like to apply for Kiva loan to buy more clothes to re-sell. The loan will make a great contribution to improviing her business. She would like to thank for all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, tiene la edad  de 63 años, está soltero, vive solo,  trabaja para su propia superación. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena germinación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la erosión, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en su bienestar y cumplir con algunas metas y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Fernando, 63, is single, lives alone, and works to improve his lot in life.
He will use the loan to buy high-quality broad beans seeds, likely to yield a good harvest.
He also plans to buy organic fertiliser to improve his land, as well as other products to tend to his crops.
He will also hire farm hands to help till the land and protect it from possible erosion damage from rainwater.
The farm hands will also help apply products to the crops and generally tend to them while they are growing.
Those precautions make Fernando confident he will have a plentiful harvest.
He wants to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions of the area, which make it perfect for the crops he intends to grow.
Fernando has many years' worth of experience in growing basic grains.
He relishes the opportunity to buy the best-quality farm supplies to ensure his crops grow in the best of conditions and provide him with a bountiful harvest. His aim is to have a lot of produce in the short term.
With the expected profits from the harvest, Fernando will invest in his well-being, realise a few of his goals and keep investing in his crops.
This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. In fact, he never took out a loan with a traditional banking institution. FUDECOSUR granted him the loan more easily than a bank would have, and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora es una mujer emprendedora de 47 años de edad que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante, por lo que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y cangrejos, actividad que le permite salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que se siente feliz de tener esta fuente de ingresos. Dora vive en casa propiedad desde hace 18 años y en ella viven también su hija de 29 años y sus 3 nietos una niña de 8 años y dos varones de 11 y 7 años de edad. Dora desea incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: mariscos, pescado fresco y cangrejos para vender en los diferentes cantones mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dora, 47, is an enterprising woman, always making efforts to get ahead. She has worked for fifteen years selling fish and crabs, and she's happy to have this source of income that allows her to get ahead with her family.

She lives in her home which she has owned for 18 years, with her daughter, age 29, and three grandchildren, an eight-year-old girl and two boys aged 11 and seven.

Dora would like to increase her sales and income, so she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy shellfish, fresh fish and crabs that she will sell in the various communities.

loans.use: to buy shellfish, fresh fish and crabs that she will sell in the various communities.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has been running her sari-sari store for 30 years. She's really earning well. His husband is disabled and can't help her anymore in working on it, but she has still sustained the business and provides the family needs.

With her generated income, she was able to repay her previous loan, which was used for the business successfully. Improving her business is easier with her access to GDMPC.

Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Con 48 años de edad Guadalupe muestra ser una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida vendiendo pupusas, platillo típico muy reconocido en el país, además para acompañarlas vende refrescos naturales de diferentes frutas, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Guadalupe vive en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijos mayores de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Guadalupe desea invertir en su negocio, ya que gracias a su amabilidad y el exquisito sabor de sus productos cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: chicharrón, queso, repollo, tomates, frijoles, maíz, entre otros productos necesarios para la preparación de las pupusas.
texts.en:
At 48 years old, Guadalupe has proved herself a hard-working woman, who makes a living selling pupusas, a very popular traditional dish (made of a maize tortilla filled with cheese, meat, and beans). 
She also sells various types of fresh fruit juice. 
Thanks to her business, she is able to support her family.
Guadalupe lives in a house of her own with two children, already adults, whom she managed to raise as a single mom.
Guadalupe wants to invest in her business, the growing success of which she attributes to her amiability towards customers and the delicious flavour of her food and drinks.
She thus asks FUSAI for a loan to buy pork rinds, cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, broad beans, maize, and other ingredients she needs to make pupusas.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare the food she makes.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a single man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells wheat, maize flour, bread, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, milk, soap and other items. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, milk, soap and other items.

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es:
Ana, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de plásticos para cubrir mesas y sus hijos viven con ellos.

Ana, tiene una pequeña venta de pupusas y de comida a la par de un turicentro, pero lo atiende solo los fines de semana, este negocio lo realiza junto con su esposo cuando no sale a vender plástico.

Ella, necesita el préstamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar algunos insumos para preparar los alimentos, porque con el nacimiento de su hija, se gastó el capital que ocupaba para su negocio y ahora quiere aprovechar las vacaciones, porque la venta es muy buena.

Ana, sueña con estabilizar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Ana, 20, went to school until the third form.
She is married: her husband sells plastic tablecloths. The couple lives with their children.
Ana has a small food stall where she sells pupusas (a traditional dish made of a maize tortilla filled with cheese, meat, and beans) and other food to go.
She only sells food on weekends, with the help of her husband if the latter is not out selling his wares.
Ana needs the loan to expand her business and buy ingredients to prepare the food she cooks.
With the birth of her daughter, she had to draw on the funds she set aside for the food stall.
She wants to take advantage of the holiday period, always a busy one, to sell a lot of food and recoup the money.
Ana dreams of running a stabler business and of improving her house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 46 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Pungul, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Pungul y se dedica a la agricultuta y a la compra y venta de ganado, solicita el crédito para la compra de una vacas maltonas ya que quiere engordarlas y luego venderlas para ganar una comisión, gracias al crédito que solicito podra mejorar el negocio, teniendo mayores ganancias, las compras y ventas realiza en Guaranda en el mercado de animales, su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen hacer profesionales ya que el no lo es y no quiere que pasen necesidades, su desafio es la falta de trabajo, y en su tiempo libre le gusta jugar voli.
texts.en:
Manuel, 46, is married, has four childre, and lives in Guarandá, in the province of Bolívar, in the village of Pungul.
He belong to the village's communal bank and is a farmer who also buys and sells cattle.
He asks for the loan to buy cows to fatten and resell for a good price.
Thanks to the loan, he will be able to improve his business and increase his income.
He buys and sells his cows in Guarandá, at the animal market.
His greatest dream is to see his children become professionals, that way they will not have to endure the hardships he suffered.
The main challenge he faces is the lack of work. 
In his spare time, he likes to play volley-ball.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado, su esposa se dedica a la venta de pupusas los fines de semana, tiene 2 hijos y aún viven con ellos.

Wilfredo, trabaja en labores agrícolas para subsistencia, este trabajo lo aprendió desde muy joven con su padre, además cuida ganado, trabaja en los terrenos de su familia que está junto a su casa.

Wilfredo, necesita el préstamo para pagar la maquinaria agrícola para la preparación del terreno para la siembra y para comprar insumos para el manejo del cultivo de maíz, con la cosecha de estos granos básicos, dará la seguridad alimenticia a su familia y producirá el forraje para la alimentación del ganado en la época de verano. 

A futuro Wilfredo, espera tener la estabilidad económica suficiente, para apoyar a sus hijos a que estudia una carrera universitaria y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 50 and finished high school.
He is married: his wife sells pupusas (a traditional dish made of a maize tortilla filled with cheese, meat, and beans) on weekends. The couple lives with their two children.
Wilfredo is a farmer, a trade he learned at very young age from his father.
He also raises cattle. All these activities are carried out on his family's land, located near the house.
Wilfredo needs the loan to rent farming machines to till the earth and sow seeds. He will also buy farm supplies to tend to his maize crops.
Harvesting basic grains is how he provides for his family. He will also produce fodder to feed the cattle during the summer.
Wilfredo hopes to become financially stable enough in the future to support his children through university so that they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies and hire farm hands.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is married and she works hard to support her family.

Irenea has a firewood-vending business in the Philippines. Irenea has been in this business for eight years now.

Irenea requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

In the future, Irenea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Munsheed

texts.en:
Munsheed is a 60-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three sons and a daughter. She adores her family. Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.

Her husband owns a clothing sale business that is the only source of income for the family. Currently, he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. Therefore, Munsheed is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase more variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs.

With the help of the profit amount, he will put aside some savings to pay for electricity and gas bills. Munsheed hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her husband's clothing sale business.

loans.name: Shalabeng G1 Group

texts.en: Marepelang is a 42 year old mother of 4 children aged between 17 and 10 years. She is a divorcee and now lives with her children and her elderly father in a small brick house that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter. She works long hours to ensure there is enough food for her children and father. All her children still go to school and the only means of income comes entirely from her with very little pension from her father.She used to wake up very early between 3am and 4am during the week, to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water and warming the house for her children before they go to school because she could not afford any other means. However with little money she makes while working plus her father's pension money;which is not much, she is now able to afford to buy gas and paraffin both which are very expensive.She finds herself having to pay about R300 to R400 a month to have sufficient gas;money she hardly makes. Not only is gas expensive for Marapelang and many like her, but it is also highly flammable and when inhaled can lead to lung diseases even death. Marapelang has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves which provide her and 12 other people from her village, who are living in the same circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes. This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. A life improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation, house burning and has given them the freedom to have a better lit home to see better in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For stove info please check www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: To be able to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To be able to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Mokotjo Group

texts.en: Masebatli is a 42 year old mother of 4 children aged between 15 and 9 years. She lives in a brick hut that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter. She and her husband work long hours to ensure there is enough food for their children, whom all go to school during the week and can only help in the field and looking after animals on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. She used to wake up very early between 3am and 4am during the week, to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water and warming the house for all the children before they go to school because she could not afford any other means. However with selling her crops and livestock, she was then able to buy gas and replaced her means of cooking although this became very expensive. She found herself having to pay about R300 to R400 a month to have sufficient gas;money she hardly makes. Not only is gas expensive for Masebatli and many like her, but it is highly flammable and when inhaled can lead to lung diseases even death. Masebatli has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves which provide Masebatli and 9 other people from her village, who are living in the similar circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes. This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. A life improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation, house burning and has given them the freedom to have a better lit home to see better in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For stove info please check www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: To be able to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio, container, and freezer.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a 45-year-old man from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married and has three children. His oldest child is 20 years old and his youngest child is 15 years old.

Edgar and his wife work together to run their sari-sari store business to earn a living. They have been doing this for 10 years. Aside from this, Edgar also buys and sells fresh and dried fish to increase their livelihood.

He hopes in the future to send all his children to school and finish their degrees.

Edgar is asking a loan to continue running his business. He needs additional capital to buy assorted grocery items such as coffee, sugar, biscuits, chips, candies, noodles, soft drinks, toiletries, powdered milk, juice and chocolate drink. He also needs capital to buy more fresh and dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, biscuits, chips, candies, noodles, soft drinks, toiletries, powdered milk, juice, chocolate drink, fresh and dried fish.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia, 50, is a married woman with nine children, five of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rogelia has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years.

Rogelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Rogelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Abelino

texts.es: Don Abelino trabaja en la reparación de frenos de escape y en la colocación de accesorios a vehículos. Con un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ($2.100) puede comprar material y otros accesorios para la venta. Esto le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Abelino works repairing exhaust brakes and installing car accessories. 

With a loan of two thousand one hundred dollars ($2100) he will be able to buy supplies and more accessories to sell. This will allow him to earn more income and improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to invest in work supplies.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala is a 47 year old mother with 6 children. She runs a business of providing a services to people by cutting grass to earn a living. 

Mala requested for a loan to buy lawn mowing machine, chemicals, celluloid, safety boots, safety uniform, trash bag, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She will expand her business using her profit, she became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy lawn mowing machine, chemicals, celluloid, safety boots, safety uniform, trash bag,

loans.name: Nyanje

texts.en:
Nyanje is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be loyal. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to have several business outlets within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clemantine is 48 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 9 and 24years. They all go school. 

She sells foodstuffs and she has been in a business for the past 20 years. While her husband is a businessman. With the loan, he would like to buy more fruits and vegetable such as: mango,sweet banana and orange for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables such as:mango,sweet banana and orange for sale.

loans.name: Marisol Elisabeth

texts.es:
Marisol es una joven de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, su pareja se dedica a trabajar como agricultor y jornalero, con el tiene una hermosa niña de dos años de edad, la cual se encarga de cuidar con mucho amor, en su casa vive junto a su suegra y se llevan muy bien ya que son una familia muy unida y trabajadora.

Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a el cuido de hortalizas que siembra junto a su esposo en el solar de la casa, pues su esposo pasa trabajando lejos de la vivienda, como familia decidieron hacer un huerto familiar ya que de esta manera no tendrán que ir a la ciudad a comprar las verduras, además en la temporada de café Marisol trabaja en la corta de este, generando un ingreso extra a la familia.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar plaguicidas y venenos para el cultivo de café.

Ella sueña para un futuro con tener mas cultivo de café y seguir cultivando hortalizas.
texts.en:
Marisol is a 22 year-old youth. She studied until 9th grade. Her partner makes a living working as a farmer and day laborer. He has a beautiful two-year-old daughter, which he cares for with lots of love. She lives together with her mother-in-law in her house and they get along very well because they are a close-knit and hardworking family.

She makes a living performing household chores and looking after vegetables that she plants with her husband in the garden at home. Because her husband spends a lot of time working far from home, they decided as a family to make a home garden because, in this way, they did not go to the city to buy the vegetables. In addition, Marisol works harvesting coffee during the coffee season, generating extra income for the family.

She needs this loan in order to purchase pesticides for coffee cultivation.

She dreams of a future involving more coffee cultivation and to continue cultivating vegetables.
