loans.use: to purchase pesticides for coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Tulei

texts.en: Tulei is a woman of 23 years old with 1 child. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, in her village to earn a living. Tulei requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. Tulei joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Trabajadoras De Curupayty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Trabajadoras de Curupayty está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, se formaron con el propósito de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar.
Una de las que integra es Martina, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder ser una mejor microempresaria.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados, y otros, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Trabajadoras de Curupayty Group is in its sixth cycle of the Poverty Stoplight for women formed with the purpose of helping one another to be able to give their families a better quality of life. They are in the elimination of poverty program struggling to improve.

One of the members is Martina who sells food that she makes herself and then sells as a street vendor. She is a hardworking woman fighting to be able to give her family all she couldn’t have.

She is grateful for the opportunity she receives to be a better micro-entrepreneur. She is asking for this loan to buy supplies to make meals such as meat, spices, vegetables, bread, and more so that she can continue working as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, vegetables, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman. She has 1 child. She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes. She hopes that in the future, the business will grow. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of potatoes

loans.name: Nuuese

texts.en: Nuuese is 44 years old. He runs a business of cattle farm in the village to earn a living. Nuuese requested for a loan to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, rope, to help him run the business. He has been doing this for more than a year. Nuuese hopes to use his profit to expand his business. He became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, rope,

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a maize farmer from Gwanki Village. Bala joined Babban Gona in order to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Bala will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Bala now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income. He intends to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields

loans.name: Batool

texts.en:
Batool is 43 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. So that he can generate more income for financially support of his family. 

Batool is applying for loan from Kiva field partner for her husband's shuttering work so that he would be able to buy more raw material for his work.
Batool is thankful to Brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Baballiyo

texts.en:
Baballiyo is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kwari Village. Baballiyo joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Baballiyo suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Baballiyo has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 30 bags of maize this year, Baballiyo can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years now.

Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma, age 39, is a mother of three sons and one daughter. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new variety of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money he finds it difficult. 

This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that his wife, Najma is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

Najma is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new variety of embroidery material for her own embroidery work

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha sells charcoal to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are members of her local community. She is unmarried. 

This is Tabitha's sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully, and she requested a new loan in the amount of Kes 120,000. She will use her loan funds to buy a stock of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Silvester is a married man with 2 children. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to his savings and buy another motorcycle. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add to his savings and buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells African fabrics. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the Kes 16,600 loan to buy a tank to store water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a boutique. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Sunui

texts.en:
Sunui is a 42 year old mother with 1 child. She had a business of sewing clothes and sell them in her community to earn a living. 

Sunui requested for a loan to buy a rolling materials, sewing machine, tape measurement, paint color, paint brush, to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She will use her profit to expand her business. Sunui joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a rolling materials, sewing machine, tape measurement, paint color, paint brush,

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary buys scrap from individual collectors or scavengers, then she organizes it into types such as paper, board, plastic, bottles, and others. She will then sell these items to a junk shop. For some, it’s a filthy job but for Mary, she will do everything to help provide for the needs of her family. She is married to Romeo, a fisherman, and they have four children, two of whom are forced to stop schooling due to financial insufficiency. They are staying in Tigbauan, Iloilo. 

Mary also sells dried fish occasionally. She has little capital for this, so she does the buying and selling when there’s a good opportunity. This rainy season is not a good opportunity for her dried fish vending as well as her husband’s fishing endeavor. Hence Mary wants to concentrate on her scrap business this season. She appeals for PhP 12,000 additional capital for buying scrap. Part of it will be used to buy replacement for her husband’s damaged fishing nets. Hopefully, this will augment her family’s daily needs this rainy season. 

She dreams that someday her family will taste a little comfort in life. She finds strength and inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more scrap for recycling

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. This is considered as one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since they provide commodities for people. 

With this fact, Corazon was enticed to get in touch with this kind of business. She is 49 years old, married to Romulo and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. By now, they are working with determination to pursue the needs of their family. The income they get from the store helps them for their daily expenditures. 

However, what profits they get from the business is sometimes insufficient. It is because at times, she finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products due to financial incapability. This is why, she is requesting PHP 10 000 loan that she will utilize to buy additional products for her inventory. With more products displayed in her store, she can ably have greater increase in her income. 

In due time, she hopes that she grow in progress and that her business will boost in sales. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her inventory

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 26 years old, married with one child.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Melanie has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from fish vending.

Melanie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Jimalyn

texts.en:
Jimalyn is 36 years old and has three children. Jimalyn is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Jimalyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jimalyn requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jimalyn has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jimalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman, 66 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nenita has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell at her local market.

Nenita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell at her local market

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 40 years old, a married woman and a mother of 8 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, age 44, earns her living as a food vendor. She prepares and sells food to members of her community, and she has been engaged in this business for five years. She and her husband have three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Anita requested a loan in the amount of PhP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase ingredients like meat, noodles, fish, and spices for her food production business.

Her goal is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, noodles, fish, and spices for her food production business

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es: Jose es un hombre trabajador de 43 años que se dedica a la agricultura y a la compra y venta de ganado solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera para la producción de leche ya que quiere tener otra fuente de trabajo por que necesita para sustentar los estudios de sus tres hijos, gracias al crédito podra producir leche y queso los cuales vende en Guaranda en el mercado central cada semana, sus sueños es llegar a tener mas ganado, el desafio al que se enfresnta es la falta de empleo, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jose, 43, is a hardworking man who earns a living in agriculture and buying and selling livestock. 

He is applying for this loan to buy a dairy cow for the production of milk. Jose needs additional work to support his three children through school. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to produce milk and cheese to sell in the central market of Guaranda each week.

His dream is to own more livestock, the challenge he is facing is the lack of employment. He enjoys sports in his leisure time.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina, is 46 years old, a married woman and she runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews them and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Sakina has requested a loan of 35000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living

loans.name: Nazeera

texts.en:
Nazeera has successfully built her business selling milk. Previously with the help of Kiva loan she was able to expand her business. Now she makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 50000  to purchase another cow to inflate her milk sales and income level alongside.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her milk sales and income level alongside.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She needs body lotion, sugar, salt, milk, water, slippers, fish,biscuits to help her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $500.00. Julieta is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, sugar, salt, milk, water slippers, fish, biscuits and eggs

loans.name: Binapani-02 Group

texts.en:
Rita, the second lady from the left, runs a tailoring business at home. She has been running this business for the past 2 years. 41-year-old Rita is a resident of Kamrup district in Assam. She is married and is a mother of 2 children. Her household monthly expenses amount to Rs. 6400. Though Rita has been making do with her current income, she wants to earn more to cater to the increased expenses as her children grow older. 

She needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, so she can expand her business and stitch more shirts, skirts, blouses, etc. She hopes to earn at least Rs. 5000 every month, compared to the Rs. 4800 she earns at present.

Rita is joined by 4 other women who seek a loan to expand their individual businesses. She leads the group of 5 women and has applied for a loan to fund the expansion of their businesses. Together, they need a loan of Rs. 50,000. Your loan will help these women expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Sreynei

texts.en:
Sreynei, aged 21, is a third-year student who is studying at a university in the city and she is from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Sreynei is pursuing a bachelor’s degree with a major in Literature. Her parents are rice farmers. 

Now she is applying for a loan because she needs finances to pay for her tuition fees from the third through her fourth year. This loan will help her have enough finances for earning a bachelor’s degree successfully. For her future dreams, Sreynei wants to work in a financial institution with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees for her BA in Literature, from the third through her fourth year

loans.name: Kamaridin

texts.en:
Kamaridin is a cheerful girl and was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1996. She is now living in remote district with her parents and she is single. She graduated technical – pedagogical college with excellence. She will be a teacher of English. She decided to continue her studies and make progress at self-development. She passed interview at pedagogical university and now became a 3rd year student. 

She likes children and wishes to work at school in the future. She needs to pay her education costs and appealed to IMON to get a loan. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay her third year university costs for a BA in English

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en: Selepa is a 45 year old mother with 5 children. She runs a business of selling cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, in her village to earn a living. Selepa requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, to help her with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a single woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

 She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have a modern salon offering a variety of beauty services within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Olevia

texts.en: Olevia is 57 years old with 3 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Olevia requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a   married woman and has seven school going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in his place of operation. 

With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Tarciana

texts.en:
Tarciana is 63 years old and married with one children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Tarciana is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Tarciana has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Teresita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell like banana, mango, orange, papaya to sell to her food stall.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell like banana, mango, orange, papaya, etc to sell to her food stall

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat and other material for her food production business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat and other material for her food production business

loans.name: Puhar Group

texts.en:
Gita hails from the Kamrup distruct in Assam. She is the leader of a group of 5 enterprising women – Gita, Bijuli, Chandrakala, Marami and Tarali. She is married and has a teenaged child. She runs a cloth business of her own at home. She wants to help her husband to contribute to the family financially. Currently, her cloth business earns her a monthly income of Rs 6000. She wants to upgrade her business so she can sell baby clothes, blouses, salwars, etc., thereby adding an additional Rs. 600 to her monthly income.
	
Bijuli runs a hotel business at Mathgharia bazar. Similarly, the remaining members of the group are also engaged in other income generating activities. Realising the need for capital for expanding their business, they formed a group and decided to apply for a loan of Rs. 1,15,000. Your loan will help these women realise their dreams. Gita, Bijuli, Chandrakala, Marami and Tarali are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the upgrading of her clothing business

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim, age 56, is a homemaker residing in Rawalpindi. She and her husband have two sons and three daughters. 

Her husband runs a small restaurant, serving good, fresh tikka boti (a Pakistani barbeque dish) to members of the community. His restaurant is situated in the main market, so many shopkeepers come to his restaurant to eat the delicious food he prepares there. 

Shamim's husband needs to buy crockery for his business, as well as fresh food items. For this reason, Shamim contacted Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. The loan funds will be used for the development of her husband's restaurant business.
 
Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crockery and fresh food items for her husband's restaurant business

loans.name: Sorm's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Siem Reap province, Sorm is 64 years old and a mother of five dependent children. To support her living, she can earn income via buying waste materials for resale and working for others for a fee to earn more income. Sorm mostly got sick because she getting old. She has been involved in her current business for 3 years and she can save her daily income about 17,500KHR per day. 

This is her first microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan in order to buy more materials for resale to produce more income. She hopes that she can get more income from her business to upgrade her living condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials for resale to produce more income.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Prasat Bakong district

loans.name: Sinan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kratie province, Sinan is 46-year-old and a mother of two children. Nowadays, she needs to support only one schoolchild. For her family condition, she earns income via rice cropping as the main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee and catches fish to earn more income. Her rice farm did not have enough water to support, so her rice did not grow so well. She has been involved with her rice farming for years and she can save her daily income about 29,200KHR per day. 

For Sinan, this is her fourth microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has paid back her past loans successfully. The previous loan, it can earn her more income to improve her condition good than before. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay on labor to pumping water into her rice farm. She hopes that her farming can produce a good yield and earns her more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to pump water into her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to support her husband so he can fix his lathe machine and can buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José tiene 70 años el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas y mellocos, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes y asi poder mejorar su tierras y obtener mejores cosechas, realizara las compras en Guaranda, su sueño es comprarse mas terrenos para poder sembrar, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es la falta de transporte y vias para poder trasladarse, y en su tiempo libre le gusta regar agua a las plantas que son muchas es una forma de sentirse libre.
texts.en:
José is 70 years old. He is a farmer. He grows potatoes and mellocos. [Andean tuber plant. The leaf can also be eaten.]

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to improve his land and obtain better crops. He will make the purchases in Guaranda.

His dream is to buy more land to cultivate. The challenges he faces are the lack of transport and roadways. In his spare time he likes to water his many plants. It is a way to feel free.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Joyce Jane

texts.en:
Joyce Jane, age 21, operates a direct sales business, selling Avon and Natasha products to members of her community. She has been engaged in this business for four years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more products from Avon and Natasha to offer for sale to her customers.

In the future, Joyce Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon and Natasha to offer for sale to her customers

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is the age of 56; she is mother of six daughters and two sons. She  lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. 

Therefore, Nasreen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Nasreen is so much thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en:
Christo nti is a group consisting of a man and four women. The representative of this group is Lydia, a 56-year-old woman. 
Lydia runs second hand clothing business that sells assorted second hand clothing. Lydia dreams of expanding the business by increasing the stock of second hand clothing, however, the capital she has at the moment is very limited.

Along with other neighbors who have the same problem in their business capital, she has formed a group and has requested a loan from ID-Ghana in the amount of GHS 6,600 to sell second hand clothing, groundnuts, also seamstress and tailoring. Lydia has spent the loan to purchase second hand clothing to her business. The business has grown gradually and would need more capital so that she can serve her customers better. This is her fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch.
She needs another loan to develop her second hand clothing business so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.use: To develop her second hand clothing business so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.name: Bello

texts.en: Bello is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Badamasi Village. Bello joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Bello will have access to the best farming resources on the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Bello now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase improved farming resources that will increase his yields

loans.name: Gheorghe

texts.en:
Gheorghe is a tractor operator from the Blindesti village, Ungheni region in Moldova. He has owned this tractor for more than 15 years. Gheorghe has plowed more than 5000 hectares for his community and has carried thousands of tons of cereals.  In this way Gheorghe helps farmers to sell their products at a good price.  He raises cereals, pigs and chickens and is married. His wife, Tatiana helps him in managing this farm.

He will use the loan to fix his tractor to offer qualitative services to other farmers.

loans.use: to fix his tractor

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en:
Bashiru is a Babban Gona farmer from Karofi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Bashiru no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Bashiru has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bashiru now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Seuiaso

texts.en: Seuiaso is a 43-year-old mother with 3 children. She runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. Seuiaso requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, and butter, to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, and butter

loans.name: Siliu

texts.en: Siliu is a 30-year-old mother with 1 child, who runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Siliu requested a loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Tamate

texts.en: Tamate is a 37 year old mother with 4 children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Tamate requested a loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 31 years old. He is married and they have 2 children. He is a livestock trader who sells cows and goats. He has been in the business for 5 years. 

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use it to buy a cow and goats to sell. He will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business to bring enough income.

loans.use: to buy a cow and goats to sell.

loans.name: Meli

texts.en:
Meli is 43 years old. She is married and they have 5 children. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for 21 years. 

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat flour and other items for sale. 

She will use profits from the expanded business to educate her children and improve their living standards. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, and other items.

loans.name: Cerro Leon Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Cerro León tiene 16 integrantes, donde cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante. Cada una está dando su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo unido.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Selva, quien está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y por medio de ello también poder ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a vender verduras, y comenta que gracias a que siempre tiene buena variedad, ya que ha formado muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas, y así seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group called  Cerro León has 16 members. Each of them puts her best effort into growing and getting ahead. Each of them is giving her best to help her loved ones through working together. 

One of the members is Selva. She is in the poverty elimination program fighting to improve her living conditions and through that, to also help her family. She sells vegetables and remarks that thanks to always having a good variety, she has formed a very good clientele.

She is asking for this loan to buy fresh fruit and thus continue with her sales, as she has been doing, fighting to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a dairy farm and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive area. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farming resources. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank and the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm resources

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 43 years old. She is married and has three children. 

She has been farming for 21 years. This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy storage bags for maize, beans and green grams. 

She will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her husband, who is attending college. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable family.

loans.use: to buy storage bags for maize, beans and green grams.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 39 years old. He is married and has three children. 

He operates a retail shop and has been in business for 10 years. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy inventory of sugar, tea leaves, tissue papers, cooking oil, paraffin, etc. He will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business that will earn enough income to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, tissue papers, cooking oil, paraffin, etc.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia, age 32, is a homemaker living in Rawalpindi. She and her husband have one child. Her husband supports the family by running a general store, where he sells such grocery items as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and biscuits, as well as everyday items like detergent and soap. He manages his household necessities from his store as well. 

The store is flourishing because he has gained many customers, largely because he is a likable person who speaks in a well-modulated tone and earns people's trust. The store has become well-known in the town and is running well.

Because of this upswing in his customer base, Fouzia's husband is enjoying increased sales, but at present he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the increased demand. For this reason, Fouzia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can restock his store with grocery and household goods to offer for sale.

Fouzia offers her thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband restock his store with grocery and household goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa es una mujer de 40 años de edad que todos los días se dedica a la venta de mariscos y por las tardes vende platillos típicos, lo que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Teresa es una mujer de luchadora que vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su nieta de 7 años de edad. Teresa cada día pone todo su empeño en salir adelante, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: mariscos, cangrejos, pescado, para mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Teresa is a 40 year old woman. Every day, she sells seafood and in the afternoon, she sells traditional food. This allows her to support her home. Teresa is a fighter who lives in her own home with her life's companion and their 7 year old granddaughter. Every day, Teresa puts her best effort into getting ahead. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in seafood such as crabs and fish, in order to improve in her sales and her income.

loans.use: to invest in seafood such as crabs and fish, to improve her sales and her income.

loans.name: Abatoni Group

texts.en:
Julienne, age 34, is the leader of the Abatoni Group. "Abatoni" means "beautiful people." The members of the group sell a variety of different products, and they wish to expand their businesses in order to improve their lives and bring about a better future for their families.

Julienne sells construction supplies. She has been running this business for six years. She and her husband have four children, aged between seven and 12 years old, and they all go to school. With her loan funds, she intends to buy more construction supplies to offer for sale. The increased profits from her business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to offer for sale

loans.name: Manuia

texts.en: Manuia is a 27-year-old mother with two children. She runs a small business in her village, selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns to earn a living. Manuia requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, yeast, and a container to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery in the near future using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a bottle of vegetable oil, a frying pan, a wooden spoon, plastic bags, yeast, and a container

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 24 years old with 2 children. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Caroline requested a loan to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2015 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas. Also, to buy children's clothing and blouses to sell, and buy 2 piglets.

loans.name: Ropeka

texts.en: Ropeka is a 23-year-old mother with one child. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Ropeka requested a loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Karla Yaneth

texts.es: Karla de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre,  ella trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada desde hace 4 años,  con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante con su madre, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo pero como no posee suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de duralitas, polines, cielo falso y pago de mano de obra y así vivir más seguras y cómodas.
texts.en: Karla is 30 year old. She lives in her own home with her mother. She has worked as an employee in a private business for 4 years. With what she earns from her job, she is able to get ahead with her mother. She wants to improve her home by changing the roof but since she doesn't have enough capital, she is asking for a loan to buy duralita roof materials, rods, ceiling tiles and to pay for labor so they can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy duralita roofing materials, rods, ceiling tiles and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma raises and sells poultry to earn her living. She has been engaged in this activity for over four years. She cites losses due to disease as one of her primary business challenges. 

She and her husband have been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. The family lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Their greatest monthly expense is school fees. 
 
Fatuma joined Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business. With her Kshs 20,000 loan funds, she will buy chicks and poultry feed.

She dreams of becoming a poultry wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Lube Armida

texts.es:
Lube, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, no pudo seguir porque tenía que ayudarle a su madre a trabajar, está acompañada y su pareja es empleado en un corral, tienen dos hijos que estudian 7° y 1° grado.

Lube, se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos la mayor parte de su vida, pero ahora se dedica a comprar y engordar cerdos y ganado para generar ganancias; su pareja es quien cuida y alimenta el ganado, mientras que ella cuida y alimenta  los cerdos porque los tiene en su casa.

Lube, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos y ganado, para poder crecerlos y venderlos y si puede poder reproducirlos lo hará, para que en futuro pueda tener su ganado propio. 

Los sueños de Lube, son que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que su pareja siga trabajando.
texts.en:
Lube is 32 years old. She went to school up to the seventh grade. She couldn't continue because she had to help her mother work. She is married and her spouse works in a farmyard. They have two children who are in 1rst and 7th grade.

Lube has taken care of the home for most of her life, but now she buys and sells pigs and cattle to generate income. Her spouse cares for and feed the cattle, while she cares for and feeds the pigs, because they are at the house.  

Lube needs the loan to buy pigs and cattle to raise them and sell. If she can breed them, she will, so in the future she can have her own cattle. 

Lube's dream is for her children to stay in school and for her spouse to continue working.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Freedom 2 Group

texts.en:
Comfort is the representative for the Freedom 2 group, which is in its tenth loan cycle with ID-Ghana as a part of the Teshie branch. The group is made up of seven members, who have a variety of different businesses, such as food vending, buying and selling beans, selling slippers, and offering hairdressing services. This loan will benefit each of these micro-businesswomen, including Comfort. 

Comfort joined ID-Ghana five years ago at the invitation of a friend, who is a client of the institution. Comfort is a food vendor who prepares and sells kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fried fish. She reports that she learned this business from her mother 20 years ago.

The loan she is currently requesting will allow her to increase her business capital by buying more corn dough, fish, cooking oil, and firewood, all of which she will use to prepare kenkey and fried fish to offer for sale to her customers. This is a local dish from the Teshie area, and its popularity is bringing her more and more customer patronage. As a single mother, Comfort is grateful that her business allows her to generate income to support herself and her child.
 
When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Comfort says that she likes the health and nutrition education that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy more corn dough, fish, cooking oil, and firewood which she will use to prepare kenkey and fry fish which she will sell to her customer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasoning, canned foods, shampoo, detergent, bath soap, eggs and soy sauce

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella es una mujer de 50 años de edad soltera, cuida de su mama que es una persona que necesita cuidados especiales. Actualmente labora en una tienda de consumo como cajera.
Hace meses fue diagnosticada con un tumor sobre la cornea en su ojo izquierdo, debido a esto ha tenido que ausentarse de su trabajo en varias ocasiones por los fuertes dolores de cabeza que sufre, por lo que corre el riesgo de quedarse sin trabajo. A ella le urge un tratamiento quirúrgico para recuperar su salud.
texts.en:
She is a 50 year old single woman. She takes care of her mother, who needs special care. She currently works as a cashier at a grocery store.

Months ago she was diagnosed with a tumor on the corner of her left eye. Because of this she has had to miss work on several occasions because of the strong headaches she suffers from. Therefore, she runs the risk of being left without work. It is urgent for her to receive surgical treatment in order to recover her health.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora casada y muy trabajadora, desea apoyar a su papa -quien es  viudo- ya que el señor presenta un problema grave de periodontitis severa lo que le prvoco la  ausencia del 85% de sus piezas dentales, lo que le impide alimentarse adecuadamente. Sin embargo los ingresos de la señora no le alcanzan para poder apoyar a su papa,  ella es el único sustento de su familia conformada por 4 hijos.
texts.en:
She is married, and she is a very hard-worker. She wishes to support her father, who is a widower. He has a serious periodontal problem, which caused the loss of 85% of his teeth. This impedes adequate feeding.

She does not earn enough to be able to support her father. She is the sole support for their family, which is comprised of four children.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Vaila

texts.en:
Vaila, age 24, is a farmer. She plants, harvests, and sells cabbages, cucumbers, and eggplant in her village to earn a living. 

Vaila joined SPBD this year, and she has requested a loan in order to buy cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant seeds, as well as a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer. This investment will allow her to improve her farm and increase her yield. 

She hopes to use her expected profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, cucumber, and eggplant seeds, as well as a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, and a backpack sprayer for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mats to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN HOMBRE CASADO DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS, ESTA EN ESPERA DE QUE NAZCA SU PRIMER HIJO, SU MUJER NO HABÍA PODIDO EMBARAZARSE POR CUESTIONES DE INFERTILIDAD QUE AFORTUNADAMENTE SUPERO, SIN EMBARGO SU EMBARAZO FUE DIAGNOSTICADO DE ALTO RIESGO POR LO QUE PARA EL NACIMIENTO DEBERÁ SER POR CESÁREA PARA QUE NO CORRA RIESGO SU BEBE. LOS INGRESOS DE EL NO SON MUY ALTOS YA QUE TRABAJA COMO VIGILANTE Y SU ESPOSA POR LA CUESTIÓN DE SU EMBARAZO TUVO QUE DEJAR DE TRABAJAR.
texts.en:
He has been married for several years. He is awaiting the birth of his first child. His wife was not able to get pregnant due to infertility issues. Fortunately, she overcame those problems. Nevertheless, her pregnancy was diagnosed as high risk. Therefore, the birth needs to be by cesarean so that there is no risk to the baby.

He does not earn very much because he works as a security guard. His wife had to stop working because of her pregnancy.

loans.use: to pay for a cesarean birth.

loans.name: Zulola

texts.en:
Zulola was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She is living in a beautiful scenic natural place with her family. Zulola is married and has two children. 

Zulola is a bright woman. She had a dream to be a student and get a higher education degree, so she chose to study management. She is a third-year student and studies with excellence. She wants to graduate from her studies with excellence and find a good occupation. 

Zulola is asking financial support to pay for her higher education costs. She awaits Kiva lenders' understanding and support.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education costs

loans.name: Esalyn

texts.en:
Esalyn is a 45-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has eight children. Her oldest child is 34 years old and her youngest child is 11 years old. 

To earn a living, Esalyn and her husband have been doing a fishing business. They have been doing this business for 30 years. They work hard to provide the needs of their children. 

Esalyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing material such as a fishing net, fishing knot and fishing weighs to improve their livelihood. 

In the future, she wishes to send all her school-aged children to school to finish a degree.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fishing knot and fishing weighs

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Dauda Village. Bitrus joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

In the past, Bitrus suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Bitrus will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Bitrus now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Tafagamanu

texts.en:
Tafagamanu is 52 years old with four children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. 

Tafagamanu requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tube (seedling), taro roots (seedling), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals which will assist her to run the business. 

Tafagamanu joined SPBD in 2015, and she hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, banana tube (seedling), taro roots( seedling), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 60 years old. He is married with six children aged between 12 and 26 years. They all go to school and one of them is in the University called ULK. 

Fidele is a constructor and he has been doing a business for the past six years, while his wife is a business lady. 

With the loan, Fidele would like to pay school fees. After paying school fees, he plans to make more savings in his business.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a Babban Gona farmer from Bakutaje Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Dahiru no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably. 

This season Dahiru has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dahiru now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Nyonko Do Group

texts.en:
Yaa, age 52 and unmarried, offers a variety of items for sale to earn her living. Her wares include charcoal, yam, tomatoes, fresh fish, rice, pepper, onion, garlic, and ginger. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and has gained a positive reputation in her community. She lives with her child in Teshie, an urban area in the greater Accra region.

The main hardship that Yaa faces is lack of capital. Due to her low income, Yaa has no collateral and therefore cannot get a loan from other banks or credit institutions. This is Yaa's third loan with micro-finance institution ID-Ghana, and the other members of her group respect her and appreciate her companionship.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more charcoal, vegetables, and spices to offer for sale. With her business profit, Yaa hopes to bring health and happiness to her family, to see her business flourish, and to ensure the education of her child to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, vegetables, and spices to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, coffee, shampoo, insect repellent, and detergent for her general store.

loans.name: Avzaldin

texts.en:
Avzaldin is the resident of J. Rumi district. He is 27 years old, married, and a father of two children. 

Avzaldin has been engaged in agriculture for many years. This year, he hopes that his farming will produce more income. After harvesting the vegetables, Avzaldin and his wife plan to plant dry-season crops to make more income for their family. But in order to do so, Avzaldin needs more capital, so he decided to ask for a loan. 

With this loan, he will buy some more fertilizers and good seeds that will help him to get a high yield. Avzaldin hopes that he will get higher income from selling these crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Fishing is the source of income in most communities in Concepcion, Iloilo. Nilda and her husband live in one of those communities that are engaged in the fishing business. They have been doing this business for 30 years to earn a living. 

Nilda is a 45-year-old woman and has seven children. Her oldest child is 28 years old and her youngest child is two years old. She dreams of improving their livelihood and having enough money to send all her school-aged children to school in order for them to have a better life in the future. 

As for now, Nilda needs funds to buy materials used for fishing such as a fishing net, fishing knots and fishing weights.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fishing knots and fishing weights.

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es:
Rosa, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor en pequeño, actualmente no tienen hijos y solamente vive con su esposo. 
 
Rosa, tiene una tienda desde hace 1 año y también tiene una venta de pupusas desde hace 8 meses, su horario de atención es de las 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. en la tienda y los fin de semana hace la venta de pupusas. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar productos para la tienda como jabón, pan, detergente, huevos, arroz, frijoles, etc. Todo para poderla hacerla más grande; anteriormente se le otorgó un crédito para la tienda también y le fue de mucha ayuda.  

Los sueños de Rosa son, aumentar la demanda de clientes, para que su negocio siga en la prosperidad y en futuro hacerlos más grandes sus negocios.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and studied until the ninth grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer in small. They do not have kids and she only lives with her husband.

Rosa has had a store from one year and also has been selling pupusas for 8 weeks. Her hours of work are from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. in the store, and she sells pupusas during the weekends.

The loan that she needs is to buy products for the store such as soap, bread, detergent, eggs, rice, beans, etc. All of this is so she can make it bigger; previously she received a loan for the store and it was very helpful.

Rosa's dreams are to increase the demand of the customers, so that her business continues to prosper and in the future she can make her business bigger.

loans.use: to purchase products for the store such as soap, bread, detergent, eggs, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a Babban Gona farmer from Badamasi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Dahiru no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably.  

This season Dahiru has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dahiru now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Seseme Girls School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Peace; she is the Head Teacher of Seseme Girls School, a girls' school with 500 students in the Rural area of Kisoro. 

Seseme School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system & Tulip filters to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Seseme School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Peace ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Apex Super School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Kasumba; he is an Administrator at Apex Super School, a mixed school with 200 students in the Rural area of Mbale. 

Apex Super School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulips water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a set of 5 Tulips, which will be enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Apex Super School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Kasumba ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, glue, nails, fabric, screws, and other items necessary to make his products.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Unidas, es un grupo nuevo, en donde las 16 mujeres se dedican a trabajos rurales, ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas que se dedican a la cría de animales.
Una de las que integran este grupo es la Sra. Wilma, una mujer muy sacrificada que empieza su trabajo desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Ella cría animales de corral, como gallinas, patos, cerdos y otros tipos de animales, y a través de la venta tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con la cría de los mismos y también poder seguir así con su negocio.
texts.en: The Mujeres Unidas committee is a new group of 16 women who a rural jobs. They are self-sacrificing women who raise animals. One of the members is Wilma. She begins her work in the early morning hours of the day, and works until very late at night. She raises farm animals such as chickens, ducks, pigs and other animals, and by selling them she has the means to support her loved ones. She seeks this loan in order to buy animal feed for her animals, and in this way be able to continue raising them and also be able to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Nelson Omar

texts.es: Nelson es un joven trabajador de 20 años de edad que todos los días pone todo su esfuerzo para salir adelante apoyado en su pequeño negocio de venta de fruta, actividad que le permite sostener a su familia. Nelson vive en casa de su propiedad en compañía de su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 2 meses de edad que es su mayor alegría. Nelson desea aumentar sus ventas y para ello ha decidido surtir su mercadería, ya que por el momento su mayor venta son las naranjas pero él desea invertir en más fruta, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papaya, sandia, mandarinas, melones, entre otras frutas para vender en su negocio el cual es de éxito al estar a la orilla de una carretera interdepartamental.
texts.en: Nelson is a young worker who is 20 years old and every day he puts all of his efforts to succeed in supporting his small business selling fruit, an activity that allows him to support his family. Nelson lives in his own home along with his wife and their small daughter who is two months old and is his greatest joy. Nelson desires to increase his sales and has therefore decided to fill his merchandise, since for the moment his greatest sales are orange but he wants to invest in more fruit. This is why he is requesting a loan from Fusai to invest in: papaya, watermelon, tangerines, melons, among other fruits to sell in his business which is successful being at the edge of an interdepartmental highway.

loans.use: to invest in: papaya, watermelon, tangerines, melons, and other fruits to sell in his business which is successful.

loans.name: José Neftali Atilio

texts.es:
José, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tienen 3 hijos. 

José, tiene 13 años de trabajar en un corral, pero además siembra maíz, el trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad.- Además de engordar cerdos y alimentarlos, también le ayuda a su pareja en los oficios domésticos. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes para la milpa, porque sembrara 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz a 20 minutos de su casa.

José, desea obtener una buena cosecha para vender una parte de los granos y para la alimentación de su  familia y seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old, completed third grade in school, is married, his spouse is a housewife, and they have 3 children. José has worked on a farm for 13 years and he also grows corn, work he does in his community. In addition, he raises pigs and helps his wife with the chores around the house.

He seeks a loan to buy farming supplies such as manure and fertilizer for his cornfield., because he will plant 7000 square meters of corn in a location 20 minutes from his home.

José wishes to have a good harvest in order to sell part of his grain and to feed his family, as well as continue helping his children attend school.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as manure and fertilizer for his cornfield.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: Amparo es madre de cinco hijos y está separada de su pareja sentimental, ella es una entusiasta mujer de 69 años de edad, que se dedica al comercio de mercancías varias, hace quince años emprendió su idea de negocio con la intensión de generar ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y ha logrado mantenerse a través del tiempo siendo preferida por sus compradores.  Ella ofrece comodidad en sus pagos y vende sobre pedido, sin embargo su capital le es insuficiente para responder oportunamente a las necesidades de sus clientes y para mitigar esta situación, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar prendas de vestir, calzado y alimentos.  Su meta a futuro es capitalizarse para responder a la demanda, así mismo ayudar con la educación de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Amparo is mother of 5 children and she is no longer with her life partner. She is an enthusiastic 69-year-old woman who works selling various products. 

She started her business 15 years ago with the objective of generating enough incomes to pay for her personal expenses, and she has managed to keep the business going through time by being the favorite among her customers. She offers them convenient payment options and sells according to the customer’s order. 

However, her capital is not enough to cover her clients’ demands on time, and in order to mitigate this situation she is requesting her first Kiva loan through the foundation Mario Santo Domingo to buy clothing, shoes and food. 

Her goal for the future is to have enough resources to meet her clients’ demands, and to support her grandchildren with their studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and food.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara and her husband and newborn son (he is 10 months old) live in Stepanavan city of Lori region. She has higher pedagogical education and already 18 years of work experience in this field. Now she works at the local school as a teacher of Armenian History.

She also has a group of pupils to whom she gives paid private courses of Armenian History at her house. In this way, she prepares the pupils for the entrance exams. Nara mentions that she likes her occupation very much and does her best to make her pupils become interested in the subject, which she considers so important for any pupil to study.

Nara is asking for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, as she wants to buy a computer and also one very important book that she greatly needs during her private courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also one very important book that she greatly needs during her private courses.

loans.name: Shirinkan

texts.ru: Ширинкан, 31 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, занимается торговлей лепешек на рынке. Покупает их в пекарне затем перепродает. Благодаря упорному труду Ширинкан имеет стабильный ежемесячный доход в размере 12,000 сом (KGS). У Ширинкан и ее супруга появилась возможность начать собственное дело - перепродавать уголь. В этих целях Ширинкан и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) - на покупку автомобиля для развоза и перепродажи угля. Доходы от кредита Ширинкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнес деятельности.
texts.en: Shirinkan is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a higher education. She sells flatbreads at the market. She buys them from a bakery then resells them. Thanks to hard work, Shirinkan has a stable monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS). Shirinkan and her husband have the opportunity to start their own business: reselling coal. With this goal, Shirinkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy a car for transporting and reselling coal. Shirinkan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business activities.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport and resell coal.

loans.name: Andaza

texts.ru: Андаза, 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается швейным делом. На данный момент у Андазы есть 4 швейные машины, заказы принимает от местных жителей. Благодаря упорному труду, ежемесячная прибыль Андазы составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Андаза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ткани для пошива одежды на летний сезон. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и мечтает открыть собственный швейный цех.
texts.en:
Andaza is 45 and married with two children. She has a high school education and works as a seamstress as the primary source of income for her family. At the moment she has four sewing machines and takes orders from local residents. Thanks to her hard work, her monthly income is 18,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Andaza has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase fabric for sewing summer clothing. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and dreams of opening her own atelier.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make summer clothing for her customers

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур, 47 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, на протяжении 10 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 овцы. На 1,38 Га земли она выращивает клевер для реализации. Бизнес приносит Айнур хорошую ежемесячную прибыль в размере 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку поливной земли для увеличения объемов сбора урожая. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса и накопить на строительство дома.
texts.en: Ainur is 47 years old, married, and raising two children. She has a higher education. She has been rearing animals and growing crops over the course of ten years. She has two cows and two sheep, and she grows clover for sale on 1.38 hectares of land. The business fetches Ainur a good monthly profit of 19,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy some irrigated land in order to increase the size of her harvest. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in increasing her business and saving up to build a house.

loans.use: to buy some irrigated land in order to increase her plot of land and grow organic produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hog fattening supplements.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama kuña Katupyry,  es un grupo nuevo, están en el primer ciclo con 16 integrantes. Todas con espíritu emprendedor y ganas de superación, todas quieren ayudare para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Graciela es integrante de este comité, se la distingue por ser una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora., que lucha por su familia y por sus seres queridos. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida que pudo montar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio y con el cual mantiene a su familia y les da una calidad de vida digna.
Graciela pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, panificados, frutas y otros productos para poder surtir bien su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee is called Kuna Katupyry, it is a new group that is in its first cycle with 16 members. They all have an enterprising spirit and the desire to improve, they all want to help to be able to improve their living conditions. 

Graciela is a member of this committee, she stands out for being a very hard-working and enterprising woman, that fights for her family and her loved ones. She has a well stocked pantry that she managed to set up with a lot of effort and sacrifice. From this she is able to look after her family and provide them with a respectable quality of life. 

Graciela is asking for this loan to be able to buy vegetables, meats, baked goods, fruits and other products to stock her business well and from this to be able to carry on with her sales and to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, baked goods, fruits and other products

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mario, de 41 años de edad, no estudio, pero aprendió a leer y a escribir por sus medios, está acompañado desde hace 22 años, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, el mayor de sus hijos ya se acompañó y los otros dos están estudian.
