Mario, se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 16 años, este oficio lo aprendió cuando trabajaba como ayudante y lo ponían a pegar ladrillos y bloques, él prestaba mucha atención a lo que hacían los albañiles experimentados; ahora hace el trabajo de forma independiente y su hijo mayor le ayuda en el trabajo, pero también trabaja con ganado de repasto, para criarlo y venderlo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos novillos.

A futuro desea ver sus hijos preparados académicamente y apoyar a su hijo mayor para que construya su casa.
texts.en:
Mauro, 41 years old, did not attend school but learned to read and write on his own. He has had a life partner for 22 years. His partner takes care of the domestic chores. His eldest child is accompanied and the others are studying.

Mauro has worked as a mason for 16 years. He learned this trade while working as an assistant learning to lay blocks and bricks. He paid close attention to what the experienced masons did. Now he works independently and his eldest son helps with the work.

But he also raises and sells cattle. He needs this loan to buy two bulls.

In the future he wants to see his children academically prepared and help his eldest son build his house.

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a hardworking woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home. Naseem is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching.

However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as thread of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes to get an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as thread of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Raul Ernesto

texts.es: Raúl de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres y sus dos hijos, el posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 10 años, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando el servicio sanitario con fosa, el baño y otros arreglos en la vivienda, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción necesarios y pago de mano de obra y así poder vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
Raúl, 33, lives in his own home with his parents and his two children. He has had a small store for 10 years.

He wants to improve his home by installing a toilet with a septic tank in the bathroom and making other modifications to his home. He doesn't earn enough money from his sales to do the work, so he's requesting a loan to buy the necessary construction supplies and to pay for labor.

As a result Raúl and his family will be able to live more comfortably and hygienically.

loans.use: to buy the construction supplies he needs and to pay for labor

loans.name: Amanda Maricruz

texts.es: Amanda de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, cuanta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a las ventas la cual lo hace de manera ambulante, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y con la ayuda de su esposo han podido salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener  mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Amanda is 39 years old. She lives in her own home with her life partner. She sells fruits and vegetables. She has been doing this work for more than ten years as a street vendor.

With what she obtains from her profits and with the help of her husband they have been able to get ahead.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetabls at wholesale in order to continue her work and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Lournie

texts.en:
Lournie and her husband are engaged in a fishing business in Concepcion, Iloilo. They have been doing this business for 10 years to earn a living. 

Lournie is a 33-year-old woman and has 4 children aged 12, 10, 8 and 4 years old. She dreams of sending all her children to school to have a better means of living in the future. 

She is asking for a loan to help her improve their livelihood. With the funds she is asking for, she plans to buy new fishing materials such as fishing net, fishing knots (rope) and fishing weights.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing knots (rope), and fishing weights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pandan leaves and dye.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 35 years old and single with four school-going children aged between two and 13 years old. 

She has been into poultry farming for the last three years now and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

Pamela has applied for her second loan of  KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya, and she plans to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

She intends to use the anticipated profits from her business to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of expanding her business for self sustainability, and of having her own home.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Maria Corina

texts.es:
María, de 52 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido a que sus padres no contaban con mucho dinero, es madre soltera y tiene 7 hijos, pero solo dos viven con ella y trabajan en un corral. 

María, desde hace 18 años se dedica a la venta de tamales y a hacer pan, aprendió hacerlo todo eso por medio de su madre, la venta la realiza dos veces por semana y sale a vender en la comunidad y le ayuda una nuera  y su hija. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar maíz, harina, levadura y para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 

María, espera obtener una buena cosecha de la milpa y además desea seguir vendiendo pan y tamales.
texts.en:
María, 52, didn't have the opportunity to go to school because her parents didn't have a lot of money. She's a single mother and has seven children. Only two of them live with her, though, and they work in a corral.

María has earned a living for 18 years selling tamales and making bread, work she learned from her mother. Twice a week she goes out into the community to make sales; a daughter-in-law and her daughter help her.

She needs the loan to buy corn, flour, and leavening, as well as agricultural supplies to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

María hopes to get a good harvest from her cornfield, and she also wants to continue to sell bread and tamales.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, and leavening, as well as agricultural inputs to plant 7,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 66 years old and married with five children, one of whom is still in school.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Kasiet

texts.ru: Касиет, 63 года, вдова, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, на пенсии. Дети работают и помогают Касиет материально. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1995 году, благодаря упорному труду Касиет, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Касиет обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 коров и овец для увеличения поголовья. Инвестирование в бизнес-деятельность позволит Касиет приумножить количества скота и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Kasiet is 63 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children. She has secondary education and is on a pension. Her children are working and they help her financially.

In search of an additional income for her family, Kasiet works with livestock breeding, after having started this in 1995. Thanks to Kasiet's persistent work, her farm currently has four cows and ten sheep.

With an aim to further develop her business, Kasiet turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase four cows and some sheep to increase her income. Investing in her business allows Kasiet to increase the number of livestock and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase four cows and some sheep in order to increase her income

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 31 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Chona is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Chona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing, and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale men's and women's clothing, perfumes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Gerber Antonio

texts.es: Gerber de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 15 años al cultivo de maíz y frijol, vende sus productos agrícolas a los comerciantes que se encuentran cerca de su casa, gracias a las ventas que realiza puede salir adelante, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, sulfato, formulas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Gerber, who is 47 years old, lives in his own home with his wife. He has worked for 15 years growing corn and beans. He sells his agricultural products to sellers who live near his home. Thanks to the sales he makes he can get ahead. The client is asking for a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, sulfate, formulas, etc., as he shows in the photograph to be able to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, sulfate, formulas, etc.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a 39-year-old woman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and has two children ages 12 and 11 years old. Her husband is a teacher, while she is engaged in a sari-sari store business. Aside from this, she also buys and sells RTW (ready to wear) items such as shirts, pants, dresses, bags, slippers, shoes, and some beauty products like lotion, makeup, and perfumes.

Riza has been doing this business for 12 years and has become proficient in this field. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell like slippers and shoes. She also needs additional capital to buy sacks of rice for her sari-sari store.

Riza dreams to be successful in her field of business to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, slippers, and shoes.

loans.name: Defence

texts.en:
Defence is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a food stall where she cooks meat and other meals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of meat and other food ingredients.

Her business goal is to have a mega-restaurant within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat and other food ingredients.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Merly has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Mary Lou is 35 years old and has one child. She is married, and her child is in school.

Mary Lou is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Lou has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Mary Lou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нурила, 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается торговлей товарами хозяйственного назначения. В обороте есть товар на сумму 300,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента в магазине. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и постройку нового дома для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Nurila is 45 years old, married and is raising three children together with her husband. She has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with selling home product. She has goods worth 300,000 som (KGS) in stock. The monthly income is around 22,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurila turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to increase the assortment in her store. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business, and in builing a new home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase products for retail sale in order to increase the assortment in her shop.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María, de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de medicinas, tiene 1 hija que ya no depende de ella porque está acompañada. 

María, tiene más de 15 años de trabajar en la compra y venta de ropa o productos de acuerdo a la temporada. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar ropa y venderla.

Sus sueños son, hacer más grande su negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 41 years old, studied until 5th grade. She is married, and her husband works selling medicine. She has 1 daughter who no longer depends on her because she has a partner.

Maria has been working for 15 years reselling clothes and other products according to the season.

She will use the loan to buy clothes and sell them. 

Her dreams are to expand her business and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sell them.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is 55 years old. She is a responsible mother of one son. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which comprises three persons.

She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people, at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult.

So, Farhat is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Farhat is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and stitching material for her own work.

loans.name: Hilcia Veronica

texts.es:
Hilcia, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 9 meses de nacido, viven con dos sobrinos los cuales están a su cargo, porque su hermana no se encentra en el país. 

Hilcia, tiene un negocio de tortillas desde hace dos años, se decidió hacer la venta propia desde su casa; antes tenía un pequeño comedor, pero debido a problemas sociales lo cerró, la venta de tortillas la realiza todos los días desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 10:00 a.m. y luego lo reanuda de 1:00 p.m. a 3:00 p.m. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar maíz, porque debido a la sequía los precios han incrementado y antes de que suban más, quiere comprarlos; además comprara una plancha para hacer pupusas, porque sabe cómo hacerlas. 

El sueño de Hilcia, es mejorar el puesto donde hace las tortillas y darle lo mejor a su hijo y que no se le enferme.
texts.en:
Hilcia, who is 29 years old, has a high school education. She is a single mother and has one son who is nine months old. They live with two of her sister's children who are under her care because her sister is out of the country.

Hilcia has had a tortilla business for two years. She decided to make her sales from her house. Before, she had a small eatery, but because of social issues, she closed it. She sells tortillas every day from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 a.m. Then she resumes selling from 1:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m..

She needs the loan to buy corn; due to the drought, prices have increased and she wants to buy more before they go up again. In addition, she wants to buy a griddle for "pupusas" [thick, handmade corn tortillas stuffed with savory ingredients], because she knows how to make them.

Hilcia's dream is to improve her stand where she makes the tortillas, to give her son the best, and for him to not get sick.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in tomatoes, onions, papaya, mangos, watermelon, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Metotisi

texts.en:
Metotisi is a 32-year-old mother with three children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living.

Metotisi requested a loan to buy a box of twist ties, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business.

She has been doing this for more than two years. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of twist ties, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. James operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

James will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will own many business outlets. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Don Juan, es un hombre de sesenta y nueve años, con semblante alegre y sonrisa honesta,  se dedica a ser mecánico y tiene un taller de reparaciones de carro y bicicletas. Desde hace un par de años descubrió que los créditos son una gran forma de prosperar, de hecho ya tuvo un primer préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, por el cual está muy agradecido.
En estos momentos, el negocio de Juan, está en crecimiento y por esto ha solicitado la ayuda de otro financiamiento de Kiva y MiCrédito, para ocuparlo en compra de herramientas, llantas, aceite, entre otras cosas necesarias para su taller. En un futuro desea invertir en buenas maquinarias, para tener un negocio moderno, donde pueda atender todo tipo de carros.
texts.en:
Don Juan is a 69-year-old man, with a happy demeanor and an honest smile. He works as a mechanic, and he has a repair workshop for cars and bicycles. Two years ago, he discovered that loans are a great way to prosper. Indeed, he already had his first Kiva loan together with MiCredito, for which he is very grateful.
At this time, Juan’s business is growing and this is why he has asked for more financing from Kiva and MiCredito, to use to purchase tools, tires, oil, among other necessary things for his workshop. In the future, he hopes to invest in good machinery, to have a modern business where he can tend to every type of car.

loans.use: to buy tools, tires, oil, among others things.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. Ruth operates a retail business where she sells fruit. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Ruth will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Saturnino Tovias

texts.es:
Saturnino, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 2 hijos que viven con ellos. 

Saturnino, se dedica a la compra y venta de electrodomésticos desde hace 2 años, este negocio lo aprendió por medio de otras personas a las cuales les ayudaba a vender; el sale a vender sus productos a las comunidades y se los deja por cuotas mensuales y su horario de trabajo es desde las 8:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

Él préstamo lo ocupa para comprar electrodomésticos como planchas, licuadoras, radios, trasteros y hamacas; 
estos productos los comprar de contado y luego los vende a sus clientes al crédito.

El sueño de Saturnino es, colocar un pequeño local en la comunidad y que sus hijos sigan estudiando y espera darle lo mejor a ellos igual a su esposa.
texts.en:
Saturnino, 29, studied up to eighth grade. He's married and his wife is a homemaker. They have two children who live with them.

Saturnino has earned a living for two years buying and selling electrical appliances. He learned this business helping other people make sales. He goes out into the community to sell his products and leaves them for a monthly fee. His work schedule is 8 p.m. to 3 p.m.

He needs the loan to buy appliances such as irons, blenders, radios, storage bins, and hammocks. He buys the products with cash and then sells them on credit to his customers.

Saturnino's dream is to have a small store in the community and for his children to continue attending school. He also hopes to give them and his wife the best.

loans.use: to buy appliances such as irons, blenders, radios, storage bins, and hammocks to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz  is a 43-year-old, hard-working woman who has five children. 

She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Shahnaz’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Shahnaz has requested a loan in the amount of PKR 45,000. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and lace to consistently meet the demands of her customers. 

She aspires to save money for the family's prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and lace to consistently meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Zoila Orquidia

texts.es: Zoila de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años,  tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pan dulce, gaseosas, detergentes, jugos, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Zoila is 48 years old. She lives with her family in a house that they own. She has had a small store located in her residence for several years. She has many customers because of the variety of products she sells. With what she makes from her sales, she manages to cover some of her household expenses.

Zoila is requesting a loan for the purchase of sweet baked goods, soft drinks, detergents, juices, etc., so that she will be able to make a better income.

loans.use: to buy sweet baked goods, soft drinks, detergents, juices, etc.

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is a 28-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has two little children ages six and four years old. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps her husband with this business. They have been engaged in this fishing business for three years. Aside from fishing, Maria Liza also has other businesses like buying and selling dried fish. She works hard to improve their livelihood. 

Maria Liza is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell, and to buy a motorcycle to be used in transporting to her business easier. She also has to pay laborers in her business. 

In the future, Maria Liza plans to increase her business so that she has enough money to provide the needs of her children, like sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, a motorcycle, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Gulai

texts.ru: Гулай, 52 года, вдова, мать 4 детей. По хозяйству помогают дети. У Гулай - высшее образование, работает учителем в местной школе. Также занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав около 30 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Гулай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 коров и 40 овец. На 1,72 Га земли выращивает люцерну. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 30,600 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulai is 52 years old, a widow and the mother of four children. Her children help her with the household. Gulai has higher education. She works as a teacher at the local school. She also works with crop production and livestock breeding after having started with this around 30 years ago.

Thanks to Gulai's persistent work, her farm currently has eight cows and 40 sheep. She grows alfalfa on 1.72 hectares of land. Her monthly income is up to 30,600 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulai turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase livestock to increase her herd. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and in renovating her home.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 60 years old, married with four children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, canned goods, coffee, cereals, noodles, fabric conditioners, biscuits, etc. to sell. Estrella has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 32 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Estrella aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, canned goods, coffee, cereals, noodles, fabric conditioners, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is 40 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Bebelyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Bebelyn has been farming vegetables for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bebelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.es: Pedro es un joven emprendedor que encontró en las redes sociales una oportunidad para exhibir prendas de vestir, provenientes de países como Estados Unidos y Japón. Decidió incorporarse en este negocio por la facilidad de comprar y vender por internet, así mismo la gran acogida que presentan estas marcas de ropa en el segmento de la población con que interactúa, le ha permitido tener éxito. Diariamente desde su equipo de cómputo se conecta a las redes sociales y revisa su buzón de mensajes y les envía las cotizaciones de las prendas que le solicitan sus amigos, vecinos y familiares.  Con la finalidad de continuar respondiendo oportunamente a los requerimientos de sus clientes, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir que le han encargado sus clientes.  Su meta a futuro es capitalizarse y lograr la independencia económica.
texts.en:
Pedro is a young businessman that saw an opportunity to use social networks to advertise clothing from countries like the United States and Japan. 

Pedro decided to get involved in this business because of how easy it is to buy and sell via the Internet. These brands of clothing have been well received by those using social networks and Pedro has had a lot of success.   

Pedro connects daily to social networks and checks his messages and sends quotes for the clothes that his friends, neighbours and other people he knows are looking for. 

With the goal of continuing to make the most of this work and responding to his customers wishes, Pedro is applying for his first loan with KIVA via Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy clothing to deliver to his customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to deliver to his customers.

loans.name: Inosia

texts.en:
Inosia is a 56-year-old mother with four children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living.

Inosia requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter and mayonnaise, to assist with the business.

She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers, butter, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 5 años, vende sus productos a comerciantes de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man, whose face has been blurred due to his age (28 years old) and because he lives in a high risk area, has worked in the cultivation of corn and sorghum for 5 years, selling his products to retailers in the area where he lives. This young man lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, etc., and to improve his land, which is featured in the photograph. This way, he can continue with his work, and thus have a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, etc., and to improve his land.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years now.

Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to later sell.

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: Salvador de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el se dedica al cultivo de yuca y sandia se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el cliente está solicitando u crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, formulas, sulfato, abono, agroquímicos, etc. para poder obtener una buena cosecha para generarle buenos ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Salvador is 39 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two daughters. He has been growing yucca and watermelon for 5 years. He sells his products in neighbouring towns and uses what he earns to get by and progress. He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies such as seeds, formula, sulphates, fertiliser, agricultural chemicals, etc. so that he can have a better harvest and therefore earn a greater income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as seeds, formula, sulphates, fertiliser, agricultural chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is a 42-year-old woman who has six children. Her oldest child is 25 years old, and her youngest child is 4 years old.

To earn a living, Rosenie and her husband are engaged in a fishing business like in most of the community in Concepcion, Iloilo. They have been doing this business for 15 years, and they work hard to improve their livelihood for their children. Rosenie wants to send all her children to school to finish their degrees in the future.

She is asking for a loan to help her increase her earning by buying new fishing net and fishing weights.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fishing weights.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be focused.

He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zenaida is 40 years old, and her child is in school.

Zenaida has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her business.

Zenaida has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Faaosofia

texts.en:
Faaosofia is a 42-year-old mother, with four children. To earn a living, she runs a small business, selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Faaosofia requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, and butter to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. 

Faaosofia became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, boxes of canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, and butter.

loans.name: Patricia Evelin

texts.es:
Patricia, de 35 años de edad, está casada, su esposo es empleado, tiene 3 hijos y los 3 están estudiando.

Patricia, se dedica al comercio de verduras desde hace 1 año, este negocio lo aprendió por medio de su tío, quien también se dedica a eso, ella vende las verduras casa por casa y trabaja de 9:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más verdura y para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Patricia, 35 years old, is married, her husband is employed, she has 3 children and all three go to school. 

Patricia has worked selling vegetables for 1 year. She learned this business from her uncle who also works in this job. She sells vegetables from house to house and works from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm.

She needs the loan to purchase more vegetables and to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and to improve her house.

loans.name: Solotetee

texts.en:
Solotetee is a woman of 35 years old with two children. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage, cucumbers, and eggplant in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Solotetee requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
María, de 34 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, está casada, estudio hasta noveno grado y su esposo es mecanico.

María, se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace más de seis años, fue a ese negocio al que ella le mostrado interés y le ha resultado.

María, solicita el crédito para comprar más frutas y verduras, para ofrecer a los clientes en mayor cantidad.

Ella sueña con darles el estudio necesario a sus hijos, para que se superen y no tengan que pasar la misma situación que ella.
texts.en:
34-year-old María has two children, is married and studied until ninth grade. Her husband is a mechanic. María has been selling fruit and vegetables for more than six years. It was this business she was interested in, and it has worked out for her.

María is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables to offer to clients in greater quantities. 

She dreams of giving her children the necessary education so they can better themselves, and so that they do not have to go through the same situation as her.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to offer to clients.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Magdalina has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her business, like sugar, flour, milk, and fruit.

Magdalina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business, like sugar, flour, milk, and fruit.

loans.name: Maria Elsy

texts.es:
Elsy, de 40 años de edad, está casada, su esposo administra una pequeña  tienda junto a ella, tienen un hijo que aún no va a la escuela.

Elsy, es comerciante, ella le ayuda a su esposo a administrar su propia tienda desde hace cinco años.

Elsy, solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como jabón, detergente, pan, arroz y frijoles para surtir la tienda y abastecerla.

Ella, sueña con que un día su negocio sea más grande y que cada vez crezca más y más.
texts.en:
Elsy, 40 years old, is married, her husband runs a small store with her, and they have one child who doesn't go to school yet. 

Elsy is a businesswoman, she has helped her husband to run their own store for the past five years.

Elsy asks for a loan to purchase more products such as soap, detergent, bread, rice, and beans to stock her store. 

She dreams that one day her store will be larger and will continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as soap, detergent, bread, rice and beans to stock her store.

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta sexo grado, está casada, su esposo está en Estados Unidos, tiene dos hijas que aún viven con ella, pero no dependen de ella porque son mayores de edad y ya trabajan.

Cecilia, depende de su esposo y de una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa.

Ella, necesita el dinero para comprar más producto como jabón, detergente, pan, arroz, frijoles, etc. para la pequeña tienda. 

Cecilia, sueña con que su tienda un día sea más grande, pero también desea a futuro mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y construirle un cuarto más.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 55 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade, is married, her husband is in the United States, she has two daughters who still live with her, but they don't depend on her since they are adults and work.

Cecilia depends on her husband and a little store that she has in her house.

She needs the money to purchase more products such as soap, detergent, bread, rice, beans, etc. for her little store.

Cecilia dreams that her store one day will be large, but she also wants in the future to improve the conditions of her house and build an additional room.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as soap, detergent, bread, rice, beans, etc. for her little store.

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
Gloria, de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a vender pan, tiene dos hijos, pero él mayor ya está acompañado y solo su hija de 8 años de edad depende económicamente de ella.

Gloria, desde temprana edad trabaja en la comercialización de frutas y verduras, pero actualmente vende ropa. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar y vender ropa. 

Sus sueños son darle una buena educación a su hija y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria, 47 years old, went to school up to the fourth grade, is married, and her husband works selling bread. She has two children, but the older one is already partnered and only her 8-year-old daughter depends economically on her. 

From an early age, Gloria worked selling fruits and vegetables, but now she sells clothing. 

The loan will be used to purchase and sell clothing.

Her dreams are to give her daughter a good education and to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables and a stove for the restaurant.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa is a Samoan citizen. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a business of selling fish in her community to earn a living.

Temukisa requested a loan to buy a fishing net, cooler, torch, and canoe to help run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business.

Temukisa became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, cooler, torch, and canoe.

loans.name: Balmore Galileo

texts.es: Don Balmore de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) tiene 44 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego venderla a los comerciantes de la zona donde el reside, Don Balmore esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Balmore, 62 years old, lives in his own house with his life partner and their daughter. He works growing basic grains (corn and beans). He has been doing this work for 44 years, which he began with his own capital. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries which are shown in the photo to later sell it to the businessmen in the zone where he lives. Balmore is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. and, in this way, be able to continue with his work to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Valle Carmel Group

texts.es:
Dúo Valle Carmel
La integrante de dúo Valle Carmel ses doña Lucila es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque. Doña Lucila es viuda y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a cuatro hijos los cuales dos están estudiando. Doña Lucila tiene más de diez años de dedicarse a elaborar güipiles los cuales vende en el mercado de la localidad y con esto se ha ayudado a mantener a su familia. Solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos de colores, telas para bordar y materiales para tejer y vender sus tejidos. El sueño de doña Lucila es que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que tengan un mejor futuro en su vida.
texts.en:
Valle Carmel Duo
The member of the Valle Carmel duo is Lucila. She is from the area of San Martin Jilotepeque. Lucila has been working for over ten years making traditional blouses which she sells in the local market and with this she has managed to support her family. She asks for the loan to purchase colored thread, fabric to embroider, and materials to weave and sell her weaving. Lucila's dream is that her children continue studying so that they have a better future in their lives.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to make traditional woven products to sell.

loans.name: Nohemí Adriana

texts.es:
Nohemí es una mujer muy esforzada y trabajadora,  en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, inicio su pulpería en su casa de habitación, con el apoyo incondicional de su madre y de su esposo, logro cumplir su meta de convertirse en una mujer comerciante. Gracias a un primer préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, creció notablemente y diversifico su oferta de productos. 
Ella ha vuelto a pedir la ayuda Kiva y MiCrédito, a través de un préstamo, que utilizara para comprar mercadería, como granos básicos, productos enlatados, detergentes, verduras, entre otros. En un futuro ella desea convertir su negocio en una distribuidora importante para su comunidad, además desea explorar otros negocios.
texts.en:
Nohemí is a determined and hard-working woman, in search of improving her quality of life, she opened her store in her home. With the unconditional support of her mother and her husband, she managed to achieve her goal of becoming a businesswoman. Thanks to her first Kiva loan with MiCrédito, it grew noticeably and she diversified her product offerings. 

She has come back to ask for the support of Kiva and MiCrédito through a loan which she will use to purchase merchandise such as basic grains, canned goods, detergents, vegetables, and more. In the future, she wants to convert her business into a large distributor for the community, in addition she wants to explore other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as basic grains, canned goods, detergents, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Dúo Valles De Bendición Group

texts.es: Dúo Valles de Bendición Este Dúo lo integra Telma de 32 años de edad es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos ya que son animales que se venden muy bien en esta área. Escucho de Fape y Kiva y desea recibir el apoyo de ambos para iniciar su negocio. Tiene buen historial crediticio en el sistema. Y se compromete a ser responsable con sus pagos. ella tiene un hijo por eso está luchando para poder darle lo que necesita para crecer sano. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y concentrado para la crianza y cuando ya esten grandes venderlos a mejor precio. …
texts.en: Telma, 32 years old, is part of The "Dúo Valles de Bendición". She is a native of the area of San Martin Jilotepeque. She works raising chickens, animals that are sold very well in this area. She heard about Fape and Kiva, and would like to get their support to start a business. She has a good credit history, and she promises to be responsible with her payments. She has a son for whom she is struggling to give him all he needs to grow healthy. She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and concentrated feed to raise them, and sell them at a better price when they are already big.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and then sell when they are bigger.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de paletas, sorbetes y helados desde hace mas de 5 años tiene muchos clientes ya que es un producto muy vendible, con las ganancias que obtiene puede salir adelante con su familia, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos helados por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana, 40 years old, lives in her own house with her two daughters. She has worked selling popsicles, sorbets, and ice creams for over 5 years. She has many customers because her product is a very saleable. With the earnings that she gets, she can get ahead with her family. The borrower is asking for a loan to purchase more ice cream products in bulk to be able to continue with her sales and, so, to be able to have more earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase popsicles, sorbets, and ice cream in bulk.

loans.name: Naun Adelso

texts.es: Naun es un hombre trabajador de 42 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace varios años a prestar sus servicios de motorista de transporte público, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con esta fuente de ingresos. Naun habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija de 20 años de edad que es su única compañía y la razón de su esfuerzo. Naun desea ampliar su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para ampliar su vivienda, ya que esta es bastante pequeña y quiere que su hija tenga un lugar propio.
texts.en: Naun is a hard-working man, 42  years old. He is a hard-working man who has worked for a number of years as a public transportation driver, for which he is happy to be able to have this source of income. Naun lives in his own house with his 20-year-old daughter who is his only company and the reason for his efforts. Naun wants to expand his house and for this he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and rebar to expand his house, since it is rather small and he wants his daughter to have her own space.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and rebar to expand his home since it is rather small and he wants his daughter to have her own space.

loans.name: Parental Care P. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Boaz. He is the head teacher of Parental Care P. School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kasese with 1,200 students.

Parental Care P. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 450-litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Parental Care P. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Boaz ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 55 años de edad que todos los días despierta desde muy temprano para iniciar los quehaceres de su hogar y después dedicarse a la elaboración de prendas de vestir y ropa de cama, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años lo que le permite sostener a su familia. Ana vive en su propia vivienda desde hace 16 años cuando junto a su esposo lograron adquirirla con mucho esfuerzo, y con ellos viven sus 3 hijos mayores de edad que le apoyan económicamente y uno de 17 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando. Ana desea invertir en materia prima para continuar su negocio y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: telas, hilos, tijeras, blondas, encajes entre otros productos necesarios para la elaboración de diferentes prendas.
texts.en:
Ana is a 55-year-old woman who wakes up very early every morning to begin her household chores and then makes clothing and bedding. This job, which she has been doing for two years, allows her to support her family. 

Ana has lived in her own home for sixteen years, which she and her husband were able to acquire with a lot of effort. With them live their three grown children who support her financially, and one 17-year-old child who currently finds himself studying. 

Ana wants to invest in raw materials to continue her business so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her clients. She is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: fabric, thread, scissors, open pattern and lace, among other products necessary to make different garments.

loans.use: to invest in fabric, thread, scissors, open pattern and lace, among other products necessary to make different garments.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling spices, which are commonly used in food for taste. She purchases spices in bulk from wholesale markets and then sells them in packs of various sizes to the people of her community. She has become famous for providing good-quality spices in her locality, and earns enough to support a decent life.

She is a responsible mother of two children and needs to earn more to cover her daily expenditures for her family members. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper, and turmeric in large quantities. It will help her to increase her sales and profits alongside for meeting her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper, and turmeric in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat  is a 50-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. 

He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Farhat  has availed herself of a loan of PKR 45,000 for her husband to buy a new engine for the van, so he can provide better service to his customers. 

Farhat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her husband's van.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz  is a 52-year-old, married woman who has been involved in a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 6 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Saul Eneas

texts.es: Saúl de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y esa ha sido la manera de cómo ganarse la vida se dedica a esta actividad desde muy joven por esa razón posee mucha experiencia en el cultivo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Saúl is 38 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He grows corn and beans. This has been his way of making a living. He has been doing this work since he was very young so he has a lot of farming experience.

He is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, compost, pest controls, and herbicides to improve the land shown in the photograph so he can continue working and generating good income.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and herbicides to improve the land

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Michael is 26 years old. He is married with one child. 

He has had a motorcycle business for 2 years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase a new motorcycle and access different routes for wider coverage and additional income. 

With the anticipated income, Michael will be able to educate his child. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a strong income and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle and access different routes for wider coverage and additional income

loans.name: Joseah

texts.en:
Joseah is 33 years old. He is married with five children. He has had a motorcycle business for two years. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle and hopes this will help him open another business. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in business and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help him open another business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married, and she works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling vegetables in the Philippines.  

Cristina is borrowing 17,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nak

texts.en: Nak, 33, is originally from Pursat Province. She is a mother of one little child. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland and earns, on average, USD 10 a day. So far, she has been in this career for ten years. She resides a little bit far from the water source so it is hard and time consuming for her to get water. Due to this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan to dig a pond for household use.  With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can get the water to use easier and spend a shorter time than before. She is thankful for the lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to dig a pond

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta una mujer de 61 años de edad desde hace 36 años cuenta con una pequeña tienda de productos varios, la cual ha logrado mantener gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y su amabilidad, por lo que se siente feliz de poder sacar adelante a su familia. Marta vive en casa de su propiedad, misma en la que tiene su negocio. Marta desea continuar mejorando la atención a sus clientes, por medio de sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual invertirá en: jabón, detergente, champú, arroz, frijoles, pan dulce, entre otros productos para surtir la mercadería de su tienda.
texts.en:
For the last 36 years, Marta, a 61-year-old woman, has had a small store with a variety of products. She has been able to sustain it thanks to her enterprising spirit and good nature, and she is glad to help her family get ahead. 

Marta lives in a home that she owns. It is the same one where she has her business. Marta would like to continue to improve her customer relations through her products. This is why she is seeking a FUSAI loan, which she will invest in soap, detergent, shampoo, rice, beans, and pastries among other products, to stock the merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, and pastries among other products to stock the merchandise  in her store.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 49 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, one of whom is now an adult, and three are school age.

Benedicta has been earning her income from operating agricultural equipment, particularly a rice tractor and a rice thresher for 12 years already. She earns approximately PHP 7,500 each month doing this type of business activity.

She has requested a loan to be used in paying the tuition fee of her child.

Benedicta has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand their business by way of purchasing additional units of rice tractor and rice thresher for them to operate in the nearby municipalities and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her child.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina lives in Napo, San Juan, Larena, Siquijor, and supports her three children by building houses from the ground up. She has applied a loan to buy building material and paints, and to pay her workers.

She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material and paints, and pay her workers.

loans.name: Mernie

texts.en:
Mernie is 51 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by poultry farming in the Philippines. Mernie is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her poultry.

Mernie has been poultry farming for 30 years and earns additional income from rice farming and general store businesses. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her poultry farming business.

loans.name: Elikram

texts.en: Elikram is 45 years old and married. Elikram's family consists of 2 children and his wife. He is from Agdash. Elikram is a farmer, and he started this work about 4 years ago. He has gained a lot of experience at work, but currently he is not happy about the situation of his farm. He loves his family and knows that with a larger and expanded business he can also improve his family's living conditions. Elikram needs money to build a water tank and improve his business. For that Elikram needs Kiva Lenders to support him.

loans.use: to build a water tank and improve his business

loans.name: Dashqin

texts.en: Dashqin is 24 years old. He is a refugee and lives with his parents in an IDP settlement.Dashqin is a farmer, and he started his work about two years ago. He has gained a lot of experience at work, but currently he is not happy about the situation of his farm. Due to a water shortage, he cannot earn enough income. He loves his family and knows that by growing and expanding his business, he can also improve his family's living conditions. Dashqin needs money to buy a water tank and improve his business.So he needs Kiva lenders support.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and improve his business.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара, 39 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. У Гулсары средне-специальное образование, на протяжении 15 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить свое хозяйство. У Гулсары имеется: 2 коровы, 30 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 17,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Гулсара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Гулсара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве, а также хочет накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Gulsara is 39 years old, married, and has four children. Gulsara has a secondary vocational education. She has been growing crops and rearing animals for 15 years. She has been able to develop her farm. Gulsara has two cows and 30 sheep. Her monthly profit is about 17,500 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Gulsara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows to increase her herd. Gulsara plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing the livestock on her farm, and she also wants to save money to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
The business of selling “kwek-kwek” along the streets is very popular these days. It is made from boiled egg covered with flour, deeply fried and skewered on a bamboo stick. It is usually dipped in vinegar with fermented chili and pepper or vinegar with cucumber. And because it’s getting popular, the competition gets stiffer and the supply of raw ingredients diminishes. 

Anacita from Davao City has been in this business for nine years now. She has a lot of competitors these days, and she finds it difficult to purchase eggs, which are the main ingredient in her food stall business. There are times when she sees the opportunity for volume supply of eggs, but her capital is not enough. She yearns to obtain additional capital of 29,000 Philippine pesos that she can use to buy more eggs if the chances arise. It’s her way of staying competitive in this kind of business. 

Anacita complements her husband’s irregular income as a carpenter in order to meet their daily needs as well as the educational expenses of their four children. She plans to put up an eatery in the near future because it will surely give her higher profit. All her efforts will pay off if she sees all her children receive a college diploma and gain a successful career. She meets with her co-fellowship members* at the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for her food stall business

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru:
Гулжамал, 40 лет, она замужем, мама 3 детей. Она очень отзывчивая, трудолюбивая, ответственная, доброжелательная, скромная женщина. Образование у Гулжамал средне-специальное, она работает секретарем, получая заработную плату в размере 4,860 сом (KGS). Также на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 18 овец, лошадь. На участке мерою 0,10 Га Гулжамал выращивает кукурузу и картофель для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Супруг и дети Гулжамал во всем помогают ей по хозяйству. 
Гулжамал давно мечтала открыть собственную птицеферму. У нее уже есть около 10 обычных домашних кур. Стремясь к своей мечте, мае 2015 года Гулжамал прошла обучение на тренинге "Бизнес планирование" в рамках конкурса "Начни свой бизнес", проводимом в южных регионах Кыргызстана. Она стала одной из 35 финалистов конкурса. Накопленные знания позволили Гулжамал составить бизнес-план, она все оценила и решила взять кредит "Стартовый бизнес" в Банке "Бай Тушум" в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Гулжамал планирует приобрести 88 породистых кур-несушек, стоимостью 500 сом (KGS) за единицу. Остальные средства она направит на постройку специального теплого сарая для содержания кур, приобретет сетку, железные листы, стойки, рейки для строительства. Это позволит разводить кур и собирать яйца и зимой. 
Гулжамал планирует ежедневно получать по 1 яйцу с курицы. Основными потребителями яиц будут местные жители, кафе, магазины и школы. Кормом для кур будет служить выращиваемая кукуруза, также с маслобойки Гулжамал будет привозить жмых. По расчетам Гулжамал - ежедневная потребность кур в корме - 100 грамм. У нее уже есть договоренность с местным ветеринаром для постоянного обследования скота и кур. Прогнозная совокупная прибыль Гулжамал увеличится до 17,800 сом (KGS). Развитие нового вида деятельности позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи Гулжамал. Если ее планы реализуются, она планирует с каждым годом наращивать производство.
texts.en:
Gulzhamal is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She is a very sympathetic, hard-working, responsible, kind-hearted, and modest woman. She has a secondary vocational education and works as a secretary, receiving a salary of 4,860 som (KGS). She has also been rearing animals and growing crops for ten years. She has three cows, 18 sheep, and a horse. Gulzhamal grows corn and potatoes on a 0.1 hectare plot of land for sale and for use on her own farm. Gulzhamal's husband and children help her with everything around the farm.

Gulzhamal has long dreamed of opening her own poultry farm. She already has about ten ordinary domestic hens. Reaching towards her dream, in May 2015 Gulzhamal undertook a business planning training course as part of a "Start Your Own Business" competition that was conducted in the southern regions of Kyrgyzstan. She became one of the competition's 35 finalists. This accumulated knowledge has enabled Gulzhamal to compile a business plan. She has evaluated everything and decided to take a "start-up business" loan from Bai Tushum Bank of 50,000 som (KGS). Gulzhamal plans to acquire 88 egg-laying hens costing 500 som (KGS) each. She will direct the remaining funds towards building a special warm barn for keeping the hens, and she will buy netting, metal sheets, stands, and poles for construction. This will enable her to raise the chickens and gather eggs even in winter.

Gulzhamal plans to receive one egg per chicken each day. The main consumers of the eggs will be local residents, cafes, shops and schools. The corn that she has grown will serve as feed for the chickens, and also using a churn Gulzhamal will get corn oil cake. According to Gulzhamal's calculations, the chickens' daily requirement for feed is 100 grams. She already has an agreement with a local veterinarian for ongoing monitoring of her livestock and chickens. Gulzhamal's forecast gross profit will grow to 17,800 som (KGS). The development of a new type of business will enable Gulzhamal to improve her family's well-being. If her plans are realized, she plans to increase production each year.

loans.use: to start a new business by buying 88 hens and constructing a special poultry barn.

loans.name: Siyavus

texts.en: Siyavus is from Agdash. He is 32 years old, and at this young age, is very energetic and passionate. He is single and is living with his family.He is a farmer and is a very good and sociable person concerning treating the customer. Siyavus is the only one working in the family and is taking care of the needs in the family, which consists of a very old mother and father. Currently Siyavus is very ill. He has problems in his gall bladder. There are some stones in his gall bladder, so Siyavus has to undergo an operation. For that, he needs a loan to buy drugs and to get the operation. He needs Kiva lenders’ support.

loans.use: to buy drugs and to get an operation

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en: Sabira is 56 years old and married a refugee. She is a widow with 4 children. Sabira is a successful and very diligent woman. Sabira started to work in her field 3 years ago . She wants new fruit trees, to grow different fruits and then sell them on the market. But, for this, she has to have some funds. With this loan she will purchase more land and sow more seeds.So Sabira needs Kiva lenders to support.

loans.use: to have new fruit trees to grow different fruits to sell.

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
As a husband and wife, Fatima and Reyad started their own business to provide a living for their children. They have five children and they need a lot of care.

Reyad is working for a low income and he cannot cover all his family`s needs. That's why Fatima decided to help him by starting her small business selling household and kitchen supplies.

After that, Reyad felt that Fatima`s business was working well and doing well at improving their life with their children, so he thought to partner with her and develop the business to increase their income. Fatima said that she is excited to work with Reyad. She believes that the business will be better with him. Therefore, they applied for a group loan to do the first step and buy a large quantity of household and kitchen supplies to sell and to add new kinds of products. Fatima is the group leader.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of household and kitchen supplies to sell and add new kinds of products.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma, 37 years old, lives in Jarash and is a single lady. She opened her business sewing women's clothes and coats from individual orders that she receives. Then she took a loan and used it to develop and buy new sewing machines. Salma is a very ambitious woman who is dreaming of being a successful designer and having a big sewing shop. Lately, Salma`s family faced financial problems, so she gave them all the money she had and now she does not have enough money to buy what she needs in fabric, yarn and tools. Therefore, she applied for a loan to help her buy what she needs and to expand her business.

loans.use: to improve her shop and buy fabric, yarn, and tools.

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en:
Nawale is a 45-year-old married woman living with her three children.  One of them is still attending school.

Her husband has worked in the agriculture field for many years after his retirement from the Lebanese Army. Today, in order to pay her child's educational fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to register him with for the coming school year. Her only goal is to see him pursuing his education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees.

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru:
Зеби 62 года. Она проживает в городке Куляб. Народ Куляба славится своим не сравнительным стилем гостеприимства и чувство юмора. Зеби является одним их тех жителей прекрасного городка. Зеби ни одного из своих гостей не оставит голодным и не даст уйти из ее дома без хорошего настроения. 
  Зеби дома занимается шитьем "курпа" и "курча".
   «Курпа» и «курпача» ватные матрасы. «Курпу» используют в качестве одеяло а «курпача» длинные матрасы используется как диваны. Курпу и курпачу дарят невестам как приданное. Теплое время года наступает и начнется сезон свадеб. Зеби хочет воспользоваться моментом и увеличить товарооборот. Она на деньги от кредита приобретет ткани, вату, иголки, нитки и другие швейные принадлежности. Она надеется, что Вы ее поддержите, и Зеби увеличит доход.
texts.en:
Zebi is 62 years old. She lives in Kulob city. Residents of Kulob are famous for their incomparable style of hospitality and sense of humour. Zebi is one of the citizens of this wonderful city. Zebi does not let even one of her guests go hungry, and does not let anyone leave her home in a bad mood. 

Zebi sews 'kurpa' and 'kurcha' at home. 'Kurpa' and 'Kurpacha' are woolen mattresses. 'Kurpa' are used as quilts and 'kurpacha' are long mattresses used like couches. Kurpa and Kurpacha are given to the bride as dowry. It is becoming warm, and the wedding season is beginning. 

Zebi wants to take advantage of the time and increase her turnover. With the money from the loan she will obtain cloths, wool, needles, thread, and other sewing supplies. Zebi hopes that you will support her, and that her income will increase.

loans.use: to buy wool, cloth, thread, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 29-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is a housewife, and her husband runs a coffee shop in his town.  He is the main income provider in order to fulfil their family needs.

Because of the difficult living conditions, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to pay her children's educational fees. This is the second time that she has sought Kiva’s support to pay school fees, and she is very happy because she will be able to register her children for the coming school year.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Fe has been in this business for 51 years now.

Fe requested a 23,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Paul David is 16 years old and is 4th of eight children in the family. His Mother Edelita supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.


Paul David is studying Bachelor of Secondary Education and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Edelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 to pay for tuition fees of the First semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Paul David plans help her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
A widowed mother of four dependent children living in Kandal province, Khem is 57 years old. For her living, she grows rice as the main source of her income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via working on her co-villager's farm to get a fee. Meanwhile, she has been involved in her business for 37 years. Her rice was destroyed by insects, which produced her a bad yield. 

This is not her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has repaid her past loan completely. With the past loan, she could update her living conditions better than before. Through this loan, she will manage her entire loan to buy a decent motorbike to drive her to work on time. She hopes that she can get more income from her extra work to upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to drive her to work on time.

loans.name: Jambie

texts.en:
Jambie is 26 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jambie runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.
