Jambie has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Jambie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim, age 49, is a mother of six children. Her son owns an embroidery shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. Her son needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money, her son finds it difficult. This loan will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that his mother, Shamim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her son.

He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. Shamim is feeling happy that she will be able to help her son with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her son wanted to increase his embroidery business

loans.name: San Cayetano 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Cayetano 3, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas son mujeres luchadoras  que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias, y que no pasen por necesidades.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Clotilde quien se dedica a la venta de Frutas, Verduras,  es una muy buena vendedora que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar en el pequeño emprendimiento que hace.  Es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha y se está esforzando para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas, y poder continuar de esa forma manera con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella al igual que las demás integrantes esta agradecida por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorar.
En la foto hay 18 personas ya que el grupo tiene 18 integrantes, pero en este ciclo solo 17 de ellas piden este préstamo.
texts.en:
This group is called San Cayetano 3. They are part of the poverty elimination program. They are determined women who want to improve living conditions for their families and themselves and not be in need.

One of the members is Sra. Clotilde who sells fresh fruit and vegetables. She is a very good salesperson who puts her whole self into her small enterprise. She is a very hard-working woman who strives and is making an effort to help her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy fresh fruits and vegetables and be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. Like the other members, she is grateful for the opportunity that they are getting to grow and improve.

In the photograph there are 18 people, since there are 18 people in the group, but in this cycle only 17 of them are asking for the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Peou

texts.en: Peou, 27, is a married man from Kampong Cham province. He has no children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, grows and sells rice and sells rice to the local dealers. So far, he has been involved in this business for around ten years. He is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day, on average.  Recently, some parts of his house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, he has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for his house renovation. He and his family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his house renovation

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Jeralyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Jeralyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Jeralyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock of household goods to sell such as ar, canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 32 years old and married with five children in school. Lenie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, rice, chips, etc.

Lenie has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Lenie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, rice, chips, etc.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina engages in hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs to support her family. To have an additional source of income, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, condiments, soap, cooking oil, shampoo, biscuits, soft drinks, and assorted goods.  

Evangelina is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. Two of her children, aged 10 and 12 years old, are still attending school. 

Evangelina has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy pig feeds, and purchase additional stocks for the store like drinks, and assorted groceries. These will help maintain the content of her store and enable customers to cater to their respective needs. Thus, she could continue finance the schooling of her children and she would be able to provide a better shelter to live with.

In the future, She hopes to expand her sari-sari (variety) store to have bigger spaces that could cater to the high number of customers  in her community and to  live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds,  and purchase additional stocks for the store like drinks,  and assorted groceries

loans.name: Grupo Guineales San Carlos Group

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador, entusiasta, competitivo que se esmera por darle lo mejor a su familia, él  tiene 29 años  de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de la Aldea Guiniales.
Carlos(el primero del lado izquierdo de la foto) desde hace cuatro años tomo la iniciativa de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ropa típica, el escogió esta actividad, porque en el lugar donde él vive mucha gente utiliza el traje típico por lo que este tipo de negocio para él es muy rentable, aunque él sea, solo un vender ambulante porque no cuenta con un puesto fijo donde poder vender, esto no le impide a Carlos tener la iniciativa de prosperar, y ahora ha logrado alcanzar una buena fama en su comunidad, como uno de los vendedores que ofrece un producto de buena calidad y esto lo ha beneficiado  a él, y para poder seguir mejorando su negocio, él tiene ahora la motivación de solicitar un préstamo para comprar más productos de la línea de ropa como: güipiles, cortes y fajas.
Carlos sueña con poder algún día contar con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hardworking, enthusiastic, competive man who takes great pains to give his family the best. He is 29 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings in a community in the town of Guiniales.

Carlos (first on the left in the photo) took the initiative four years ago to buy and sell typical clothing. He chose this activity because many people in the place where he lives wear typical clothing. This type of business is very profitable for him.

Although he is only a street vendor with no fixed stand from which to sell, this has not prevented Carlos from taking the initiative to prosper. Now he has a good reputation in the community as one of the vendors that offers a good quality product and this has benefited him.

To continue improving his business he now has the motivation to ask for a loan to buy more products from the clothing line such as traditional hand woven blouses, skirts, and belts. 

Carlos dreams of having a facility some day where he can best exhibit his proucts and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing products such as traditional woven blouses, skirts, and belts.

loans.name: Hair Product Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of Hair Product Solidarity Group which is made up of four members.  All four members including Aminata are engaged in petty trading but selling different products. 

Aminata who is 27 years old was unanimously appointed to lead the group.  She sells different types of hair products, men’s t-shirts, etc. Aminata has been selling for the past two years. She uses proceeds from her business to provide livelihood for her family.

Aminata and other group members of Hair Product Solidarity are requesting for their first loan with a total of 4,000,000 SLL. From this amount, Aminata will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to purchase more than 80 t-shirts and dozens of shoes for her business. Aminata is in the right of the photo.

Aminata is single and hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. Aminata hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family.

Aminata and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more than 80 t-shirts and dozens of shoes.

loans.name: Maritza Antonia

texts.es: Maritza de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de tortas, hot dog y hamburguesas desde hace varios años e inicio con capital propio,tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus alimentos como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, salchichas, entre otros ingredientes y poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en: Maritza is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. She has been selling sandwiches, hot dogs, and hamburgers for many years, and got started with her own money. She has a very good clientele because she sells her food at a good price. With the earnings she makes from her business, she covers household expenses. She is requesting a loan to enable her to purchase everything she needs to make her food, such as bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, cold cuts, sausages, and other ingredients. Then she'll be able to have higher profits and continue helping her family with the expenses that come up.

loans.use: to purchase bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, cold cuts, sausages, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Vilma de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 7 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y darle a su hija una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma, 40 years old, lives in her own house with her daughter. She has been working selling fruits and vegetables for the past 7 years. Her business is located in the municipal market, and she has many customers. She uses her earnings to get ahead with her daughter. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of more wholesale fruits and vegetables, to be able to continue her sales and give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: for the purchase of wholesale fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Shedrack

texts.en:
Shedrack is 40 years old. He is married and has three children. 

He does farming growing maize, beans and mangoes. He has been farming for 15 years and it has been profitable. 

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

He will use profits from the expanded business to educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are for a high income yielding farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the raw materials to make traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fuel, a spare tire, and grocery items for consumption

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man with 6 children. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of sugar, flour, bread and other items. His business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stocks of sugar, flour, bread and other items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence was appraised as an individual client from a rural fishing site. She is aged 39 years and married with eight children. She does fishing at a fishing site and besides she also does agriculture on a small scale to support her business of fishing. 

She’s looking forward to acquire a loan of UGX2,000,000(Two million shillings only) to increase her working capital so that she can meet her customers' demands but she has a challenge of harsh weather changes especially in the fishing business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is 52 years old and married with three children, one of whom in school, Maricon works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, soap, etc. to sell.

Maricon has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future Maricon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 26 years old, married woman. Her husband (the man shown with her above) operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. Razia 's husband is responsible for building the roofs of houses during their construction. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family. However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. For the growth of her husband's business, Razia  has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow him  to purchase good quality timber, metal and slate so he can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal and slate so she can meet her customers’ demands without any delays

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe 1 Group

texts.en:
Daniel, age 42, is the featured borrower of Yehowa Akwe 1 from Teshie, Accra. He is the one standing to the left in the photo.

Daniel lives with his wife and two children. His wife works as a trader. As the man of the house, Daniel needs to work hard to take care of his family, so he needs a loan to buy phone credit and toiletries which he will sell to his customers. This is his ninth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch and second with Kiva.

Daniel, along with his group members, has requested a total loan amount of 8,200 GHS to purchase phone credit, toiletries, foodstuffs and African wax-prints which they will sell to customers. Daniel will use his share of 3,000 GHS to buy phone credit and toiletries which he will sell to customers. This will enable him to increase the volume of sales, resulting in the rise of his income.

loans.use: To buy phone credit and toiletries which he will sell to customers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Kanakargo Village. Esther joined Babban Gona to expand her  farm and grow her  agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, 

Esther will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Esther now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to build a house/ renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Pearls School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Emily. She is the Head teacher of Pearls Kindergarten School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kasese with 300 students. Pearls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Pearls School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Emily ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Trusted Care School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Elizabeth. She is the Head teacher of Trusted Care Junior School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kasese with 320 students. Trusted Care School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Trusted Care School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Elizabeth ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Nasreen is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 50,000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes to increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 34 year old, hardworking woman who has four children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Bushra ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. She is shown in the photo with her husband who also assists her in work. Bushra has requested for a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 45-year-old, married woman. She has 6 children. Salma is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns by hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. Salma has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time in order to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Salma closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 27-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of 2 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. She also sells milk in her community to raise an extra amount of income. Now, Shazia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money to provide a prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Jalawa Village. Ayuba joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ayuba will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ayuba now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Sesilia, who is in her mid 40s is married with no children.  She has been selling charcoal for three years now.  She works from 09am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Sesilia's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the charcoal stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciate Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to take care of herself and her husband and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.  She dreams of owning a wholesale and a retail shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group  Sisi kwa Sisi which consist of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 30 years old. She is married with five children. 

She has been selling tea in her area for the last 15 years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase more tea leaves and hopes this will help her open another business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are build a strong business which will earn her more money in future.

loans.use: to purchase more tea leaves to help her open another business

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Mujeres Luchadoras se formó en la ciudad de Itá, son 19 mujeres que se esfuerzan por poder trabajar y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas trabajan dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde se destaca la Sra. Olga, una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Olga comenta que se gana la vida haciendo comidas con sus propias manos, y después vende por su barrio y alrededores. Está esforzándose para poder ganarse la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, frutas, hortalizas, condimentos y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Luchadores" was formed in the city of Itá. There are 19 women members who strive to work and help one another. They work within a poverty elimination program, in which Olga stands out. Olga is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.

Olga says that she earns a living making handmade food, which she later sells in and around her neighborhood. She is making an effort to earn a living in a dignified and honest way. She is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, fruits, greens, seasonings, and others, to make her food. She is grateful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to grow and succeed.

loans.use: to purchase food preparation ingredients such as: vegetables, fruits, greens, seasonings, and others.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 36 year old, married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband (who is also shown in the photo). She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has four children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Kilembe S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Augustine. He is the Head teacher of Kilembe S. School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kilembe in Kasese with 1200 students. Kilembe School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kilembe School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Augustine ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a welding business where he offers welding services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of welding materials. His business goal is to own a big welding shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his business.

loans.use: buy more stock of welding materials.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en: Mukhtaran is a 41 year old married woman and a mother of four children. In order to support her husband (also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Waziri Village. Gabriel joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, 

Gabriel will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Gabriel now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort, age 46, is a water vendor in Nsakina, which is a new community within the metropolis of Accra. There is no piped water here, so people depend solely on water from water tanks brought in by water tank operators. Water vendors buy these tanks and sell the water from them to members of the community. 

Comfort and her husband have three children between the ages of 12 and 25 years old.

She will use this loan to buy a larger poly tank than the one she currently has. This will allow her to store more water, which means she will have more water to offer for sale to her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy a poly tank to store water

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry 2 está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delia; quien se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas en su casa, a través de las capacitaciones y charlas ella va mejorando poco a poco.
Ella esta mejorando sus condiciones de vida, y también ayuda a sus seres queridos. Comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos como ser verduras, carnes, y también bebidas para la venta.
texts.en:
The group named "Kuña Katupyry" 2 is in its first cycle of the women's committee. It is a new group, where everyone works and helps out to succeed.

One of the members is Delia, who works selling food and beverages from her house. Through trainings and workshops, she is gradually improving herself. She is improving her living conditions, and is also helping her loved ones. 

She says that she is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to buy vegetables, meat, and also beverages to sell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, and also beverages to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Miguel 2 es un grupo nuevo que se formo en la ciudad de Itá. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mitha; quien a través del esfuerzo, el trabajo continuo y por medio de su despensa viene abriéndose camino y ayuda a su familia.
La Sra. Mitha solicita de este préstamo para la compra de los productos para surtir su negocio como ser harina, aceite, azúcar, leche y productos de panificados. Maneja bien su negocio para que de esa manera también pueda tener mejores  ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Miguel 2 is a new group in the town of Itá. The members are part of a research project aimed at eliminating poverty. One of the members is Sra. Mitha. Through hard work, a steady job, and her grocery store she is leading the way and helping her family.

Mitha is seeking a loan to buy stock such as flour, oil, sugar, milk and bread products. She runs her business well so can expect to have an increased income.

loans.use: buy flour, oil, sugar and bread products

loans.name: Jackilyn

texts.en:
Jackilyn hails from Talibon, Bohol and runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities including canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, soap, chips and  seasonings. She is married with three children, ages 12, 10 and 2. Jackilyn has been engaged in her retail business for more than five years. She needs funds to support her small business and to repair her home.

Jackilyn is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries for the store and to purchase hollow blocks and  steel rods for renovating her house. With the loan, she would meet her customers' needs and purchase materials to make a comfortable home for her family. Then she could better handle her finances and continue to support the schooling of her children.

Jackilyn would like to expand her business so that it is successful and also to create comfortable shelter for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for the store and purchase hollow blocks and steel rods for renovating her house.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 34 years old, married and has three children. 

She is a farmer and has been farming for the last 10 years. 

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to pay for labor and buy storage bags as well as fertilizer. 

She will use profits from the expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hope for the future is to have a stable family.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy storage bags as well as fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married mother of four children, three in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, Mwanatumu has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Makwaron Village. Garba  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Garba  suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Garba  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to (USD) $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Garba will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With an ambitious goal of harvesting 35 bags of maize this year, Garba  can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand and improve her business by buying the fast moving fruits.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 37 years old, married and has three children. 

She operates a green grocery and has been in business for 15 years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables for resale. 

She will use profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hope for the future is to have a financially stable business and family.

loans.use: to buy carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carpentry tools

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a Kiva borrower who has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. Virginia has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive location and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy beauty products for salon use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 62 years old. He is married and he and his spouse have two children. He is a farmer growing mangoes and has been farming for 18 years. 

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to pay school fees as well as to expand his farming business through the purchase of fertilizer. 

He will use profits from his expanded business to support his family. His hope and dream for the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to pay school fees as well as to expand his farming business through the purchase of fertilizer.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a Kiva borrower. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be strong and God fearing. He operates a motorcycle transport business which he has been involved in for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain season which affects business. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lucila has been in this business for 3 years. Lucila earns more income from general store.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire labour to make bricks

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married with six school going children. They live at their own house that  neither has electricity  nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Kituku

texts.en:
Kituku is 38 years old, married and has two children. 

He sells plastic ware and has been in business for 20 years. 

This is his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy plastic basins and buckets for sale. 

He will use profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children. 

His hope for the future is to expand his business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy plastic basins and buckets.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 26 years old. He is single and has no children. He has had a cyber cafe business for two years. He also offers printing and photocopying services and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to buy stationery materials like printing papers, files and envelopes and hopes this will enable him to serve more clients and make more income to buy another photocopier machine. His hopes for the future are to expand his business, make more income and build a house.

loans.use: To buy stationery materials like printing papers, files and envelopes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sugar, soaps, salt and juice for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shirts to sell.

loans.name: Desire

texts.en:
Desire is a farmer who makes his living from agriculture, especially potato growing. He does this in the village where he lives.

Because he is a responsible person, Desire has achieved prosperity in life. For Desire, farming is good as it generates profit, although not enough to be able to sow more crops. This is why he is seeking a loan of UGX 2,500,000 that he will invest in the purchase of agricultural consumables for his next crop.

Desire's dream is to generate more income on a daily basis to be able to redesign his house and improve his family's living conditions. He appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Popote

texts.en:
Popote is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

Popote decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.en:
Ivonne is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Shughuli

texts.en:
Shughuli is a married woman of three children she owns a house that has piped water and electricity.Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Shughuli has operated a tailoring business for the past seven years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of starting a business of supplying water. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy biscuits, cup cakes, bottled water and mangoes

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Chiroma Village. Gabriel  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Gabriel  suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to pay for his children's school fees. 

Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Gabriel  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 18 bags of maize this year, Gabriel can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Pasquilina

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Pascquilina, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013 and has been trained on enterprise and financial management. She grows crops i.e. maize, beans and green grams alongside goat rearing.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more goats to boost her goats enterprise. She is looking forward to an improved income which will enable her pay school fees for her children as well as provide better meals to her family.

She is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay back well.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale thus earn more income and be able to provide better meals for her family

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una luchando por poder mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vicenta quien vende remedios naturales, comenta que por medio de su trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Vicenta es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Vicenta pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para poder vender, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad de poder seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Trabajadoras is currently in its second loan cycle of the women's communal bank program.  They are also part of the Poverty Stoplight program and each one of them striving to do better.

One of the members is Vicenta, who sells natural medicines. She talks about how through her work, she makes a living in a dignified and honest way. Vicenta is a hard working woman who wants to progress in order to continue helping her family.

Vicenta is requesting this loan to purchase natural medicines for resale, and that way continue the work she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity to continue improving her income.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines for resale.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Monte Ramos La Familia Group

texts.es:
Heidy es una joven de 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive muy feliz mente con sus padres y hermanos, ellos  viven en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Heidy (la que se ubica en medio de las tres de blusa rosado) se caracteriza por su simpatía, amabilidad y entusiasmo, ella para darle lo mejor a su familia y no parezcan de necesidades desde hace tres años tomo la iniciativa de dedicarse a la compra y venta de abarrotes, pues en la comunidad donde ella vive no se encuentran muchas tiendas y esto le permitió a ella a brindar a sus vecinos un mejor servicio. Heidy desde hace algún  tiempo se avisto a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo, porque deberá surtir mejor su tienda para satisfacer  las necesidades de los clientes a raíz de esta necesidad ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos de abarrotes como: arroz, aceite, golosinas y refrescos.
El gran sueño de Heidy es que su negocio crezca para poder instalar otra tienda uno de los puntos céntricos de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Heidy is a young woman of 20 years of age. She is single and lives happily with her parents and siblings. The live in a community in Suchitepéquez. 

Heidy (the one in the middle with the pink shirt) is known for her friendliness, kindness, and enthusiasm. In order to do the best for her family, she began buying and selling groceries 3 years ago. There aren't many stores in the community where she lives and this allowed her to provide her neighbors with better service. 

A while ago, Heidy realized that she needed to apply for a loan because she needs to stock her store better in order to meet the demands of her customers. Due to this need, she is requesting a loan to buy grocery products such as rice, oil, snacks, and refreshments.

Heidy's greatest dream is for her business to grow so that she can open another store in one of the central areas of her community.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, oil, snacks, and refreshments.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as trustworthy.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en: Kache is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a marketable place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Wendy Yumila

texts.es: Wendy, tiene 23 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Wendy siempre se ha dedicado al comercio en la venta de ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, vestidos etc.  Este negocio lo realiza desde hace 3 años y vende de manera ambulante y por pedidos. El prestamo es por 10,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar más mercadería de ropa como blusas, jeans, camisetas, faldas  y camisas, con el fin de aumentar el inventario y sus ventas. Su plan es seguir creciendo para seguir ayudando a sus hijos y tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Wendy is 23 years old, she is married, has two children and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  She has always made a living selling clothes, such as pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, etc. She has had this business for three years, both as a street vendor and by taking orders.

The loan is for 10,000 lempiras, which she will use to purchase more clothing merchandise such as blouses, jeans, t-shirts, skirts and shirts, in order to increase her inventory as well as her sales. Her plan is to continue growing so she can continue helping her children and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing merchandise such as blouses, jeans, t shirts, skirts and shirts, for resale.

loans.name: Yasmira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yasmira es una mujer de 35 años de edad, residente del municipio de cerete, una zona forestal, donde priman actividades agrícolas.

Yasmira vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos, dos de ellos adolescentes y el menor que tan solo tiene 1 año de edad, Ella siempre se ha desempeñado como ama de casa, realizando labores domésticas y cuidando a sus muchachos.

La falta de dinero en su hogar la llevo a buscar alternativas para generar recursos y en base a sus conocimientos que adquirió de niña de sus padres monto un negocio de venta de pollos y huevos, con el que ha mejorado las condiciones de su hogar.

Yasmira solicita un apoyo financiero para la compra de pollos, gallinas, huevos, desea aumentar la cantidad de animales, para mejorar sus ventas.

El préstamo le permitirá ser competitiva y luchar por sus deseos de pagar la educación de sus hijos y seguir mejorando día a día las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yasmira is a 35 year old woman. She is a resident of Cerete, a forested area where agriculture is the primary activity.

Yasmira lives with her partner and three children. Two of the children are adolescents, and the youngest is only one year old. She has always had the role of stay-at-home mother, doing domestic work and caring for her kids.

The lack of money in her household has led her to seek alternatives to generate income. Based on knowledge that she learned from her parents when she was a child, she started a business selling chickens and eggs. This has improved the conditions in her home.

Yasmira is asking for a loan for the purchase of chickens, hens, and eggs. She wishes to increase the quantity of animals, in order to improve her sales.

The loan will allow her to be competitive, and to fight for her wishes to pay for her children's education and to improve her living conditions day after day.

loans.use: for the purchase of chickens, hens, and eggs, to increase the quantity of animals and improve her sales.

loans.name: Bridgit

texts.en:
Bridgit is 31 years old. She is married, and they have two children.

She farms and has been farming for 10 years.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy water tanks and seeds.

She will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her husband, who is going to college.

Her hope and dream for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy water tanks and seeds

loans.name: Silgona

texts.en:
Silgona is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive place. 

This is Silgona's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of chickens. She hopes that in the future she will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy more stock of chickens

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 60 años de edad, humilde, sencilla, que trabaja por gusto, por amor, pro el sostenimiento de su hogar, por salud, ella se dedica a la cría de aves, en un galpón que tiene ubicado en un costado de su hogar.

El dinero que produce es de gran utilidad en su hogar, puesto que vive con su pareja que es mayor y está presentando problemas de salud, ella es muy consciente y solidaria y trata de apoyarla en todo lo que este a su alcance.

Virginia tiene en sus manos una oportunidad de mejorar sus entradas de dinero, pero esto depende del aumento de capacidad en su negocio, es por ello que desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos y alimento, con el claro objetivo de aumentar su capacidad y tener mayor rotación de ventas en el año.
texts.en:
Virginia is a 60 year old woman. She is humble and unassuming. She works for the enjoyment, for love, to maintain her home, and for health. She works breeding poultry in a shed located on one side of her home.

The money that she earns is of great value in her home, because she lives with her partner who is older and is having health problems. She is very aware and supportive and tries to provide support using everything in her power.

Virginia has in her hands an opportunity to improve her earnings, but this depends on her business gaining more capacity. This is why she wishes to apply for a loan to buy chickens and feed, with the clear objective of increasing her capacity and having a better turnover of sales throughout the year.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed, with the clear objective of increasing her capacity and having a better turnover of sales throughout the year.

loans.name: Dora Edilma

texts.es:
Dora es una empresaria de 51 años de edad, dedica a la fabricación de arepas (ver foto), la arepa es uno de los productos más tradicionales de la región Antioqueña de diario consumo.
Dora realiza todo el proceso en la cocina de su hogar; la cocción del maíz, molerlo, darle forma y someterlo a calentamiento para tener la forma final de la arepa.
Este negocio junto con la actividad que realiza su esposo, representan las entradas de dinero en el hogar de Dora el cual lo terminan de completar 4 hijos.
Fabricar Arepas es un proceso bastante tedioso y de mucho desgate, el proceso que más lleva tiempo y energía es moler el maíz y ya que tiene una máquina manual, la idea es conseguir una eléctrica, que le ayudara a agilizar su proceso y reducir esfuerzo, por ello desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de este aparato eléctrico y maíz en grandes cantidades para seguir con su noble profesión de fabricar arepas, con la cual ha aportado para el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Dora is a 51 year old entrepreneur. She makes "arepas" for a living (see photo). The "arepa" is one of the more traditional products in the Antioqueña region that is consumed daily.

Dora does the entire process in her home kitchen: cooking the corn, grinding it, shaping it, and subjecting it to heat to have the final form of the "arepa".

This business together with the activity performed by her husband represents the money coming into her home, for them and their four children.

Making "arepas" is quite a tedious process and is very tiring. The process that takes more time and energy is grinding corn because she has a manual machine. Her idea is to get a powered machine, which will help expedite the process and reduce her effort. For this reason she is requesting a loan to pay for this machine and corn in bulk so she can continue her noble profession making "arepas", which has contributed to the improvement of living conditions at home.

loans.use: to purchase an electric grinding machine to reduce her efforts

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 12 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même village qui ont de bonnes relations qui s'activent dans le commerce et l'embouche.  
PENDA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de  53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 5 enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter de l'arachide, du mil. Elle va acheter parallèlement un mouton. Elle achète 60 kilogrammes d'arachide à 36 000 FCFA et 5 kilogrammes de niébé à 2500 FCFA qu'elle va semer.La récolte de l'arachide va lui permettre de produire de l'huile d'arachide qu'elle revend le litre à 700 FCFA. Elle revend aussi le niébé après sa récolte.  Avec le reste du prêt elle fait un apport personnel et achète un mouton à 15 000 FCFA qu'elle va élevè et revendre à 25 000 FCFA.
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre de construire une chambre, subvenir à ses besoins personnels et familiaux.
texts.en:
This groups consists of 28 members and is part of a banc villageois which was created on 12 December 2009. It brings together women from the same village who have good relationships and who are active in commerce and the fattening of animals.

Penda, standing on the right of the photo with her left hand raised, is 53 years old. She is married and has five children: two boys and three girls.

After receiving the loan, she is going to buy peanuts, millet and a sheep. She will buy 60 kg of peanuts for 36,000 CFA francs and 5 kg of cowpeas for 2,500 CFA francs which she will sow. The peanut harvest will enable her to produce peanut oil which she will sell at 700 CFA francs per liter. She will also resell the cowpeas after harvesting. With the rest of the loan she will make a personal investment and buy a sheep for 15 000 CFA francs, which she will raise and resell for 25 000 CFA francs.

The profits will enable her to build a room and meet the needs of herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, cowpeas and a sheep

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en:
Agneta is 42 years old. She is married, and they have four children.

She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for three years.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stocks of sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, and other items for sale.

With the anticipated profits, Agneta will be able to educate her children.

Her hope and dream for the future is to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Konene

texts.en: Konene is 33 years old. He is married with two children. He does livestock trading and has been in this business for thirteen years. He will be using the loan to buy more cattle for rearing and hopes this will enable him to have enough livestock to sell and make more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for rearing, which he hopes will enable him to have enough livestock to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought which affects the availability of animal feeds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy another cow. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a successful agriculturalist carrying out poultry farming and banana growing. These businesses have seen her improve her standard of living and also progress in her coffee and milk production. Being a single parent, Sarah is determined to educate her children and engages in various businesses so as to have several sources of income to support her children.

Sarah is requesting a loan to mulch, weed and prune her banana plantation.

Sarah meets a hardship of price fluctuations of agriculture products, which affects her expected returns.

loans.use: to mulch, weed and prune her banana plantation.

loans.name: Lilia Janelys

texts.es:
Lilia es una joven de 26 años de edad residente de la zona de turbo, un lugar caracterizado por sus agricultores bananeros. Lilia por el contrario quiso romper los estigmas y la cotidianidad montando un negocio de servicios como lo es un salón de belleza.
 
Lilia desde que iba a cumplir la mayoridad de edad en Colombia (23 años), mostro sus ganas de volverse independiente y por ello sin temor al futuro montó su salón de belleza a comienzos del año 2008.

Todos estos esfuerzos, largos días de trabajo tienen un fin, un motivo y es que Lilia desea lograr a toda costa y pro métodos honrados comprar una vivienda, se sueña con vivir en su propia casa, tener una pareja y formar una familia.

Los altos costos de los productos, lo difícil que es conseguir algunos insumos de salón de belleza en turbo hacen que empresarios como Lilia tenga dificultades, es por ello que ella, acude a un apoyo financiero para la compra de tinturas, tratamientos, gel, barnice, entre otros productos para abastecer su salón de belleza, teniendo en cuenta que le gusta tener mercancía a la venta para la comodidad de sus usuarios.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 26-year-old young woman, resident of the Turbo zone, a place characterized by its banana farmers. Lilia, on the other hand, wanted to break the stigmas and the daily life, setting up a service business like a beauty salon.

Lilia, since she was approaching the age of majority in Colombia (23 years old), she showed a desire to become independent and for this, without fear of the future, established a beauty salon at the beginning of 2008.

All of these efforts and long days of work without end had one motivation, which is that Lilia wants to manage at all costs and by honest means to purchase a house. She dreams of living in her own house, having a partner, and forming a family. 

The high costs of the products, the challenge it is to get some beauty salon supplies in Turbo makes entrepreneurs like Lilia have some problems, for this she asks for a loan to purchase dyes, treatments, gel, nail polish, and other products to stock her beauty salon, bearing in mind that she likes to have merchandise to sell for the comfort of the users.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, treatments, gel, nail polish and other products to stock her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanajuma has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Seny's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 23 Décembre 2014 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Le banc villageois est composé de femmes désireux d’améliorer leurs conditions d’existence à travers  des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Seny (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04  enfants. Âgée de 24 ans, elle s’active dans la transformation et la vente de patte d’arachide.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs d’arachide à 11000f pour la transformer en patte d’arachide et le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de diversifier et développer  son commerce et prendre en charges ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created the 23rd of December, 2014, on the occasion of its inception. The 'banc villageois' is made up of women who wish to improve their living conditions through revenue-generating businesses. They have lived in the same village for several decades and maintain relationships of solidarity and mutual assistance. They are involved in small business.


Madame Seny (seated at the far right with her left hand raised) is the featured loan recipient of the group. She is married and a mother of 4 children. She is 24 years old and is active in peanut butter sales.

With her new loan, she plans to buy 3 sacks of peanuts (at 11,000f) to make into peanut butter to sell retail.

The profits will allow her to diversify and to develop her business as well as to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of peanuts (at 11,000f) to make into peanut butter and sell retail.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, a married father of five, describes himself as focused. He has been operating a motorcycle transport service for 10 years. His primary customers are individuals. 

Benson will use this Kes 30,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, his previous one fully repaid. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell, such as oranges, mangoes and sweet bananas.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 63 años de edad la cual a tenido que sortear y superar difíciles retos que se le han presentado a lo largo de su vida, uno de ellos fue la separación con su esposo, un golpe moral que la afecto y que sigue superando ya que formo parte de su vida.

Ya que victoria no tiene hijos, fue inteligente y monto un  negocio de venta de mercancía y ropa, un negocio que montó persiguen un sueño que era comprar una vivienda propia y ahora a pesar de que tiene que acarrear con todos los gastos de un hogar, no renuncia a su sueño y desea vivir lo que le reste de vida en una vivienda propia.

Victoria en el momento necesita capital, la razón es que quiere surtir su negocio con productos de aseo personal y surtir nuevas tendencias en ropa, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para abastecer su almacén el cual le sirve para pagar todas sus deudas.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 63-year-old woman who has had to deal with and overcome difficult challenges which have come up over her lifetime. One of them was the separation from her husband, a moral blow that affected her and which she continues to overcome since he was a part of her life.

Since Victoria doesn't have children, she was intelligent and established a business selling merchandise and clothing, a business that she undertook pursuing a dream which was to purchase her own house and now, despite having to bear all the expenses of a home, she doesn't give up on her dream and she wants to live the rest of her life in her own house.  

Victoria now needs capital, the reason is that she wants to stock her business with personal care products and stock her clothing fashions, for this she asks for a loan to stock her store which serves to pay all of her debts.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products and stock new clothing fashions.

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha, from Kyabasita, is 30 years old, married and a father of five. He began commercial farming in 1998, growing bananas and coffee. The dry season is his major challenge.

Twaha has requested a loan of UGX3,000,000 to buy organic manure to spread on his coffee plantations, a purchase that will boost his yields and output.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, a single mother of two, describes herself as ambitious. For two years she has been operating a retail business, located in a competitive area, that sells clothes. Her biggest challenge is transportation. 

Alice will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, her previous one fully repaid.

Alice's  goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Rosiris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosiris es una empresaria de 35 años de edad la cual se dedica a producir alimentos, para ser más acepto vende arepas con quesito, con carne y hogado (el hogado es un aderezo que se hace con tomate y cebolla).
Inicio este negocio por necesidad económica ya que busca brindar una mejor calidad de vida y oportunidades de estudio a sus 4 hijos los cuales no superan ninguno los 10 años de edad.

Rosiris viene de un hogar donde han faltado recursos pero ella quiere cambiar esa realidad de su familia y por ello se enorgullece de su trabajo ya que paso a paso va logrando su objetivo y dando ejemplo a sus hijos que los sueños se pueden cumplir.

Rosisir en el momento se encuentra en etapa de crecimiento y no quiere detenerse por la falta de capital, es por ello que solicita el apoyo para la compra de insumos para fabricar arepas e ingredientes complementarios, también quiere comprar refrescos.
texts.en:
Rosiris is a 35-year-old entrepreneur who works making foods, to be more precise, she sells arepas with cheese and with meat and hogado (hogado is a sauce that is made with tomato and onion).

She began this business due to economic need since she seeks to offer a better quality of life and schooling opportunities to her 4 children, of whom none is older than 10.

Rosiris comes from a home where they lacked resources but she wants to change this reality of her family and for this she is proud of her work since, step by step, she is achieving her objective and providing her children with an example that their dreams can come true.

Rosiris, at the moment, finds herself in a stage of growth and doesn't want to stop herself with the lack of capital, so she asks for a loan to purchase the supplies to make arepas and the associated ingredients, and she also wants to purchase soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make arepas and associated ingredients, she also wants to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. 

Salome will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Cotton Tree Group

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Aminata. She is married and has three children. Her children all go to school.

Aminata belongs to a solidarity group of four women who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams. “Cotton Tree” is the name of Aminata’s solidarity group.

“Cotton Tree” group needs a total loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Aminata will receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she needs in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil for her business.

Aminata trades in palm oil in a rented shop right in the city centre of Freetown. Her business, which has been in existence for over 15 years, is the main source of her and her family's livelihood, and it supports her children’s education.

Aminata is a hardworking woman. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week, from 7 am to 6 pm. See Aminata on the left of the group picture.

In the future, Aminata plans to support her children to acquire a university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman. She will be very appreciative to anyone who can help. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Alba Nery

texts.es:
Tener un buen futuro, no pasar necesidades, llevar el alimento diario al hogar es una obligación que todo padre tiene, algunos tiene profesión, otros excusas y existe otro grupo Alba, una mujer con mente empresarial que no se dejo vencer por las dificultades y busco una manera de generar recursos y la encontró en el emprendimiento.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y carnes, en la foto podemos ver carteles de los productos que vende, los cuales distribuye desde su casa, Alba es claro de ejemplo que querer es poder y con esta actividad genera el dinero suficiente para el mantenimiento de su hogar conformado por ella, su pareja y 5 hijos.

Ahora Alba con la mente de progresar de ampliarse, solicita un préstamo para la compra de una nevera para albergar mayor cantidad de carnes, compra de productos como vegetales y carnes para la distribución.
texts.en:
To have a good future, to not lack for anything, and to bring food to the home daily is an obligation that every parent has. Some have a profession, others have excuses and there is another group - Alba - a woman with an entrepreneurial mind who doesn't let herself be beaten by difficulties and sought a way to generate income and found it in entrepreneurship. 

She works selling vegetables and meat. In the photo, one can see the posters of the products she sells, which she distributes from her house. Alba is clearly an example of desire is ability and with this activity she generates sufficient money to support her household made up of herself, her partner and 5 children.

Now Alba, with a mind on progressing and expanding, asks for a loan to purchase a cooler to store a larger quantity of meat, and purchase products such as vegetables and meats for distribution.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler to store a larger quantity of meats, and to purchase products such as vegetables.
